The room didn't have a view, it looked out onto some sort of concrete pad where something was being built or pulled down - 5 years ago. We could see another hotels pool, that was comforting. We didn't have breakfast included but also didn't buy breakfast there. Given the total lack of decent coffee anywhere (and a try hard coffee costs USD $6.50) we probably should have gone the breakfast and coffee. The room was just OK, the location is very convenient. ABC (like 7/11) store almost next door for quick but expensive snacks and beer. The guy who checked us in was a bit arrogant without need to be and that set the tone of the stay.Car parking is extra $25 USD / day and when you get your bill at the end there is an $ 18 USD / day environmental levy or some levy I wasn't told about.No milk in the room, some coffee and tea and a bag of something which looked like nuts. Fridge noisy. Air Con very noisy. Shower old. No bathroom door, only shower / toilet room door.

This hotel was part of a vacation package we booked and was included. We spent two nights here. The staff was great. Our room was very clean. It is an older hotel, but they had newer towels and linens and the decor was nice. It wasn’t fancy but it suited everything we needed for a stay. The AC worked really well too! We had the breakfast at the restaurant. It was good, it’s a standard buffet and had all the necessities-pastries, toast, oatmeal, eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, and either French toast or pancakes as well as Hawaiian specialities. It filled us up just fine. Our only negative experience at this hotel was with the concierge. We wanted to book a horseback riding experience for the next day and she told us that there wouldn’t be anything available that last minute. Well I called the place directly and they did have availability. She didn’t even look, so why have someone there to offer to help book activities.

Flight from Vancouver Canada to Honolulu. From the airport $32.00 US cab ride right to entrance. Fabulous price and location! Arrived a little before check in time which is 3 pm. Room was ready, if not, they will store luggage.Rooms are clean, beds comfy. A bit dated but just fine. Heard a few buses in the morning outside but had to get up and get going anyway. Amazing breakfast buffet and two for one coupon - so all in $16.70 US!Half a block to Duke Statue at the beach ,shops and Waikiki Walkway!Beach towels available so went to the beach and enjoyed a long afternoon swim at one of the best beaches in the world so close from this location. We were on the 5 floor so had a peels boo view of the water. Used Avion Points. Higher up floors perhaps a bit better view.Would return due to such an enjoyable stay.Warm welcome from Kenneth and reception.Gorgeous lobby, stained glass windows and gorgeous Christma decor.Thank you!

We went to Hawaii to celebrate my 30th Birthday. Had a great time! Each day we had an event planned except the morning and afternoon of the my actual birthday. I went to the front counter to ask about locations to visit in the Island for a reasonable amount of time. The Representative Brandon was the man for the job. He was excellent in mapping the entire route, timing, each location how to spend the day site seeing. My girlfriend and I were very pleased. Branden you are the Man!!!! My favorite part was the place I got to eat at on the North Shore

Stayed st Waikiki resort hotel for 12 nights in November. Had a room with an ocean view which had a small balcony. Location was superb however the rooms are a little bit dated which didn’t worry me for the price I was paying. Staff were excellent and would definitely stay here again

Our stay was good and the staff were friendly, however the shower leaked into the bedroom and soaked the carpet and when we told housekeeping they said they knew about the issue and the carpet would dry. They didn't offer to swap us into a different room or another so that was a bit disappointing.

A wonderful hotel and really thoughtful staff made my stay absolutely heaven!! Loved everything about this hotel, location perfect, super comfy rooms, but most of all excellent staff who all go above and beyond to make the guests feel special and spoiled. Especially Brandon at the front desk!! Cannot wait to come back, hopefully it will be a Christmas present to myself to stay here again!!

Good location 1 block so 1 min walk to Waikiki beach and also a McDonald's. Comfortable hotel. Pool area small but nice. Breakfast v gd and staff friendly and helpful. Room bit small but fine. Wifi good. Shower good. Very nice stay.

This hotel is great. The service is excellent and the staff are so pleasant and efficient. The rooms are comfortable. You can watch DVD 's free and they have current releases. We were 1 block from Waikiki beach.

This is a great hotel set one block from main beach, walking distance to amenities and restaurants. Dave at the desk was a gentleman and nothing was too hard. Thank Dave. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Waikiki.

We enjoyed staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. The front office staff were friendly and efficient. The room was reasonably large and clean. The location is excellent.....walking distance to amenities and restaurants. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Waikiki.

A nice but little bit dated hotel set one block from main beach right on the edge of the busy district of Waikiki. Hotel has all that is required for a good stay but negatives were - street noise throughout the night (due to construction work mainly), the TV being in some Asian language not English, and the bed not being of a standard I am used to. Major positives were Dennis the Bell Boy, service of the staff generally and the price/location ratio.

Room is clean, service is good. my best part is the location where i can go to the beach, shopping, eating out day or night. lot of fun. close to International Market Place that is the most beautiful shopping center in the world.

Our stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel was wonderful! The staff was friendly and professional, check in was fast and efficient, and the room was incredible! We had a amazing view and the beds are the most comfortable! Will definitely be back!...Mahalo!!

Awesome hotel, with friendly, helpful staff. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to most everything you'll need, but if you do rent a car, there is plenty of parking. Great breakfast buffet. Really enjoyed our ocean view room. Will definitely be back!

My Trip was Epic!!!!! Thank you so much it was great location, view, comfortable room and friendly staff. I will definately recomend and stay again. I love the location and the stain glass windowm the employees were super friendly without being fake wich was really great!

Clean hotel Near beach, city bus nearby, no need for car. Near shopping and restaurants.Rooms showing a bit of wear. THE BEDwas clean and comfortable.staff was friendly and professional. Nice pool area but sun only from 10am-1130am and1pm-4pm.

Great location, only 2mins walk to Waikiki beach, excellent value for money. Service was great as well. However, the hotel needs an upgrade. Buffet breakfast was average..limited choice and variety. Guests staying over more than 3 days will get bored with the breakfast

I wish the 'door's to the rooms were quieter. When someone came to their room at 3am we were all awake. Have sign to put on the door to 'clean room please'. enjoyed the pool area and it was nice to receive clean towels for the pool.

We stayed at this resort from the 19th-27th Oct. We arrived quite late due to flights however this was not a problem and was given our room straight away. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we needed a cot sending up to our room and they did this very quickly. The pool was a good size however could at times be very cold due to lack of sun light. The room we were in was a good size with a safe and fridge in the room, The cleaning staff quick and very friendly. On check in they took our card and placed a hold, this did not come off for a few days after our departure, so looked like we had been billed twice however the staff were quick to explain this. over all a very good stay if you are on a budget and not wanting to stay at high end places and prices.

Thank you Waikiki Resort Hotel staff. You all made our stay safe and comfortable. With the issue of another guest, all staff worked hard to make sure our stay was a pleasant one. I am returning at the beginning of Feb and will surely be looking to book a room there again.

We stayed in the ocean view rooms- ocean view was bwtween buildings but was nice.Front desk staff was nice.The “bathtub” was a shower with a deep basin.Wished they just put more than three pillows on each bed.The amenities fee was a bit much for not much. I would stay here again because of location, clean rooms, and friendly service.

we do like the location and the service was excellent, we enjoy our staining and the convenience for the saving luggage it was great. hopefully we will be back soon and we will consider to stay again there

The hotel was fantastic!. Great location, really nicely presented and we could really relax here. Everything was neat and tidy which is all that you should ask for. The included breakfast as part of the deal was really handy, not to mentioned really nice in the morning - love the bacon!!

I love this hotel! It's been a long time since I've stayed at a hotel that doesn't just cater to the tourists. Waikiki Resort hotel makes Kamaaina really feel special. I almost hate to spread the word about how fantastic this hotel is because it's such a gem! The prices are affordable for a family staycation, the rooms are clean, the breakfast buffet is simple and just what you need to get your day started and the staff is always so friendly and accommodating. The walk to the beach, Waikiki strip and the International Marketplace is so close! We even walked to Sansei! We'll always choose Waikiki Resort Hotel for our mini staycations!

Waikiki Resort Hotel,Lets see 1 block to Waikiki,Free breckfast ,Free coffee to go.Baggage up to our room in about 2 min.Printed our bording pass in lobby;Lobby guy got us back to the air port. Lets!!!!! go again.

Great room, excellent service. View from balcony was amazing. Would recommend this place to those wanting great service and excellent location to downtown activities. So close to the main beach, use of free towels from housekeeping is a additional bonus!

I almost hate to give this review in fear that everyone will start going to this hotel! However, I feel that I must give an honest review with the exceptional service and value that the Waikiki Resort Hotel gives. First and foremost is the location. It's only a block off the beach, and about mid-strip with the 1 min walk to Kalakaua Ave. This puts everything in Waikiki in walking distance. Second, I love that they have self parking. I mean I love Waikiki and all, but I spend a lot of time coming back and forth to different parts of the island. And honestly, valet parking is a hassle when you are in and out of the car. I have stayed here three times when visiting Oahu, and been treated with nothing but aloha every time. The staff is great, the location is AWESOME, and I love the amenities. For the price, you can not beat the value of this hotel. I will continue to come back to the Waikiki Resort Hotel.

I am very pleased that the hotel is comfortable this vacation.I will stay at Waikiki Resort next time.The front managers were so kind.It was convenient in Waikiki Beach and the price was low. The swimming pool was a little too slow, but I'm still satisfied.음성듣기음성듣기

Highly recommend - we really enjoyed our stay here. Located within a short five min walk of the main strip for restaurants and shops, ABC store on the corner and quick one min walk to the central beach. Big thank you to Brendan at front desk for giving us an upgrade to the Penthouse Suite which was AMAZING and made us not want to leave our rooms. All the staff were ever so helpful providing tips and local advice and are rooms were cleaned very well each day.

The staff were very helpful, and the location is fantastic. The hotel has seen better days but it’s fine for what you pay.The photos they use to advertise the Ocean View are cleverly taken. It looks like you can dip your toe in the water, but in reality you are quite far away.WiFi was awful.

Low cost and great location. It's enough to family vacation. Near by waikiki beach and good local stores. Above all they has coin laundry under ground it is very helpful to baby or child including family.

Hotel decor is dated but clean and comfortable and a great location much better placed than hotels twice the price in the shopping area...if you want 2 mins to beach stay here - Nancy on reception was a star - Thank you all the staff for ensuring we had a great stay in Hawaii

I knew it would be a great holiday the minute the receptionist said we could enter our rooms early. The rooms were very comfortable with everything you needed to make your stay comfortable. Breakfast included was wonderful and being so close to the beach was great. Staff were friendly and helpful especially the lovely lady who welcomed us to breakfast each morning.

Lovely location close to the beach. The staff were very friendly and helpful in the restaurant as well. The room was very clean with ample toiletries and towels each day. The only downside was the noise when the room above opened their patio doors. Late at night and early morning this was rather disturbing and woke us on more than one occasion. Apart from that it was perfect.

We just spent seven days at this hotel. It was our second visit and our first time at this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfasts were great and the location is perfect.Would highly recommend this hotel. Only one block to the beach.

We stayed for 4 days. Easy walk to the beach, where you can hire an umbrella and two lounges - $25 for two hours. Our room was good, comfortable bed, wall safe, wifi in room. Good selection of hot and cold food for breakfast. Self service laundry, car parking - $25 per day. Everything you need at an affordable price. It was our Wedding Anniversary, our daughter rang to tell them, and the hotel surprised us with a bottle of bubbles and some cookies, much appreciated. We will stay here again.

We stayed 9 nights here with three adults and one 3 year old. We enjoyed our stay immensely. Breakfast was included, and there was sufficient variety. The walk to the beach is about 2 minutes, which was amazing. It’s not a 5-star resort, but it’s definitely a good 3.5-star place. Rooms are clean, and there is no outside noise. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. A great option for those wanting to be close to the beach without spending a ridiculous amount of money on luxury.

We stayed at Waikiki Resort for four days this October. Suzanne was amazing and worked out an early check in for us and a room upgrade. Also, we mentioned that we were travelling for my birthday and Front Office Staff brought a small birthday gift and card to the room. All staff we met in hotel were always caring and thoughtful. It was a pleasure to be so thoroughly cared for.

I am so thankful to have a great time in this hotel. I walk to the beach a few times a day. The room is super clean everyday. And we found that we can lift the head side of the bed to see a wonderful view of sunrise and the beach scene! I want to thank the owner of this hotel because he treated us as honor guests!

I enjoyed my stay. The breakfasts were good. The location was perfect. It was close to the beach and and the zoo. The room were clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly. It was a little pricey though.

My husband and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort as part of our Honeymoon in June. The hotel is in a great location and is one block from Waikiki Beach. The standard city room was a good size, and we did have a small view of the Ocean. It was also exceptionally clean. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel offers beach towels which you can exchange for clean ones every day which is ideal. We also booked direct which included breakfast. It was a good range and the food was really good. We did not eat in the hotel apart from Breakfast but the Korean restaurant always looked busy. There is no bar as such as the hotel, but there are plenty available at other hotels and restaurants are only a stone throw a way. We will definitely stay again if we are lucky enough to go back to Oahu!

After an epic road trip across the mainland via Route 66 it was a pleasant relaxing finale to our trip thanks to the efforts of Branden who took care of our every need whilst at the hotel, in that check in, inquiries and tour information were all handled professionally. Rooms were clean, well appointed, serviced & a comfy' bed, what more could you ask!

Very clean and comfortable room with fabulous view of the beach and Diamond Head.The rate was very reasonable for what we got.Staff were polite, friendly and very helpful. Buffet breakfast was good but the coffee could use some improvement.Overall we were very happy with the hotel and will definitely stay there next time in Waikiki.

We arrived at 7am & the staff were able to mind our bags while we went to the beach. We checked back again about 12.30pm and our room was ready for us. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was good, bed was very comfortable and we had a glimpse of the beach & surf. Booked directly with hotel online which included free breakfasts. Good internet. Organised a wonderful day out on a catamaran snorkelling. Great location being 2 blocks from Duke's statute - buses and trolleys stop there so not far to walk. Would stay here again if we come to Waikiki again.

I cannot express how AMAZING this hotel stay was. We stayed in August 2018 as a celebration for my mums 60th. On arrival, we were greeted at the front desk with big smiles, which was very much appreciated after flying for 15 hours! Brandon and Dave checked us in and then told us due to the special occasion we had been upgraded to the best room the in the hotel, THE PENTHOUSE. We were completely shocked but very grateful. On arrival to the penthouse, we were greeted with a birthday present for my mum, which was another very appreciated touch.The staff continued to surprise use with their helpfulness. A HUGE thank you to both Brandon and Dave as they went out of their way to accommodate us, especially Dave who on his day off went to get use some extra cream from the local store for our tea and bought it in so we did not miss-out on our traditional English tea. The staff again were very helpful as 2 days before the end of our stay the garbage disposal broke and the hotel offered to move us to the next door penthouse free of charge as they fixed the it. They also gave us a complimentary meal at their delicious Korean restaurant for the inconvenience. The service was impeccable and again we cannot thank Brandon and Dave enough for how well they treated us. The hotel room itself was extremely clean and the penthouse had an amazing view of Waikiki beach, which was no more than a 3 minute walk away. The hotel also had a shop where you could by anything from water to beach towels. The pool was extremely clean, peaceful and well maintained. The surrounding area of the hotel had restaurants bars clothes shops all within walking distances. There was also a local bus route that took you around all of the malls and it only cost a few dollars. The bus top was situated just in front of Waikiki beach by the statue of Duke the surfer.All in all we had an amazing time on holiday and the staff at the hotel added to it. They helped us with tours, fixed the garbage disposal efficiently and went out of their way to make our stay memorable. We would definitely stay again.

Excellent location, great facilities and very friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast, shame there was no pool bar or snacks but otherwise a very good hotel. located approx. 200yds from beach and main strip,

As always expected my stay was amazing! It was a perfect little getaway especially on this special trip, linking up with a child hood friend, the night was quite magical. The hotel being close to all of my faves, restaurants, shops and food! Could not ask for another hotel to stay at, the amazing and kind hearted staff exceed beyond my expectations as to what customer service really is about. In fact it feels like seeing a close relative in a while every single time I return. It really is a great accomadation considering there is a breakfast buffet (Ilima) and Korean restaurant (Seoul Jung Inn) near for your convinince if you have not a clue where to eat for breakfast, the view is bright and sun-lit and starts your day off right and the hearty Korean restaurant never fails to fill!

Great hotel facilities, excellent location just one block back from the beach. Nice clean hotel and rooms. Friendly and helpful staff (front desk and room attendants). Was great being able to do our own laundry since we were staying for nearly two weeks. Good breakfast buffet.

I was so well in waikiki resort. All was be perfect and i will recomend to my friends. It wad cleanef near the sea, good atentio by personal specially al front desk. We past so enyoy the four days at your hotel thanks for all.....

Room was not that clean but not that bad.staffs are friendly except breakfast staff.good location for stay. could go many restaurants and shops by walk.parking lot was not enough but not too bad.price are reasonable.

We have visited Oahu 8 times & have chosen to return to the Waikiki Resort Hotel 4 times. It would have been 5 but unfortunately for us they were booked out on one of our trips. Just a block back from the beach the location works perfectly for us. There are rooms with amazing views of the mountains or the Ocean - take your pick. With a bar fridge, microwave, coffee machine & kettle you are somewhat self contained so can cut down on the expense of dining out everyday. However the breakfast in Ilima is sure to carry you through the most arduous day of sight seeing. Top up your plate as many times as you like, & the coffee is bottomless. Great way to start your day. There’s a laundry for guest use, & even a mini market in the foyer so if you need supplies they are easily accessible. The staff are always courteous & eager to help in anyway they can, from the front desk to the house keeping. We will definitely return again & again.

The location is great just one block from the beach. While the rooms are not the most modern looking they were clean and comfortable and the breakfast was a good start to each day. The reasonable rates for the location made for an enjoyable stay.

The location is great, beach is only a short walk away. Generally hotel is a little tied and dated. We arrived late afternoon and reception staff weren’t very friendly. The beds in the room are way too small for 2 people sharing I think they were a king single, they need to buy queen beds very uncomfortable. Cleaning staff were very helpful and rooms were clean but we call reception 3 times to get someone to fix our electricity in bathroom as we couldn’t use the hairdrier or straightener. It is very convenient hotel but need some TLC.
Room clean, Bed OK, Location very good and convenient, Breakfast OK, staff kind, convenient mart open till late night.wish to have Korean Travel agency in the hotel, Hope renovation for TV and Shower

We decided to break the trip from Vancouver to Sydney with two nights in Waikiki and the hotel is in the ideal spot for a swim at the Beach, spot of shopping and close to good food outlets. This is our third time at the hotel and we will stay again. Great location and helpful staff.

Our family reunion was held at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and it was great. Rooms are tidy and comfortable, great facilities and within walking distance to pretty much everything in Waikiki. I recommend this for families travelling on a budget but still wanting a quality place to stay.

I would definitely let others know about this hotel!! We had a great stay. Mahalo for making us feel like Family. Everyone was so very nice & helpful when needed. Will come back again and stay with you

I really have no complaints about this property. Everything was above expectations and well worth the money spent. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean and spacious, and the location was perfect with regards to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, and distance to the ocean.

I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel a very long time ago and when we decided to go to Hawaii now as a couple we decided on the Waikiki Resort Hotel and what a great decision that was. I can't say enough about the staff at the front desk; from check in to check out and some trips to them for advice, everyone was excellent, went above and beyond. We requested a late check out as our flight was leaving late at night and I had been ill, Not a Problem!! Breakfast each day was just what we needed to start our day. Looking forward to returning and will recommend the hotel to our friends.

Excellent location and wonderful staffGreat ammenities and accessible services any hour.Safe for families and children to explore Waikiki and see the beautiful shores which boarder the Island. Would definatley bring my family back to this resort.

Great place to stay in the middle of Waikiki. Lots of restaurants withing walking distance and very central ery save to walk around at night. Only one block to the beack. Lots of ABC shops around . Rooma are airconditioned

My husband stayed here a few nights while visiting family and celebrating our 10 year anniversary. We both agreed that we would definitely stay here again. Not only did we find this hotel to be very clean and the employees very friendly, it was also centrally located. Shopping was all around us and visiting the beach was less than a 5 minute walk. Our room had a partial ocean and partial mountain view which were beautiful whether waking-up in the morning or falling asleep after a busy day. Also...a TIP...we booked directly through the hotel and got free breakfast buffet in the morning, worth $15.99 per person. Saved my husband and I over $95.00 in meals! The only, and mean ONLY thing I would recommend this hotel to do is to extend the size of the bathroom sink. We had a Mini Suite and the sink was a small corner sink with small shelf above it which made it a little difficult to use especially when brushing our teeth. If you can deal with this super small issue I would highly recommend this hotel!

The elephant in the room is that this hotel is a bit dated. Get over that and you will love your stay here. Staff are wonderful. Rooms are comfortable, although the bathroom in our 1 bedroom aptment was smaller than you would get on a cruise ship. Very small, almost unusable basin/vanity in the bathroom. Great intimate bar on lobby floor, with excellent happy hour (6 - 9pm). Korean restaurant was one of the best for food. Great authentic Korean dishes but the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired. We played music from our iphone to get the mood going. Seems the sound system was broken in the restaurant. But dont let that stop you from enjoying the wonderful Korean food. Comfortable room with a good size balcony, microwave, jug, sink etc. Our room backed onto the lifts which were very noisy. Recommend that you have a room removed from them. Great value hotel.

Hotel was nice. Staff very friendly. Bathroom in king room with pull out couch located next to elevator super small and you can hear elevator going up and down, but want horrible. We managed for a week. Pull out couch very uncomfortable and only enough for 1 person.

The hotels staff were friendly and the room was nice and big and it was very clean. Close to the beach. The staff helped accomodate our early arrival and late departure very well. The only downfall was that it was a little noisy on the street outdoors.

The location is excellent. It is close to every thing. I arrived very late after 10pm. The front staff gave me a local map and showed what was available. I booked this hotel for 3 nights. First night was through TripAdvisor on line and 2 nights through Cruise booking. However, only the cruise booking covers breakfast but not Tripadvisor. I clearly remembered that the breakfast was included on the ad when I booked on line. I was little disappointed.

EXcellent in all ways ---nothing was a problem The room and room service was 5 star Pool and Tiki bar were excellent ---great happy hour easily enjoyed Staff could not be better receptive and helpful in all areas

Just a couple blocks to the beach and still in the heart of Waikiki where all the actions and shopping are located. Parking structure is small but we did not have any trouble finding spots. Good, decent stay if you are on a budget. Many food places within walking distance. Air conditioning works almost too well. We got 2 double beds that sleep 4 total. They offer a rollaway but not sure how you can fit. Mini fridge is not stocked and there are a couple of chairs but no couch. Coffee, tea and dvd rental included with resort fee.

Prime location at Waikiki area, easy access to beach and surrounding shops restaurants etc. parking at 25USD/dayBreakfast at 15USD/person less discountDecoration is bit old fashionedRooms were door door next to elevator however when elevator is running you can hear the noise very clear, imagine, the whole night.There is nothing you can do about it but to change your room, and good luck with that!

Really nice hotel, great location with beach and shops only a walk away. Air con was good, elevator was a little loud at first but eventually got used to it. Had a great view of the ocean from our room. Everyone was really nice and helpful.

Excellent part of Waikiki to stay near everything, hotel was great clean friendly .staff very friendly, and helpful , had Breakfast their very good and not expensive with 20% of from hotel when checking in .

Generally the hotel is a little tired and dated. But staff were lovely, rooms comfortable and breakfast was good. The pool area is disappointing. It is a sterile deck with a few chairs, nothing to make you want to spend any time there.Great location close to beach. Walking distance to main shopping area.

Great location, just a short walk to beach and other areas of Waikiki. Bus stop just a block back to get to pearl harbour. Nice quiet pool with sun exposure. Friendly and helpful staff. Would stay again

This hotel is in a terrific location, a short block to the beach and shopping area. We had easy check in and were upgraded by the manager, Branden, because it was our 50th anniversary. Branden was very helpful, friendly and knowledgable of thngs to do in the area.A full breakfast was included. The staff was cheerful and extremely helpful.

My husband and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for 11 nights in August 2018. Checkin - Is normally at 3pm. We arrived at 11am and asked if we could get our room quicker as we were really tired after a long flight. We were told it would be prioritised. We went for out until 1.30pm, room still not ready. Checked again at 2pm to be told that there was a computer glitch and nobody could be checked in. At 2.30pm we were checked in but they couldn't validate any credit cards so were we had to leave our card with them. We went down about 30 minutes later our card was given back.Room - Ocean view room on the 16th floor. Reasonably good view given that the hotel is one block back from the beach. Bathroom is a bit dated and could do with a bit of TLC. The room was clean, comfortable, housekeeping was great, king size bed was quite comfortable and there was an armchair with a footstool plus a desk and chair. Also a Keurig coffee machine - not the best if you are a tea drinker. Good amount of tv channels, wifi was free and pretty good speed (had to connect to other room's wifi though and sometimes got a message saying it was unsecured so I just switched which room I was connected to).Sleep Quality - We were right by the lift which didn't seem to be noisy, but there was a reasonably constant background noise which affected our sleep. Not sure what caused it - the airconditioner? the lift? the wind outside? Sirens from emergency vehicles are easily heard from the 16th floor and some mornings I could hear the trucks loading/unloading/reversing.Location - great location one block back from the beach, 2 minute walk to the beach, a short walk to Duke's Statue to catch the trolleys and cafes/restaurants, the Zoo is close by.Tour desk - We booked 3 tours through the desk which is run by Expedia. Good service but I think we could have got better deals elsewhere.Pool - Very basic on the second floor, was clean and a good temperature. Pool towels are available in the basement and can be taken to the beach.Laundry - Coin operated washing machines and dryers are in the basement/car park. Cost is $2 per load and change is available from reception. Machines did not wash clothes very well.Eating - Cafe for breakfast and lunch and a restaurant for more formal dinners. Also a food truck in the car park, which does quite nice food. We didn't eat at the hotel.They handled the hurricane threat well & kept us informed. Was good value for money, we'd stay again.

The location of this hotel is fantastic. It is just one very small block back from Waikiki beach meaning we would often go back and forth. The hotel itself is clean and professional and overall we enjoyed our stay. If you are after a no frills hotel this is for you, however if you are wanting extras like a stocked mini bar, in room dining etc. this hotel does not provide this. Tip: When they say that you can hear the elevators (mini suite next to elevator) they mean it. It makes a howling sound (like a strong wind). At first I was a little put off however it really did just sound like wind and was very quickly drowned out. I was never woken up by it and found it easy to go to sleep. I would definitely recommend and although I would prefer a real resort next time, budget pending, i would definitely return to this hotel.

Super happy with this hotel! Close to everything and one street back from the ocean front. Very reasonably priced and friendly staff that are very helpful. Short walk to the zoo and about 20 mins walk to Ala Mona shopping centre.

We enjoyed are stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, very clean, Minutes to the beach , A ABC store on every Corner, . But most of all and man to all our needs Branden was such a great help too. THANK YOU

What a lovely place near the beach fantastic and very friendly staff for our first trip to Hawaii thus was a great hotel choice i did find it a little noisy outside and had to put the fo not disturb sign every night as the cleaners come around 9am

We were checked in by Connor, who was very friendly, informative and had a sense of humor. He answered all of our questions and some questions we didn't know to ask. He helped us get our vacation off to a great start! We would have liked a microwave in our room and more than one icemaker in the building. However, overall it was a great experience in a prime location. BTW, we appreciated the free DVD's which guests receive - Paddington 2, who would've known it would be so good!! Sequels are typically a big disappointment.

We enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. The hotel is in a good position, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet was excellent. All the staff were friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Picked this hotel because it was very central and cheap. My room on the 2nd day was leaking water from the air-con. Hotel was very attentive and moved me straight away to another room. They also give you DVD card were you get to rent movies for free at the lobby! and all the major tour companies will pick you up at this hotel which was great. The hotel is only 100m from the beach.

This hotel is situated in an ideal location, perfect for the beach & close to the shops & restaurants. The hotel itself has two restaurants offering different styles of cuisine, both provided good quality food at reasonable prices. Pool area clean & not too crowded. Staff very courteous & helpful. Rooms cleaned daily. Laundry facilities available. Would happily stay here again on a return visit to Waikiki.

Hotel was within a blocks walk to the beach and many restaurants. We booked it due to the price and got what we paid for. Room was very clean but fairly basic. Bit of a strange layout with fridge in the bathroom and no door between bathroom and rest of room. Shower and toilet were in a seperate room.We were on 18th floor with great view. Room was very quiet. We stayed with our 12 year old daughter and booked a roll away for her to sleep on.We had breakfast at hotel only once. It was ok but not good enough to entice us back.We used the pool a couple of times. Wasn't overcrowded. In conclusion hotel was fine but would probably look for something different next time.

2 minutes walking distance to Waikiki beach. Room was comfortable. Included breakfast at Lalima was great. Food selection was good. Would stay here again.Parking garage is tight. Pool is ok. Could use a whirlpool.

location very good walking distance to Waikiki beach and the main road mall and shopping ! the pool no any activity always empty , for tour we buy from the hotel expedia office.litel expensive but we enjoy all the activity.

The hotel is located very close to Waikiki Beach and super convenient. Branden at the front desk was exceptionally helpful and friendly to all our questions and requests, as was Connor. Would stay here again in the future.

Staff is nice and welcoming, we especially received great service from Dennis( lobby). Hotel is nice and close to the beach. The room was clean and not much noise. There are many places to eat and shop near Waikiki Resort Hotel.

We spent a night at the Waikiki Resort Hotel the night before our cruise around the Hawaiian Islands. Just a block away from the beach, the hotel was comfortable, clean, and had two nice restaurants. we were able to see the ocean from our room. We enjoyed dinner at the Korea restaurant and then the buffet breakfast at the main restaurant.

The location was great. Very nearby the beach and good restaurants. The room was pretty clean and the air conditioning was not a problem at all. But the front desk staffs' attitude wasn't very amicable...

Very disappointed in this hotel. This is the only hotel I have stayed in where the staff don’t say hello when you walk through the lobby, friendliness costs nothing. The hotel is very tired, we paid for an ocean view and had a crane blocking the view whilst appreciating this is not the hotels fault they were less than helpful. The lift is noisy at night and kept us awake. Overall the hotel seems to value their Korean visitors at the expense of snyone else, very disappointed. I will menti9n that the cleaners were friendly which is the only positive part of the stay.

There is no denying the location is excellent. But the overall furniture, stuff, styling, atmosphere of the room is very old and small. The kind of room that wants to make you go outside. I would rather pay more and find better place to stay next time I visit Waikiki.

Hotel has great accommodations, pleasant staff, clean room and bathroom, strong wi-if connection and best of all, location is near Waikiki Beach, mall and restaurants. Price is great as well. I booked 6 months in advance and I received a great deal. I will be back.

Stayed here for three nights on the 17th floor. Room was very clean but on the small side. Paid for an ocean view that was minimal at best due to the taller building across the street. Nice location with a nice voucher breakfast. Only other downside was the street noise. Very friendly staff.

The rooms are a bit older and not luxurious. But they are comfortable and the cleaning staff did a fine job. All staff was very pleasant. Rooms have coffee and tea, mp3-compatible clocks/speakers, charging stations, balconies, mini fridges under the sink, and sink/vanity separate from shower/toilet.The location is fantastic! 2 minute walk from the beach, beach rentals, and beach shops. Also a short walk to high end shopping (Jimmy Choo etc.)

My husband and I stayed here for 5 days. Nice place and checking in and checking out was nice and easy! I wasn't really fond of the breakfast in the morning so I gave I this place a four but otherwise, we had fun!

My family loved the quick access to the beach and restaurants. There is a surfboard rental shop next door. Parking underneath was super convenient as well the store located in the lobby for all your snack, beach, or souvenir needs. Would stay again!!

Branden was amazing! We were staying for our honeymoon and we were stuck next to the elevators that kept us up late and early. So he upgraded us to a way better room. You should give him a raise ! He was awesome and gave us excellent customer service !

we stayed in this hotel for 7 days. I requested a two double since there is four of us, without questions asked my request was granted. I was really pleased wtih all the staff, especially Brandon, they were helpful and friendly, they made our stay in hawaii very plesant. I would come here again in our future trip to hawaii.

The room needs more light, new furniture, and a decorative makeover. Appears dingy. AC a bit aged and struggling. Excellent, amenable staff, especially Dave at desk and the male PH housekeeper (forgot his name).

We asked for an early check in but we weren't expecting to be able to access our room at 10:30 in the morning! Well done cleaning team. Located a short distance from Kalakaua Avenue which helps reduce the noise level with low amenity fees and many side benefits.Sadly my virus protection wouldn't allow me to access the free but unsecure wifi.The rooms are well laid out and the bed is comfortable and the rooms higher up actually have sea views. The hotel is used by a lot of air crew so you know it is good.

I loved the Resort and would stay there again! The hotel was all that I wanted myself and family was pleased with the service the cleanliness was great and in a great spot we were so close the beach and easy access everyone was helpful when we needed questions answered.

The hotel was located in a great spot. It was not on the main street but within walking distance to the beach. Nancy checked us in and was super friendly!! She told us where to go to rent a car and other great input in where to go.

This is a great sized hotel, has many extras such as free DVD rentals, beach towels, pool, buffet breakfast and without the crowds so you never have to wait for any of the amenities, lifts, or room make ups etc like you do in the larger resorts.We Appreciated the early check in and later check out without having to haggle.All staff were warm and excellent hosts.Room had coffee machine, breakfast included.Location superb, beach view from our corner suite.Would definitely stay again if we make it back.

From the moment you arrive the checkin staff are friendly and helpful. The Penthouse room was large and included a seperate bedroom, double pull out sofa bed and we requested an additional single (portable) bed. Plenty of room for two adults and two teenage boys. Includes a kitchenette and microwave for those days when you just want to make a quick breakfast or dinner!Location, seriously, 100 steps to the beach! ABC store down stairs...what else do you need?Highly recommend. Will definitely return.

The hotel was very nice. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Branden checked us in and when he found out it was our honeymoon, sent us champagne, cookies and a card to our room. Leo, the bell hop gave us lots of tips on getting around and where to go.

Overall a good hotel. Nice, clean and friendly staff. Great location just a block from the beach and the nice shopping and restaurants. There is a Keurig coffee machine with Kcups in the room which was a nice touch. There is a DVD player in the room and upon check-in they gave us a card for free dvd rentals. We only stayed one night on our way back to the mainland. We were in room XX01 which is right next to the elevator that comes with a king bed and sleeper sofa. This is like a small suite with the sofa is in a separate room with a 2nd TV, that was nice. However this room is right next to the elevator and was noisy, you hear the elevators going up and down constantly. The bathroom sink is so tiny with a tiny counter above it, as small as the ones on airplanes. Have we been staying here more than one night we’d likely asked to switch rooms because of the elevator noise and tiny bathroom sink.

The staff at this hotel were extremely nice and helpful. The rooms are average and the amenities as well. Room was clean. Parking is tight below the hotel but manageable.  Decent bang for your buck though in Waikiki. Staff definitely make the place. Mahalo!

I took 79 High School All State Music students from 10 different states and stayed at The Waikiki Resort Hotel in June 2018. There were no complaints concerning rooms, service, etc, about the hotel,. The management and staff were so accommodating! The front desk guys: Brandon, Dave, and Connor were the best...very helpful!I highly recommend The Waikiki Resort Hotel....great place and location!

I live in Hawai'i and whenever I'm in search of a destination to have a 'staycation' or weekend getaway, Waikiki Resort Hotel has never failed to cross my mind. Every single time I bring my family/friends along, it always ends up being a memorable and eventful time with not one single dull moment for everyone to remember. I had booked a weekend at the Resort and my reservation was obscured in the process and was booked a day before my actual arrival. I arrived on the date not knowing that I did not have a room available for me since the reservation accidentally got pushed back a day. The staff jumped to the situation and helped resolved the problem and was able to rebook me a new room with no charge at all. I must say the short time it took to re-book a room for me was quickly completed within the time it took my family and I to have brunch.The hotel is in an unbeatable area, you are welcome to the pool on the 2nd Floor or take less than 5 minutes to Waikiki Beach to take a dip in the pacific! The location is quite central from a large variety of shopping, restaurants and bars! All of Kalakaua Ave is available to all of your endeavors from shopping at Hawai'i's tiny mom and pop souvenir shops to browsing some of the finest shops in Waikiki! The hotel itself is a wonderful place to stay and the staff really make sure our visits there feel at right at home! Their hospitality make staying there such a welcoming environment for all of their guests to enjoy. Quick to respond to room service requests, very accommodating to many different situations and customer service is just always A+. The cleanliness of the room always exceeds proficiency, the room never has that odd, stale odor that some hotels possess. A great thing about this hotel is it offers many different comfortable and inviting rooms at different affordable rates with the same customer service as a luxury room would. The hotel ranges from many different affordable room rates, featuring their very own array of Waikiki Resort toiletries! These rooms do include In-Room and Lobby high speed internet, as well as a dvd kiosk to borrow at your liking for the entertainment system, we used that to our advantage quite often. The children that travel with us definitely appreciated it when they travel with us. A thousand Mahalo's and Aloha's to the GM Glenn Vergara and family favorite, Brandon, for always creating an ambience filled with Good Vibrations, Aloha Spirit. Glenn has a way of maintaining an all around inviting and captivating experience.

Excellent location close to the beach, the pool wasn’t that great no shade and the scenery around the pool wasn’t nice. The room was ok but the bathroom was super small. The Front desk staff was very nice.

Have just returned from Hawaii having spent 7 nights at this hotel. It is well located being a short walk from Waikiki beach as well as local restaurants and bars. Our room was comfortable, clean and with coffee making facilities. We had been upgraded and had s sea view which was lovely. The buffet breakfast served has a good choice of foods. Staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. On the 2nd floor there is a nice pool and sun lounge area. Beach towels were available free, a nice touch if you wanted to spend the day on the beach. All in all we had a fantastic time in Hawaii and this hotel certainly contributed to that. Would certainly use again if I was to return to Hawaii.

Just spent 4 nights at this hotel, yes its a little dated but who cares, the location was perfect a couple of minutes to the beach, room was spotless and I loved the fact you could have the air con on icy and was nice to have a shower that actually had great pressure. I have stayed at a few hotels in the past but would definitely come back to this one. I was on the 16th floor with an ocean view and it was so quiet at night, was worth paying the extra for the view.

This is the an awesome hotel for its price! First of all the check in is easy and they are friendly! Branden made our check in so easy and even gave us a free pass for breakfast so only one of us had to pay! Second we asked for a room with an ocean view and we got it! Beautiful view and awesome rooms! The lady who cleaned the rooms asked if we wanted it done because we didn’t do it all the time but she wanted to make sure, she was sweet! They have free movies for you to watch they have a pool and breakfast and their location is awesome! ABC stores around the corner and food places! The ocean is a 3 minute walk! We will definitely stay here again on our next visit!

Especially when check-in and check-out,staff was really friendly. Bed making was good. Close to the beach. The room was clean. Free DVD is available.Totally fine. The traffic-noise comes from outsidewhen sleeping.

Would stay again over the 5 star hotels because of the hospitality - Drianne------------------------------Visiting from Sydney, my friends and I stayed at Waikiki Resort for 10 nights in total. We couldn't have picked a better location for everything -- our tour pick-up's were always walking distance (if it wasn't at the hotel), main strip/shops, restaurants and of course, Waikiki Beach! Thanks to Vicky for tending to us on our first day and making sure that the issue concerning our first room was addressed appropriately. Special thanks to David and Dean (sorry, we can't remember everyone else's names) for never failing to give us good recommendations on where we should go for food, activities & events, and for always being down for short talks and laughs whenever we pestered them at the reception -- you guys are the bomb! Thanks for everything! Sophia

We requested a room with a partial view of the ocean...not only did we get this view, but we also had a great view of Diamond Head from our private balcony in addition to being able to watch the surfers every morning. We were so close to the beach and close to bus stops to take us where we wanted to go, and within walking distance of a lot of restaurants, shops, etc. Everyone at the front desk from check-in to check-out was very helpful. One of the gals, Dee, was so kind as to even help us print out our boarding passes (we are in our late 70's and we needed help). The hotel was very clean, the king size bed was comfortable and we had a free daily breakfast buffet and beach towels were provided (no need to pack one). I would highly recommend this hotel and advise staying at this end of the island, as it is so much closer to the beach, the Honolulu Zoo, the Waikiki Aquarium, Diamond Head and Hanauma Bay; thus spending a lot less time traveling by bus or car (no need for a car).

We had a great experience with the Waikiki Resort Hotel! Its in a prime location with only a moments walk to the beach, restaurants & shops, the room was clean & maintained nicely throughout our stay, the buffet breakfast was affordable & the staff were very friendly & helpful. The only thing we were not prepared for (as we're budget conscious) was the additional Resort Service fee of USD$110 at check-in for wifi,cleaning etc (this may have been our travel agents mistake for not advising us prior). Overall we were very impressed with the hotel & will stay there again on our next visit

Mahalo NUI Loa, amazing. I love Hawaii, I love my accommodation & I love the people. Recommended 100% Amazing island & my accommodation was always clean, fresh& welcoming. Staff very helpful & accommodating

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort on several occasions and have always been greeted and welcomed by Branden & Dave. They both have gone out of their way to accommodate us to make our stay the best. The resort location is close to the beach, and there's a lot of places to visit that is within walking distance.

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for a week in June 2018. The location is superb - a 2 minute walk to Waikiki beach and close to everything you need (shops, restaurants, transportation etc).The only thing we were disappointed with was the fact the pool was out of service for refurbishments for 4 out of the 7 days we were there. We only happened to discover this when we went to use the pool and saw the sign. Had we been notified upon check-in we would have re-arranged our days so that we could have used the pool during the first half of our stay. The fact that we were charged the full rate for the entire stay when we weren't able to use the pool (a key reason we booked) left a bit of a sour taste in our mouths, but other than that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Waikiki Resort Hotel was fabulous. Derek help us with our reservations. He was terrific. Kenneth, the bellman, was great. The staff that cleaned our rooms did an excellent job. The buffet breakfast was amazing. The staff in restaurant did a superb job also. I would recommend their resort very, very, highly!!!!

Excellent Service, we will be back. We loved the easy accessibility of resort from everywhere. Staff were excellent especially the lady who checked us in the morning. Brendon checked us out and help us.

My cousin and I had an amazing time at your hotel! It was so convenient and had no issues with anything. Thank you for the great accommodation! I would recommend your hotel to anyone that is visiting Waikiki!

Did not like the addition of hidden fees to quoted daily rate. Breakfast was good every day. Parking was a problem, but also all over Honolulu, bad for handicapped & older visitors. Overall the stay was a pleasure.

We recently had a family of 4 vacation and it was our first time to Hawaii we tried saving money as well was hesitant on not choosing a hotel we know like the Hilton etc.. but so happy i went with the resort it's literally 2 min from the beach and it has a lot near by the hotel service and staff was 100 % excellent room good size just an awesome experience and we stayed for 6 nights

I loved the entry way in to the hotel. The staff is very professional but relaxed. They are very helpful with any questions i had and made my stay very pleasant. The property is very well kept and everything worked. My next time in Hawaii i will stay here again.

Thank you for your hospitality. I feel that the everything couldn't be better. Especially, cleanness, location, service, room, sleep quality. If I have to bring up one, I hope e-cigarette is available in my room.

Was our 2nd stay here and we had great service received an upgraded room once we told them it was for our 1st Anniversary. Would recommend. Great location very close to the beach & walking distance to the main shopping strip

Unfortunately, my stay was very bad. Location was excellent and hotel lobby was clean. But besides that, service was bad. 2x i went to lobby to ask for service and location of pool. They snapped at me lile if i knew. Pool was lonely and dirty. My room was so loud at night, didnt get sleep. Elevator sounds on and off. You can hear it all night long. Then when Koreans would get out of elevator or walk in hallways, you could hear them. Rooms are not sound proof at all!! Aweful. U would think for almost $800 for 3nights, u get a better service. Not happy at all.

Very nice hotel. Wonderful location and amazing customer service. Loved the DVD’s. The room was perfect for the price and very well maintained. The staff were all helpful and very nice and attentive. Would recommend to anyone.

Traditional style hotel only 30 second walk to the beach. Location is perfect for beach, restaurants, bars etc. Room is spacious and has everything you need - safe, toiletries, fridge, coffee maker, comfy beds etc. Trolley stop is nearby which can take you to Ala Moana for shopping. Hotel staff are all very friendly and helpful. Resort fee includes wifi, DVD rental, beach towels. Breakfast buffet is cheap and good food. Would definitely stay there again.

It was our first time staying here. On our prevous trips to Hawaii we would stay at the Mirmar Hotel,but it has since been pulled down, and on those trips we use to come to the Waikiki resort for the buffet breakfast. Thats how we knew about this hotel.. it is like a tiwn sister to the Mirmar,But a even better location,One block from the beach and the front rooms you can see the ocean.The hotel has Hawaiian charm and friendly staff and is very clean and big enough rooms and a seprate bathroom and wash room.The breakfast buffet is the best in Waikiki and as a guest of the hotel we got 20% off. The buffet has everything you want and if made fresh with great staff and yummy food, For any Australians traveling the hotel charges a resort fee of $15 USA a day which goes to the credit card, but i beleive all hotels in Waikiki have this fee,,it is includes wifi in your room,beach towels,daily newspaper from the lobby and a DVD rental per day which you get from the lobby.The bed and pillows were the best i have had in any hotel..Will defineatly stay here again. A special shout oout to ROSEALY,the lady who serviced our floor,Floor 7, Always nice to talk to her and see such a friendly happy person everyday.

we have good time of very kind employees and personnels of your hotle. we experienced a safe, family-friendly environment of your hotelI will recommend your hotel to my fellows actively and spontaneously.

What a great hotel with amazing staff from the front desk to the breakfast and the housekeeping. Everyone was so helpful and friendly they went out of their way to help you. Such a fantastic location quiet but just a short walk to the beach w minutes and right in the middle of all the shops and such great eating places on Kuhio. Highly recommended

The staff at the motel are very helpful.The only criticism is that as a tea drinker only, I did find it very inconvenient that there was not a kettle in the room or any normal tea (black) it seemed a great waste to me that, we had to open another packet of utensils to have access to sugar. Just some food for thought. Normal tea and separated sugar and a kettle.Other wise fantastic stay. Thank you very much.

The room was very clean. Staff was very friendly. Rooms and bathroom were small. We really only slept there. The only disappointment for us was the breakfast buffet. The food was all cold and overpriced for the quality. I would book here again.

From the time that we arrived the staff there very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and tidy. They have a good size pool which is great to sit around after a day of shopping and admiring the views. If we go back there we would be happy to stay there again.

We had a "wonderful" welcome to the hotel. We arrived after a 7 hours flight to Honolulu, and arrived at the hotel a little after 9am. We are aware that the official check-in time is 3pm, however, we were so tired, we asked for an early check-in if possible. The lady at the counter, Nancy, said it may be possible for us to check-in at 1 or 1:30pm. We were asked to leave a mobile phone number so that they can notify us once the room was ready. So we went out for breakfast and a walk. We then came back to the hotel, and checked again. We were asked to wait. We saw 2 to 3 groups of Koreans checked-in, we saw 2 groups of flight crew checked-in. We saw a small Asian family checked-in. By then it was 2:30pm, we again went to the counter and spoke to a man, Connor. After confronting him, he gave us a key which was already ready to our room. The next day, we were so tired, we left our room a little later, we saw the house-keeping lady outside our room and told her we were from Rm 509, she then said "Do you need service everyday?" It is lacking of amenities including: shower cap, tooth brushes, slippers.We will definitely not be returning to the Waikiki Resort Hotel.

This hotel is one of the older hotels around Waikiki. It’s missing some amenities that newer hotels have and some rooms need updating but we have stayed in this hotel for the third time because the staff are second to none. Dave from the front desk was very helpful in getting us the room we wanted to stay in, and the cleaning staff always made sure our rooms were cleaned even when we left the room late. The staff truly cares about the comfort of the people that stay there. I hope this is still the case when we come back in the future!- Mareanne L., Hamilton Ont Canada

Staff was friendly and helpful. Dean at the front desk really did a great job when we requested different bed arrangements! Found us a great room with exactly what we requested! Also, he told us of some close-by restaurants that he likes. Great service, and we had a great first night's dinner because of his suggestion!If you book directly with the hotel, they give you free breakfast buffet tickets. Resort fee is $15.71/day and parking is $25/day (as of mid May-2018). Booking through different agencies will result in different discounts for the breakfast buffet. Just ask.Rooms have fridge, a/c worked well, 1-minute walk to Waikiki Beach, 7-minute walk to the International Marketplace. Two parking lots: one at street level and one underground. Underground one is usually pretty full but there was usually a parking spot for us when we got there. Lots of quaint places to eat within 3-minutes walk.Only one of the three elevators goes down to the underground parking so you may need to exit at the lobby and either push the "down" button to get the elevator to the underground parking or just take the stairs.

We got a good deal on this hotel (at the time of booking) which included breakfast daily & high floor oceanview. We arrived late at night & very tired, to find the guy on Reception very helpful. But no-one to help with our luggage and the trolleys all locked up so we couldn't use them. Finally he found someone out the back who helped us with the luggage. The hotel room was large but decor quite dated and the air cond not on when we arrived so we were hot AND tired. However, the bed was very comfortable I have to say. There was a coffee machine but no milk, and only paper cups with a plastic straw to stir, which I felt very poor quality.The bathroom must have been divided up at one stage as there was a large wardrobe area with a safe, washbasin and the fridge (with no cold water or glasses)!! Then the toilet and shower area. The toilet was very low (I have mobility issues) and the step-over shower recess had no hand-rail or anything for safety. The towels were thick and fluffy and the amenities changed daily.What I found odd was that there was no bar in the hotel, & the restaurant was only open for breakfast and lunch and no room service!! There was also a Korean restaurant but that was "it". If you wanted anything to eat you had to go outside down the road (not far though)The breakfast was "OK" but no choice in eggs (usual scrambled), there was an assortment of hot dishes and Asian dishes plus fruits & salad (???); the coffee very ordinary (and there was plastic sachets of milk on the table). I asked for cream and was told they didn't have any. We had to take some sachets of milk for our in-room coffee machine.They need to add in extra glasses in the room (only 2 small glasses kept in the bathroom); some cold water in the fridge and proper cups with milk left.We would stay again simply for the location and comfy bed but be aware all hotels in Hawaii have added daily taxes plus plus so it was NOT a cheap option really (and car parking another extra if you needed it). The staff were friendly and helpful.

Our location was just perfect! Really appreciated the availability and the willingness of the staff to help us understand things when asked. The gals that kept our room neat and tidy were very personable and lovely to chat with!

Amazing location! If you want to stay close to restaurants and bars in Waikiki this is the place. The staff is also great. Dave at the front desk knew this was my honeymoon and brought us some champagne. Woohoo! Will definitely stay here again! :)

Located one block from the beach in Waikiki. Easy walking distance to many restaurants and shopping areas. Showing some wear, but maintenance is constant to keep it in good order. Traffic noise is constant on surrounding streets and can be bothersome when you are trying to sleep. Small restaurant that serves included buffet breakfast - can be crowded and difficult to get a seat at times.

I booked a solo trip to Oahu on impulse and needed help with activities and food! Connor, Branden and Bogdan did an amazing job helping me make my trip a dream vacation! They were all so friendly! Would highly recommend staying here!

Room was average. Clean and Serviceable but that was about it considering it was supposed to be a Deluxe room. Furnishings were very tired looking. Quite different from the initial impact of the foyer.After an initial problem with our booking and having the hotel trying to transfer us to another hotel as they had overbooked it was not a very pleasant start to our couple of days in Waikiki as we wasted quite a few hours waiting whilst the problem was sorted which eventually it was, but only after standing our ground as insisting on staying at the hotel we had booked.

Internet did not work in the hotel room which was frustrating and the main negative to staying here. DVD kiosk was nice. Good breakfast buffet. Staff was very friendly and rooms were cleaned well. Beach towel service was also very nice.

Have used Waikiki Resort Hotel for many years. Now coming back twice a year. Friendliness of staff, and cleanliness and upkeep of the building keeps bringing us back. Great location for Waikiki beach is an added bonus.

We were going to stay on one of the bigger hotels right on the beach but decided on this one after getting a great deal. We didn't regret it. The hotel was always very clean (and I am fussy, this is important to me) and it was easy to access everything in Waikiki. We were a 2 minute walk from Dukes Statue and surrounded by ABC stores. I however found the staff a little less forthcoming than other hotels, they didn't smile or say hello or good morning as you walk past them but whenever you had a reason to interact with them, they met all our needs. Our wifi was a great speed and we surprisingly loved the DVD machine, which wasn't just old DVDs but new ones too. We would stay here again

Good accommodation, great location, felt very safe with the kids, however would be good to have cups, bowls and cutlery available in the room. Very helpful staff. Would recommend Waikiki Resort Hotel.

We had booked a city view room. We ended up with an amazing view of the mountains and city. Branden checked us in and was so helpful and friendly. Later that day, he had even left us a gift in our room and called to check on us and make sure we were pleased with our room. The hotel isn't huge, it's basic and not as modern as some hotels. However, I didn't fly to Hawaii to stay inside a hotel the entire time. It was extremely clean and everything worked properly. The breakfast buffet was actually really good and service was great. The lunch was also good and very affordable. I have zero complaints. The location is perfect and I would stay here any time in the future. Thanks to the staff for a wonderful trip!

This was our second time staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, the location is great, one block from the beach, the staff is amazing, they go out of their way to make sure your visit is the best it can be. Thank you, we will be back and will continue to promote your hotel to our friends. Jessica Casey & Robert Joe

Hotel was very clean, pool area very nice we used it twice. The room was very clean and spacious. front desk staff were very helpful and happy. All in all a great stay.Conecurge stored our luggage until our room was ready, very helpful.

From the time we entered the hotel we were greeted with a big smile and a warm Aloha from Branden at the front desk. We've stayed here before so it was nice to see so many friendly faces. Branden, Dave, Nancy, and Suzie at the front desk. Every morning we had breakfast in the Ilima cafe and it was great to see Gil, Erna, Park and the new waiter Moon. Then there's Trent, Denis and Leo at the bell desk. The hotel is always clean ahd the staff super friendly.There is one lady who always goes above and beyond and her name is Sherri, she works in reservations and always takes care of us with a great room. And the general manager Glenn who took the time to chat in the lobby one afternoon to ask how we were enjoying our stay and he told us of all the great things the hotel is doing in the community. These people truly live Aloha. We will never stay anywhere else.

This year my wife and I will be celebrating our tenth wedding anniversary. We decided to go back to Hawaii and to stay for our fourth time at the Waikiki Resort. This time we brought my sister and nephew with us. The staff here is like ohana to us. Sherrie in reservations who we love and who we meet for dinner with her family. Branden on the front desk who always has great recommendations for restaurants and activities. Nancy who is a sweetheart who we also enjoy her company for dinner. Our room attendant Erley who is our morning greeter and helps us get the day started on a good note. The whole front desk staff along with Derek from reservations who always makes us feel welcomed. The hotel is well run and if you need anything the staff is very accomodating. It is one block from the beach and close to all Waikiki has to offer. Public transportation is also very close. You wont be disappointed staying here.

Had to stay at short notice as flight was cancelled - staff looked after me & room clean & quiet. It’s a little dated compared to other hotels, but couldn’t fault the service and room was nice enough. Good value too!

This was my first time going to Hawaii and somebody recommended that I stay here. The resort is very clean and comfortable. It is also located very close to the beach, Kings Village, stores, and the Zoo. However, one thing that I must emphasize is their service. The staff are amazing!!! If you have any questions, concerns, or thoughts about your stay they are more than willing to go up and beyond to make your stay a memorable one. If you do get to stay here speak to Branden, Dave, or Sherry. When I had questioned about Hawaii like the culture, locations or events they always gave me the best information. If it wasn't for them I might have not experienced some of the things I did. Outstanding customer service!!

Overall very good stay. The resort was very well maintained, the staff was friendly, and the location is right off the beach. We received a free ocean side upgrade upon arrival which was fantastic. It was wonderful to wake up every morning and see the beach. Would recommend staying here for sure!

We've never stayed here before, weren't sure what to expect but we had an awesome stay. Everyone was so nice there. Housekeeping did a wonderful job. Check in and out was great. We had the Mountain View Room, which was awesome for the three of us. The one who slept on the hideaway bed, said it was really comfortable. We really enjoyed the stay there. My only complaint is, you pay for wifi and there was none available in our room the entire stay. One of the girls, is in college and needed to do some things and couldn't get on line. Other than that, there were no problems. Still giving it a 5 star but we really needed that internet to work. Now we were on the top floor, so not sure if lower floors can get it or not. At any rate, we had a wonderful stay there and will most likely be back next year. Hopefully!!!! :) Oh and it's one short block from the beach. Very nice!

I do not write many reviews but I had to share the stay my mother and I had at the Waikiki Resort Hotel last month...As soon as we checked in at the reception desk, we felt how warm and welcoming the staff was. We came from California to Oahu for a funeral and to visit family on Molokai. Brandon at the front desk immediately made us feel like family and we felt he went above and beyond with making us feel at home. The staff in the lobby as well in the halls always greeted us and chatted with us. I had booked our room through TripAdvisor and it was very clean and tidy. We had a view of the surrounding hotels. We were a block from the beach and we could conveniently watch the fireworks and parade of the Honolulu Festival.We had a wonderful experience there. Thank you to everyone at the Waikiki Resort Hotel.

We booked the Waikiki Resort Hotel due to the proximity of the Hapalua Half Marathon as it was within walking distance to both the start and finish. When we arrived, Connor helped us check in and gave us a run down of the amenities. The hotel room was nice and seemed to have been updated recently. The housekeeping staff was friendly and even dropped off towels for us when we declined housekeeping. On our second night we spoke with Brendan at the front desk about our day and he gave us some tips on places we might want to check out for a late dinner. Overall, I would recommend and come back.

Great location. Wonderful staff! Walking distance to everywhere. Get a room with a microwave if you are staying a while, helps with food costs. Safe and fridge in room is nice. Clean, and nice balcony. Not the Ritz, but excellent value for the money. Onsite restaurant for breakfast with 20% included, but plenty of options close by to walk to for variety.

Hotel could use updates, but overall this hotel is perfect. Branden and Nancy at the front desk were exceptionally helpful and kind. Ilima restaurant breakfast buffet is a nice addition. Location is superb. I had an ocean view and it was great.

高層樓房,晚上看到daimond head 美麗的夜景, 住在其他旅館的朋友還會特地來訪看夜景,房間擺設就像是自己家一樣安全舒服 ,水果茶的茶包好喝,housekeeping 姊姊服務很貼心,大床舒適棉被很大很好睡 Everything is just great!如果我再到Wakiki 我一定會再來這個旅館 Thank you Waikiki Resort Hotel .I will certainly come again.

Just had a week at this hotel and I really enjoyed my stay. The location was terrific - just one block back from the beach. The room was great and the bed was very comfortable.The pool was very nice and there were lots of sun lounge chairs to relax on. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again

I Love it here! Relaxing,Always accommodating, the staff is AWSOME!! “BRANDEN & CONNOR”Gives you the #1 service, professionalism, best definition of ALOHA. Recommend this hotel every time. Deserves 5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

The price was competitive in comparison to other properties but I have to say it is in dire need of upgrades and also professional integrity. We booked and paid for a room with a king size bed but walked into a room with two double beds. When we inquired about that we were told that there were "no guarantees". What in the world? We have never been told that before. The only 'advice' we were given was to inquire the next morning and we could possibly get moved. Another unexpected unpleasantry was the construction crane obstructing our partial ocean view. Not the hotel's fault, I understand but it added to our already frustrating double bed situation. The breakfast buffet is subpar, won't eat there again for the rest of our stay. Should we return to Waikiki, we'll try a different property.

Conveniently located to everything. Quick walking access to beach, good food, and shopping. Branden and Dave at front desk are wonderful and helpful. Korean BBQ restaurant at hotel is best in Waikiki! I'm from the islands and definitely recommend this place for locals and mainlanders.

Close to the beach, nice amenities, UNBELIEVEABLE STAFF (from the front desk, to housekeeping, to the bell staff!!), location is truly perfect - close to the beach and walking distance to some terrific restaurants. You are going to be walking a lot anyway, but this hotel is centrally located in my opinion. Look, if you are interested in the best value for your buck, you absolutely need to consider this hotel. It's not on the beach, but literally 1 block away. My particular room (that I selected mind you) had a view of the city, and I could see a little of the beach, but the balcony was nice to have. The room was what I expected, wasn't huge, but worked for two people. It didn't have a microwave, which I would recommend that you select a room that does if you plan to stay in Hawaii for a while, helps with keeping food costs down. The room had a safe, which was very nice, hair dryer, and iron/iron board (which I would never use, but one day I had a business event). The pool is not heated, but worked well for hot days and I even enjoyed later day/evening swims (it was fine). The staff IS AMAZING!!!! So friendly, professional, and helpful. I will stay at this hotel again!

Whilst the rooms were basic, they were very clean and well organised. The location and staff were fantastic and made for a great holiday. Would certainly go back again. My only issue would be to include the resort fee in the initial room price rather than add it on when you check out, even though you know it is coming

stayed here 4 nights, room very spacious very clean and well serviced during our stay. The bed was very comfortable. The room was not very sound proofed, we were woken early morning with the rubbish trucks banging around outside. Location is excellent for access to Waikiki and the main restaurants and shopping areas. Staff helpful with directions for buses and local sights.

Everyone here at this hotel was very,very pleasant and accommodating. Cleaning ladies were also very helpful. June was awesome at check in and out! Desk Staff also helped with printing boarding passes. Will definitely stay here again.

The location is perfect, just a street away from the beach and at the end of the shopping strip. Accomodation is average, bathroom is rather small, view from the room is nice, thin walls (when we stayed the hotel next door was being renovated so was very noisy). Only issue we had was the check in time is 3pm and they don't allow you in any earlier. Our flight landed at 7am and we got to the hotel by 8:30am and got told to do something otherwise i'll be a very long wait.Other then that we enjoyed our 1 week stay here.
