That being said all of the hotel staff without fail went out of their way to be helpful and the location one block from Waikiki Beach is hard to beat for the price. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to people as long as they are not expecting a 5 star experience for a 3 star price. Overall I would return to this hotel because of staff and location.

We stayed only one night, arriving late in the evening after a long flight from the mainland East coast. George at the front desk was very welcoming, provided great service and hospitality with a smile, taking care of us with offer of extra beds and free breakfast. Location is right in the center of Waikiki beach, very close to everything including the beach (although not beachfront). Rooms were a little dated but lobby was very nice. Buffet breakfast was good.

We stayed here for a night prior to returning home to California. We were on the big island for a week. They upgraded us to the penthouse suite...room was fabulous, great views...easy access to beach, restaurants etc. The checkin was quick and easy...Coco was awesome, presented us with Leis...I wish we could have stayed longer, you bet this will be my next hotel of choice our next visit.

If you want close to the beach this is the one. The rooms are very nice and the staff are very helpful. The only reason I did not give it five stars is that the WI-Fi is not good.Still a nice place to stay.

We booked and were a little dubious as reviews were all over the place - people said good and bad things... Thought about changing hotel but so so so glad we didn't!We arrived in the afternoon and check in was smooth and easy. Wifi worked great and we were also advised of the $10 a day resort fee - so cheap compared to most hotels...The room was absolutely great. Not massive and a few of buildings but how much time are you spending in your room! It was perfectly adequate for the 3 of us (2 adults and 1 - 5 year old) we had 2 double beds... We didn't eat in the restaurant at the hotel but looked at the shops which stocked a good range of products and all was lovely. The pool was lovely and warm and also had a good selection of sunbeds. Towels were free from the basement and you could use these for the pool or beach! The foyer in the hotel was bright and breezy and the concierge were really lovely! Genuinely helpful happy people.Location - well well well where do we start.. the hotel is literally a 30 Second walk to the beach and the main strip on Waikiki. That's passing a McDonalds and a Haagen Dazs shop on the way! It's absolutely perfect!!! You couldn't get any closer... Would I stay at this hotel again! Absolutely!!!!We also booked a luau with the hotel excursion desk - great guy - great choice. Pick Chiefs if you go to one! You won't be disappointed!!Can't wait to return!

I couldn't connect Wi-Fi on the 6th floor properly. I had to go down to the lobby every time when I use my mobile phone with W-Fi. I don't know what was problem on this. I saw the signal for Wi-Fi network conditions so weak on the 6th floor.

I just had to write this review to share with the world the WONDERFUL experience I had at Waikiki Resort Hotel. The hotel and rooms are very nice and clean but what makes me rate this hotel an Outstanding is the incredible customer service I received from "Dave" at check-in. I am visiting Hawaii in celebration of my mother 's 73rd birthday. So, I wanted the best accommodations my money can buy. Not only was Dave extremely patient and understanding, he was also very helpful and informative! He deserves a raise in my opinion! :-)Overall, I would rate my experience at this hotel, particularly in my dealings with the staff, a 5 out of 5!Lashone WallaceSan Antonio, TX

Parking may be a challenge but the hotel staff are very helpful in assisting with that issue. Hotel is close to the beach and plenty of shopping and other services. i am sure you will be very comfortable at this hotel.

Waikiki Resort Hotel is an excellent place to stay. It is very close to the beach, shops and eateries. If you can get an ocean view room it will make your holiday better. I had a city view room and when the garbage was collected early in the morning it was very noisy. The internet kept dropping out in my room but was always available in the lobby. Breakfast was basic but good. The tour desk was very helpfull so were the reception desk. There is a coin operated laundry on site which came in very handy. I would stay again.

We stayed at this hotel at the end of July 2016 for 2 nights.We had never stayed here before so did't know what to expect. When we reached the hotel the Lady at the reception was so kind and smiling all the time. Her name is Dee Guo. When we checked into our room it was so clean and neat with all the amenities we required. Oh the WIFI is fantastic, its high speed :-)We stayed in the ocean view room, so it was lovely.Not a noisy hotel at all compared to other hotels we have stayed at at Waikiki.Then next morning we had the buffet breakfast, it was really healthy and yummy :-)Perfect to start our day!!!We so recommend this hotel if you want a relaxed atmosphere.The staff are very friendly.We will stay there again on our next trip to Waikiki!

My stay was very welcoming and roomy i had a blast , only thing i would change is that instead of a shower i wish there was a tub to bathe in . Overall it was niceand clean and a very good vacation. Thanks

Pity it was just a short stay for only just night, but the reception was a warm welcoming one, and service excellent. Nice rooms and beautiful street and ocean views from the room I was in. Definitely nothing to complain about!

Great location - one block back from the beach but access to bars, restaurants and shopping. Also easy access to the buses. The room was great - I chose a partial sea view and was not disappointed. The room service was excellent.

We are very happy we choose this property, The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. (Even when I called the day before our trip) Housekeeping had another set of towels to our room even before we had a chance to notice we needed another set of towels. We liked that beach towels were available. It was nice to be able to walk to the beach and to restaurants. Finally, the bellman on the last day held our bags and had a taxi ready for us when it was time to leave for the airport.

I recently stayed at this hotel. I found every part of it great. Was able to check in early, had a great room with a terrific view and most all the staff where friendly and the place was CLEAN. Its a great location and for the price was exactly what i needed. I will be back and will bring the wife and kids

First, great location. Right in the middle of everything you need. The rooms are very spacious and I love that it had central ac instead of a wall unit. The rooms always stayed nice and cool. What I was most impressed with though was the maid service. I was locked out one day because the battery died on our door lock and she immediately helped us. She also did a great job cleaning the room (we were pretty messy) I thanked her every chance I got. Great stay

Stayed here for a week and were very comfortable. The only improvement I would suggest would be better mattresses since they are a little saggy. The hotel has all the necessities for a reasonable rate, including pool/beach towel service and refrigerator in room. The washers and dryers onsite were a little pricey but convenient. Staff were all very friendly, though check in can be slooooooooow (seems to be part process and part people efficiency).

Went here with my family, 9 of us stayed here and we were all located on the same floor. Although the room seemed basic, it had an ocean view and a fridge, kettle, microwave. Plenty of toiletries always left for us. Hotel provides beach towels as well. Wifi in room was really poor but good in the lobby. The staff were excellent and always willing to help. The hotel is really close to the beach and restaurants, its a perfect location. The hotel needs a bar and smoking was not permitted anywhere. If I ever went back to waikiki I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again.

This Hotel is awesome. The staff always so helpful and kind. The parking is so convenient -right underneath. The room was clean and staff always cleaned it up so nice and left nice soaps too. Would stay there again.

Stay was good but just felt the hotel rooms were somewhat dated, especially compared to how much we paid for the hotel. Otherwise, location was excellent and staff was friendly enough. Very close to the beach and lots of shops and dinning.

The rooms are clean and comfortable.There were no wine glasses in the room. We went to housekeeping and eventually they found two glasses for us. This was not uncommon in hotels in Hawaii as there were no wine glasses in any of the hotels we stayed in. The WiFi in our room was not good so to get a good signal we had to go to the lobby. The day time lobby staff were great and all very friendly. The overnight staff when asked questions had too get advice from someone else. The concierge, house keepers and bell boy were great and very helpful.The location of the hotel was great. Close to tour pickups and the beach front and restaurants.

The staff are absolutely lovely, the rooms are spacious and clean. 9 of us stayed at the hotel and not one of us had a complaint. The staff went above and beyond to cater for us. The only thing we would say is the hotel needs a bar and the pull out sofa we slept on was pretty uncomfortable but it was ok!

We really enjoyed our stay. Our room was initially incorrect but the front desk was able to move us to the correct room the following day All the staff was very friendly and accommodating. There was an issue with the plumbing that the engineers could not fix. When you turn the shower on the way to hot the pipes would rattle loudly. Other than that we really enjoyed the hotel. It was an excellent value.

nearly everything was fineit would be good to get more than one pool towelBreakfast buffet is no plain yoghurtmore different fruits for breakfast would be goodpool is very nice, it would be good to have for umbrellas for sunshine

this hotel has vey good location so it's easy to go around with my kids even at night.It's really good hotel to stay with my kids for the price I paid.Beds are comfortable to sleep.Also we can walk just 2-3 minutes to take Trolly^^

Overall stay was excellent , a few things I think they should have is a workout room, the ocean view room and bathroom could have been a little bigger, hotel should keep a wheelchair for emergencies....great hotel!

Overall we were very pleased with the hotel. The room was excellent, we had views of the beach and diamond head which was fantastic. The hotel is very central to everything in Waikiki. The pool was excellent our kids played in the pool for hours. The Internet access was a little slow but adequate; the lifts were a bit slow at times. It would have been nice to be able to store surfboards somewhere; even on the day we were checking out the concierge didn't allow us to store the boards downstairs while the luggage while we went and got our car! Overall though - a great hotel that I would recommend to others.

The only issue was the poor wifi service and the small pool, but overall very good hotel to stay for the price we paid. It is about a block distance from the waikiki beach. The personnel service was great and they were very nice and friendly. Oh my toilet got clogged up and after calling they came within 5 min. to fix.

We had a nice time in Waikiki. The hotel is in a great location and we had a view of the beach. Rooms are dated but were reasonably clean. Amenity fee is low compared to some, dvd's were lacking. Pool area is boring and gets no sunshine. Housekeeping service was good, plenty of towels after letting them know there was 3 of us in the room. Unfortunately after our flight was cancelled, they were booked out but offered me no assistance to find a room elsewhere even after I asked could they recommend/ phone a sister or affiliated hotel. Did not provide the 20% discount on breakfast as promoted even after we provided our coupon.

It was a great place to stay, very central and lovely room. Our only criticism was the poor wifi in the rooms. All of our friends staying here found the same and the only wifi accessible was in the lobby.

Location was perfect,staff were very friendly and helpful,hotel was spotlessly clean at all times .the only downside there isn't a hotel bar where where you could relax to after a long day .I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to hawaii.

I was greeted by a very friendly employee at check-in! We had a 2-bed room, a standard size, small shower, comfortable bed!! The walls are a little thin. We could hear street noise (on the 4th floor) and our neighbors entering/exiting their room. This is a great location, a block from the beach, 2 blocks from the start of great shopping/window shopping and restaurants. On the opposite corner of this hotel is a surfboard rental shop w great prices.

Amazing location. Great value, but room was older and needed updating. Toilet needed repair as it was leaking water into the bowl the whole time. Rooms were serviced but certain items (like toilet paper) were not replaced, so I had to ask for it. Front desk service was great! Getting in and out of the parking garage was easy.

I had my reception here it was phenomenon the food was great the service was great the staff was phenomenon especially edwin (food service ) sherrie (guest services ) and everybody from the restaurant by the lobby, the bartender for my reception EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT

In the last 4 or 5 years we have stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel 4 times and then tried a couple of other hotels directly opposite the beach. This trip due to the drop in the $A we went back to the Waikiki Resort for our 2 week Hawaiian holiday as it is a bit cheaper than the hotels directly opposite the beach.Since we last stayed WI FI is now provided to rooms, a free DVD service is available and free Newspapers are available. A small resort fee has also been added so the free extra’s aren’t really free, however good WI FI in the room is a lot better than only accessible in the lobby area Arriving at 8am we were very happy to be given a room straight away. Early access can depend on the time of year as on our last 3 trips (incl 2 other hotels) a wait of 4-5 hours was normal for an 8am arrival. Kudos to the reception staff who got our trip off to a great startRooms are clean and comfortable, but the bathroom fixture and fittings are starting to show some signs of aging. The US$13.30per person discounted breakfast at the restaurant is OK, but we find there is not enough variety to eat there every day.We found all staff to be pleasant and helpful.Considering price and the location being less than a 2 min walk to the main Waikiki Beach area, we consider the hotel to be good value when compared other hotels nearby, and would continue to come back.

Enjoyed our stay loved the location. The staff was very nice and friendly. I would come back no questions asked. The Consear service was very helpful getting us to our site seeing tours. The breakfast was perfect and service was great.

We stayed at multiple places during our visit and this was one of our favorites! Great location! Warm, friendly service. They went above and beyond. I enjoyed the movie rentals. The parking lot was smaller than expected so I thought we may have problems but we were always able to find a spot.

The hotel isn't anything fancy. The rooms are comfortable and spacious enough. Staff are friendly and helpful. There is a laundry in the basement $2-2.25 to wash and $1.75 to dry. Breakfast buffet is good although quite expensive. A better option for me was to walk 5 minutes to the grocery store and buy some cereal. Beach is only a minutes walk and it's close to major bus stops to take you all over the island. Wifi is good, when it works, but seems to always require re logging into which can be annoying. I was lucky enough to get a room with a view, although it's obscured by buildings on each side. I was a little put off at being charged an extra $10 per night upon arrival for things like internet, towel usage etc. Why this could t be added to the original booking price is beyond me. Overall it's comfortable well appointed and fairly centrally located.

Our two night stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel was part of a cruise package, so we can't comment on value/cost.Our introduction to the hotel was very good. We arrived at the hotel at around 8am exhausted after a 9 hour overnight flight - long before we were due to occupy a room at 2pm. The sympathetic lady on reception made a special effort to get us into a room within a couple of hours. Desk and other staff were invariably friendly and helpful.The room itself was clean and bright - perfectly adequate. The only dining we did was breakfast - quite a good buffet at a reasonable price. Staff were friendly and efficient.The location is great - a couple of minutes' walk to the esplanade, shops and restaurants.

Super convenient location but no view, it's easy to walk to the Waikiki beach and located near a tour bus stop.The hotel is dated but seems like they keep it well maintained. The service was friendly for the most part especially the front desk, they were very helpful. We were traveling with big family so we were on a budget so we picked this hotel. This hotel is a Korean hotel and so there is Korean restaurant and Korean air office in the hotel.

I had a happy time at Waikiki resort hotel w/ my family. All people and services were satisfied. Clean rooms and amanities. Very friendly representatives. Location close to Waikiki beach and Alamoana shopping center.

One of the things we just had to do on vacation was to visit Pearl Harbor. To accomplish this we had to "island hop" from Hawaii to Oahu on Thanksgiving day. We arrived at the hotel at mid-morning, long before early check in. The Bellman secured our luggage and the front desk directed us to a sumptuous Thanksgiving feast just across the street. As we returned to wait on our room, I worked with the concierge to secure round trip travel to Pearl Harbor for the following day and a plus - 4 tickets to the Arizona Memorial. The concierge worked with me for 30 minutes and would not accept any compensation for his efforts.Our room had two separate bedrooms, an unusual but functional bathroom and a limited view of the beach. We enjoyed a free movie from the lobby, and used the free Wi-Fi to make the remainder of our travel plans. The price was a lot lower than a number of other hotels I had researched but the amenities and location was outstanding.

A good Hotel for holidays, beach is 1 min to go, personal is friendly and helpfull, pool is clear, eating is good and delicios, a bus stop is 5 min by the hotel. The organisation and service is very good.

Great location, only minutes to the beach and to shopping areas. Bus and trolley stops just around the corner. Reception staff and concierge were very helpful, room was clean and the pool was really good for cooling off after a day out. Bed was comfortable.

CHECK IN JUNE 26 TO JULY 3RD. Pros: FRONT DESK STAFF VERY HELPFULL, ESPECIALlY COCO AND CONNERS.THEY HONORED MY REQUEST FOR TOP FLOOR OF THE HOTEL- FLOOR 19 ROOM PH-E. GOOD HOUSEKEEPING STAFF. My Room had ok view of Ali Wai canal.They give you a 25% discount to eat at their restuarant called Ilima. For $18.00 after the discount; the food in the restuarant was good. Good variety, scrambled Eggs, Ham, Sausage, Pancakes, Hash browns, fresh fruit, fried rice, ceral, muffins juice, coffee and tea. We ate their 3 of the 7 days. Concierge desk locatedin lobby. Room next to Pacific beach hotel and Hyatt and 2 blocks to Waikiki Marriott hotel. Cons:Found 3 small roaches in the bathroom over last 3 days of stay. Maybe due to the construction in adjacent room.Small shower area. Rooms could use new carpeting and sprucing up. Spoty Wi- Fi in room. Only have 2 guest washing machines and dryers. They need at least 4. Machines we dirty and need to be replaced. Over all I would return to the hotel if in the area. They just need to refurbish some of the rooms.Bob C

We are return customers & have stayed here numerous times.The rooms are clean & spacious, the beds are comfortable & the staff are very welcoming.The location is perfect being near to the beach but still quiet. Room 1803 is our favourite & we hope to return soon.Mahal I & Aloha,

The front desk staff was always friendly and ready to help with any question we had. The hotel is located one block from the beach and is close to many restaurants. The breakfast buffet was fabulous with a large variety of food and it was delicious.

Had a great stay here. Great location only minutes from the beach, shops, restaurants, and local bus stops. Rooms cleaned daily. Beach towels available on request. The breakfast buffet was very good value. Staff all very friendly and polite. Hotel very clean. The beds were so so comfortable - best I've ever had in a hotel. Only downside is there are no sun shade parasols in the pool area. Overall I would def recommend and would stay here again if I am ever lucky enough to go back.

Location is great. Rooms were small and dated. They forgot to clean our room one day and didn't clean it the next until almost 4 pm. However, no major complaints. No gym and having to pay 25$ per day for gym across the street was an added expense.

Location is very very good.ButYou need Interior remodeling.Bathroom, bed and dressroom is so old and antique.And you do not have korean guide book.I would like to hope korean guide book.I will be back. Waiikiki resort...Bye~~~!

It was a trip for my honeymoon. Mr.Connor and Brendan at Front desk were very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to them again:) The room that we stayed was always clean whenever we came back from outside. The breakfast was always super and the ladies at Spa were so kind and provided us such a good massage. My honeymoon could be that perfect since your hospitality! Me and my wife will definitely stay with you again! There will be a little baby coming with us for the next time:) Many thanks again!

We loved everything about this hotel! The staff was amazing, so friendly and helpful, and the location couldn't have been better. A short 5 minute walk had us on Waikiki Beach, and it was an equally short walk to the bus stop. The free DVD's were a great bonus, and having the pool on hand in case of bad weather was very appreciated. Internet was spotty in the room, but strong in the lobby. Our reservation included the buffet breakfast, and it was a wonderful way to start the day! I think it was well worth the price that we paid for a room so close to absolutely everything Waikiki!

We stayed here at this resort for 1 week. My biggest complaint was the constant door slamming all throughout the night. I got woke up several times. The doors to the rooms slam shut very loudly. Other than that we had a great stay. I love how the resort supplies beach towels. That saved a lot of room in our suitcase. If you're not sure what activities to do on your stay visit the Expedia desk in the hotel lobby. We worked with Meriam and she helped plan our whole week. We will definitely return. I highly suggest finding out when and where the farmers markets are set up. We were able to purchase fresh fruits, salads, salad rolls and hot foods as well for under $3.00. We had fresh fruit and delicious snacks our whole trip for very cheap. Enjoy your stay! Btw the hotel supplies great shampoos and lotions.

It would have been nice to have an ice machine on another floor besides only the 2nd floor. But the free dvd's and garage parking was nice. The elevators are super quick. Didn't try any of the restaurants at the hotel.

The hotel is a few blocks from the beach, has no microwave, overpriced for an average hotel. Internet available but very slow or hardly working. But easy access to restaurants and shopping center. Parking is small can't find parking to park. Staff are friendly.

I was very happy with my accommodations. The convenience to get to the beach. I had a beach view. I was very suprised that there was no ice machine on the floor. And I was not going to use the ice tray in the refrigerator. The other fault was the sliding door to the balcony. It was so rusted and hard to open. Otherwise everything was fine.

Great location - just a few minutes walk from the beach and restaurants. Breakfast was included which was a bonus. Very helpful staff. We stored our luggage (small cost involved) while we stayed on another island. Rooms were ok and beds were extremely comfortable. Our second time we have stayed and probably will again.

We did a 3 night stopover and stayed at this hotel , good location , good breakfasts comfy rooms , and very friendly staff ,had it all, The restaurant on site is Korean but food was reasonably priced and tasty.

Did a lot of research, based on ratings, location and price and settled on the Waikiki Resort. The staff was very pleasant, upon arrival they confirmed a king bed, but I was vacationing with my daughter and needed 2 doubles. They provided a rollaway for the first night and was able to switch rooms the 2nd day.Location is very conveniennt, only a block away from the beach.My only complaint is the underground parking. It is very limited and it appears that employees park their vehicles there too rather than an outdoor lot next to the hotel. I left the hotel for 15 minutes to run to the bakery at 8am, when I returned, the spot that I had been in was now occupied by a 2005ish 4runner, obviously not a rental.

Stayed 6 nights here with my son, then my daughter with her partner joined us for 2 of those nights. Very clean, spacious room & well designed so no problem for 4 adults. The staff are so friendly & helpful, a plentiful buffet breakfast was included. Great location. One small block from the beachfront, could walk anywhere in Waikiki & convenient to a bus stop for further destinations. Loved the lobby. A large, open, colourful & relaxing area.

I would stay at the Waikiki resort again, you can't beat the corner location just a short block to the beach, shopping and restaurants. You even get a partial view of the sand and surf with the back drop of the sun lit turquoise waters in the day and the moon lit shimmering waters at night. The service was very good and the rooms were clean, all except for one carpet stain but hey turnover is constant in paradise and the resort still gets an A. My favorite aspect of the resort was the open air lobby where the breezes were heavenly.

This hotel has some of the cleanest best kept rooms in Honolulu. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is in the heart of the city. Parking is a little involved but not too big of a deal. I had a great stay and I will definitely return. This is a great and affordable spot just off Waikiki Beach!

Good value. Very close to the beach and transport. Nicely presented rooms and lobby. Helpful and friendly staff. We got a room upgrade and a cot for our baby at no extra charge. Free dvd rental in lobby.

Pros:Location less than 2 short blocks to beach, on-site breakfast tasty and good selection, friendly staff if you can find them.Cons:Cold showers, pool closes nightly at 7 pm, not enough towels in your room, constant noise from the street (non-stop back-up beeping noise from garbage and construction trucks that I never could figure out where they were. Windows won't close to block it out so we had to leave the A/C on constantly to block the noise.) Worn and dated furniture, fixtures, carpet, lobby, have beach towels available but you have to go downstairs and beg, plus they charge you if you don't bring them back by that same night!One of our rooms had a flying bug infestation that had the resident up for several hours killing them with her shoe!! She said they seemed to be hatching from between the wallpaper and the wall.Bottom line is this is only one step above a motel 6 in quality, and ridiculously overpriced.

My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a few nights at the beginning of the honeymoon as a way to be in the centre of Waikiki and get to know the area (before moving on to a more secluded area later in the holiday). I must say I didn't expect much as the hotel is comparably cheaper than other nearby hotels but I was pleasantly surprised.We paid a little extra for the corner room which was very spacious and had a decent view of the ocean (albeit slightly impaired by a couple of other buildings). The customer service was good, everything in the room worked and the pool area is decent. We did have an almighty shock on one occasion when we came into the room to find a stranger sitting on our balcony!! It turned out to be one of the hotel workers (who had been adding a new coat of paint to the side of the building) was catching some shade out of the sun.Of course the best thing about the hotel is the location. It's in the middle of Waikiki so you're surrounded by shops and restaurants tailored for tourists, plus there is great transport/excursion options to see the "real Hawaii".Overall, if you're looking for a decent, convenient hotel then I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Located half a block back from the beach (approx 100m), the location was perfect and the hotel is not overly expensive in comparison to others on Waikiki. We stayed for 11 nights with 2 young kids and had a great experience. The hotel is obviously a little dated but still very comfortable and acceptable for the price. The beds are very soft. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The Korean restaurant in the hotel was also excellant. One criticism is that we would have loved to see more umbrellas or shaded area around the pool. Overall excellent value for money!! Thanks for a great stay!!

This is an average hotel that needs a major upgrade. The rooms were clean however the carpets smelled like mildew at times. The hotel corridors and lobby are outdated and looked very drab. There was not a gym at this hotel and we did not use the pool. The upside was that this location is one block from the beach and restaurants. Upon checking in we asked for a room with a decent view and the front desk agent couldn't/wouldn't find us one. We ended up with a room facing another building. When the people in the room above me would shower there was a very loud sound like a generator or water heater of some sort that came on. This woke me up at 3am I called the front desk and they sent a security guy who said there's nothing they can do, the building is just old. Overall I give this place 3 out of 5 stars.

The lobby of the hotel is very impressive and looks very luxurious. However, the rooms are another story. I looked at several hotels in the same price range as the room I chose and I can honestly say that I don't think the price I paid represented what I should have seen in the room. The room was clean and comfortable as you would expect, but despite the "ocean view" I paid extra for - the room is anything to be desired. You are cramped in like sardines on two double-beds and there is very little room to spare besides the bed and a small desk and dresser. With the price I paid I would have expected some other piece of furniture to sit on besides the desk chair. The maid kept the place looking nice and the beds were comfortable yet tight for two average size adults. You have to be very mindful of all the hidden fees of this hotel. There is a $10/day amenities fee that covers phones, internet, etc. which is about average for this type of fee - however I meant to mention there is a catch with the amenities. You cannot use the "Business center" which has two computers for that included fee. You must use a credit card to use the Business Center computers. The more frustrating charge that although disclosed on expedia's website is a total joke - in reference to Customer Hotel Parking fee. Parking in general in this hotel's general geographic area is very tight. They offer "hotel" parking for you as a guest for the ridiculous price of $25/day. What is ironic that for a hotel with 19 floors, there are only 30-40 total space available next to the hotel and underneath the hotel (in total). If you happen to be out late - you can forget getting a chance to park there. Also they have a weird ticketing system for this parking that is problematic from time to time. You must use the ticket to both enter and leave the parking areas. For those of you who don't rent a car the hotel does happen to be within walking distance of both the beach and several other shops and restaurants. So if you do not have a car have no fear. I would also comment in general that if you are used to to big city streets this town will be no surprise to you, however coming from a smaller town i was overwhelmed with the number of one way streets, buses, and people traffic in general. You can take any estimate on Google Maps and about double it if you are going to travel anywhere by car inside of Waikiki Beach.

Waikiki beach is just 2 minutes away from hotel.Location is really very good. and price is very good. We do not need to see beach, ocean all the time. Also, services of front desk and cleaning were nice.
Staff very nice and courteous .The room could have been more. Enjoyed the DVD rental each day. Location to the beach and shopping was extremely nice.Breakfast selection limited for the price you pay.

Waikiki beach is just 2 minutes away from hotel. Much quite than beach side. We do not need to see beach, ocean all the time. The price is very reasonable compare to location. Only $10 pre day for wifi in room and beach towel. You can access easily to go trip to Hanauma Bay (Bus #22), 5 color tram.

We stayed at this resort last week, and we had a great time. The staff was nice and courteous. The facilities were clean throughout. We stayed in a mini suite, which was the perfect size for three of us. The location is fantastic if you don't want to be in the center of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, yet want to be walking distance to all of its attractions. The only negative experiences we encountered during our stay is we were able to hear all of the noise in this area; there's virtually no counter space in the rest room; and the lobby area is open air, which means there is no A/C. Although it was noisy, none of us experienced a bad night of rest. The room was very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

Evrything is good. Good location.Your hotel is located at the center part of Waikiki and walking distance to various tourist attractions. Also, services of front desk and cleaning were nice.But breakfast buffet was horrible. Food itself was ok. But pilippino personnels were very rude and made my appetite disappear. Every morning I felt unpleasant.

Great location perfect view but average hotel. You are paying for location. Room service took 3 days to get right. Ask multiple questions but need to speak to multiple staff as each specialise in their knowledge i.e map, internet queries, restaurants. Restaurant terrible but plenty around location to choose from. Convenient 24hr reception. Checkin was the best experience of the hotel, lovely service and room was ready before 3pm.

We stayed here for 6 nights from 16th May. Everything about the stay was just lovely. Just a few weeks before our trip I needed to amend my booking and add another room for my mum to join us. The staff were just amazing, managing to arrange for the rooms to be next to each other. The hotel was full so they really worked hard to ensure our holiday went smoothly. We had a bottle of wine and some lovely confectionery in our room on arrival as I had mentioned on the booking that it was my birthday and our anniversary. A really lovely touch. We were on the 18th floor and we had the end room which was lightly larger than my mother's. The rooms are spacious and the view from the balcony, just wonderful. We had breakfast included and this was a buffet. There was an excellent selection but if there was something from the menu you would rather (can't see why you would though) the staff were more than happy to oblige. After such a wonderful breakfast, we didn't want anything until much later. Big saving on the food budget!! The hotel is just one block from the sea and the main walkway. There are numerous high class shops and plenty of places to eat but mainly the best places are in the hotels. We did not eat at the hotel in the evenings and there is no bar in the hotel. There are plenty of places to buy a bottle, or two, of wine (there's an ABC Store pretty much on every corner!) to keep in the fridge in your room and enjoy whilst looking out at the ocean. What could be more perfect? Sooooooo wish I was there now!! I would definitely recommend this hotel, for location, customer service, lovely rooms (request one on a high floor and an ocean view is a must), excellent breakfast. We only used the pool once but it is just lovely. You can hire towels and can use them for the beach. It is a perfect place to stay as you are minutes away from the sea and all the shops but being a block away, it is much quieter. I would definitely stay here again.

We really enjoyed this hotel. It is very close to the beach, shopping, restaurants, and nightlife. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel gift shop has some of the best prices in the area. The restaurants are a little pricey, but there are other options really close by (McDonald's is practically next door.) They provide free beach towels. They took care of anything we needed.

It was a great stay with no issues at all. I enjoyed the room and the cleanliness was great. The girl at the front desk helped me with everything I needed and there were no issues with anything. It was close to the beach and just what I was looking for.

Great spot if you want to spend the majority of your time at the beach. Shops and food all within walking distance. Definitely make use of the surf lessons while you're in town and the bus isn't far from here too.

Very clean nice staff close to beach staff was very helpful love the e mart felt very safe room was spotless everyday. If you needed something always ready to help. Would diffently stay here again love love

I have always stayed at this hotel when traveling to Waikiki. Never had an issue always a pleasant stay. Hotel staff is always friendly and helpful. It would be nice if they would have a meal package included though.

Oh this was a great hotel beautiful chandeliers helpful concierge peaceful and quit only thing is i wish i new there was no microwaves in the room guess had to ask for that but all in all great hotel.

I would appreciate if the management say in clear language that the charge for the amenities of $10.00 daily is mandatory. My family and I occupied 2 rooms and I thought I could save on that if we used the wi-fi, internet, phone, etc. in only one room.But I was charged for the amenities, that I did not take advantage of ,of the other room.Also grab bars in the bath tub would add safety for your guests, especially the elderly. Otherwise, my rating overall would have been excellent

Ok so the lobby and general area is a bit old and dated, but it meets all your needs. The staff were friendly and helpful, arriving quite a bit before checkin time it was nice that they allowed me to check in early. The room itself was perfectly find, it was great to go out onto the tiny balcony and be able to see the beach and the pool a really good spot. I loved that the hotel was so close to the beach so easy to move back and forwards and the pool area was nice as well, full marks for the cushioned sunloungers making things just that little bit more comfortable. There is of course a resort fee here, but at $10 per night it was one of the cheapest I found. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again in the future.

Good central location, good value for the location but not a luxury 4 star type resort. Breakfast buffet restaurant was well done. Bonus of free movie rentals. Convenient store on site was well equipped. No view of beach from rooms, blocked by another building.

It was nice vacation for my family. I am very satisfy all the time that during time. Except wireless internet service at 15th floor. And in case of parking lot, very very need more space. also very nerrow.

Nice hotel with a big open air reception you can happily lounge in while waiting for your room . We arrived very early and they offered to call us whenever a room was free so we could check in early. They can also keep your bags at no extra charge while you walk around. The hotel is just a block away from the beach which is extremely clean. There's a little lagoon, ideal for families with young kids. You can rent a beach umbrella or sun chairs.The rooms are spacious, very clean. Small shower in the bathroom but plenty of towels and toiletries. We had a little balcony with 2 chairs and a little table, nice for a drink in the evening. Staff were friendly and efficient. We were given 20% off the hotel restaurants so we had the breakfast buffet there every morning which was plentiful and had something for everyone (Asian and American), really good scrambled eggs and bacon.

It was a good stay. It really was the location we wanted. Nice and convenient. We all wanted it to come back. My 8-year-old daughter did like the stay in your hotel and left a note. It was long, so I could not remember what she wrote, but all nice about the place and the stay. Thank you for the hospitality you provided. We'd like to come again soon.

It is closed to waikiki beach so location is really good.Facilities and rooms are just okay.Pool was cold and not really clean.Staffs are okay.There is convenience store in the hotel which is quite handy.

We had a great stay at this hotel for three nights. The hotel is located just off the main street in Waikiki - right across from the beach. Perfect location! Free wifi in room and lobby. We checked in to a great room with a perfect view. (room 1014). Close to lots of great restaurants. A great burger place just up the street and across from the beach. Minutes from the Cheesecake Factory. McDonalds on the corner and ABC stores located on every corner. The best location ... Not directly on the beach but a stones throw away. Would definitely recommend. Staff are excellent. Very helpful. We had a late flight out that evening and was doing a tour of Pearl Harbour that morning before checkout. They held our luggage until flight time. Excellent! Would definitely go back and definitely recommend.

A nice hotel close to the beach and a very nice shopping area. The best with the hotel was the cleaning. I have nevear experiensed so fast and top cleaning of the room as under our stay in this hotel.All service personell was very nice and the foyer was hugh end delicate. Thr only negative was that it was very easy ot hear noice from the neighbours

Very helpful staff.Great location.Hotel getting very tired, Rooms were dissapointing. .very small bathroom ..very tight squeeze round bathroom door for the toilet..door opened inwards !!! Shower had a curtain..would rather have a more modern bathroom !!Kitchenette was on bathroom vanity..and bathroom quite dark..

Upon check in, we were met by a very unenthusiastic agent to check us in. We were exhausted from traveling and were just married a few days prior. We weren't asked what brings us to Hawaii, how our trip in was, or anything of the nature. He was very blunt and seemed pre occupied with something else and did the bare minimum to check us into the hotel. I would have left it at that, but every time I went to the front desk the response was similar.

The hotel is centrally located, half a block to the beach (the area protected by the breakwater, so no waves for uncertain swimmers) and half a block from the main local bus routes.When I booked the hotel, I requested a quiet room. It seems that the booking site I used did not use the hotels own description of room types. So the hotel contacted me to advise that my first choice was not quiet and I should select another room type. This time I checked the hotels own web site, which was very clear about each room type. I really appreciated that they bothered to let me know.We arrived early due to an overnight flight and our room was not ready. So we waited in the clear and cool Lobby. It felt safe and I dozed off. The room was on the 17th floor and the view was of other hotels (which would be the same in all centrally located hotels). But I did not plan to spend my time in the room.The hotel itself was quiet, but street noise did carry up to the 17th floor. If you are come from somewhere that is quiet, pack your ear plugs ( I had).The King bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. There was an in room safe, which was perfect for storing passports and tickets.There was free WiFi and a free DVD hire booth, of new release films, in the lobby. The instructions to use the DVD player were very easy to use. Which was ideal when wide awake at 3 am.I would definitely stay here again

Hotel within walking distance to the beach, and very helpful staff. The only downside to this hotel is the shower it was a 3x3 side standing shower barely enough room to turn around but other than that it was a great stay. Limited parking space. Breakfast was good and free movie rental which made enjoyable for my kids at night to watch.

I stayed this resort with my husband. Staffs was very kind and location is very close to beach. Room facilities are little bit old, but clean. I think they need remodeling in someday soon. Anyway, is was good time with ur hotel.

Great breakfast, good variety, great service! Room was clean and well equipped. Wifi free was nice bonus and no password needed. Front desk service prompt and very friendly! Entire experience was great!

This hotel is conveniently located a half block off main street in Waikiki. Which means it's only a half block from beach, shopping and various fast food and sit down restaurants. The hotel is lovely with a beautiful lobby. There is a convenience store in case you forgot anything or just want a snack. There are also 2 restaurants in the hotel too. They offer 2 small parking lots for a fee if you need. There is also a swimming pool to hang out at but with the beautiful beach just steps away the beach is the way to go. The rooms are clean and spacious and the beds are comfortable. The rooms have a balcony with 2 chairs and a small table. There are a couple of coin washers and dryers for your convenience too. This is the 3rd time I come back and stay at this hotel. The staff like Brendan and George make us want tokeep coming back. The rooms for the price make it possible.

I really loved the location annd people great experience would certainly come back, and recommend to friends and family, definitely worth a 5,000 miles in traveling. Beds were also very comfortable and rooms very clean.

We had a great time the people are lovely and the beaches are nice. The weather is beautiful. We caught the public bus around the place and the tours we went on were awesome. The staff at the hotel where lovely and helpful

very nice hotel in a central position,2 minutes of the beach and handy for restaurants. very helpfull staff.had a problem with my wifi and trainee staff on reception was very helpful and sorted the problem within minutes. well organised and very clean hotel.

The location of this hotel is very good, just a few steps away from the beach, with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.The hotel is a little rundown, but the location is hard to beat, and providing you are not expecting luxury, you will probably be pleased to stay here. We enjoyed it.We initially booked a standard room, but were upgraded to a superior room with a partial ocean view (more like an ocean glimpse). There was a little street noise, but it was not too bad. The room was large, the decor was dated, but everything was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. A coffee pot, electric jug, fridge and microwave were provided. The bathroom was spacious and pristine. Water pressure in the shower was good.Breakfast was good, and we specially enjoyed the plentiful, high quality fresh fruit.Staff were very pleasant. Wifi worked well.A minor complaint was the lack of a full length mirror in our room.Overall, a good stay.

The room was small and the facilities definitely needed an overhaul. The dresser drawers were out of order (we made do) and the shower head had a hole where water shot out. My rating is average because not everything was bad, though. The location and staff services were good, and the free beach towel rental was a nice plus. In addition, they had Korean programming on TV which worked out for my Korean parents.

I cannot express enough how wonderful all the staff are at Waikiki Resort Hotel, Susie, Nancy, Branden and especially Scott! We had some bad luck whilst on holiday in Hawaii, dentist, doctor and credit card fraud, the staff at the hotel went out of their way to help us! We were so very grateful , I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Waikiki. Thank you again to all the staff! Also the hotel is in a great location, excellent pool, very clean rooms and the breakfast buffet was fantastic!

My initial room was horrible. There was black mold and spores growing from the ceiling. All was corrected after talking with management. Also George at the front desk is very polite and helpful to his ability. After the initial issue with the first room we were given a different room, a nicer room in my opinion. I don't believe paying to park in the garage or parking lot is very fair. With Waikiki, there is little to no parking. I feel like this is takin advantage of a situation that visitors cannot help. This was my third trip and second time staying at this hotel, first time was a better experience but the helpful nature of the staff made a bad situation better this time.

Very good value for a great location one block away from Waikiki beach. However the rooms were average with only a mini fridge. Very good value hotel/resort restaurant for breakfast. I would rate the resort 3plus.

A 3 week stay cost $177 per night plus $25 per day to park your car and $15 per person per day for breakfast. None of which I was aware of till we arrived. So obviously no option but to pay these prices for what would be a budget hotel in Europe. Not impressed won't go back. As for the room very dated double glazing didn't stop the road noise and was generally not worth the money. Would not use again under any circumstances

Only a block from Waikiki beach so it's close to restaurants and shops. The room had been refurbished and had a comfortable bed. We didn't use the sofa bed. The ocean view was minimal, with most of the view being the hotel in front of ours. Overall, we were happy with our stay. It was nice to have a refrigerator, microwave and electric tea pot. We would stay here again.

We booked a standard room and were upgraded to a corner room with an ocean view. I am very particular about the cleanliness of hotels and the room was very clean and well appointed. The decor of the room is average, the furniture was in good condition but the brown wall paper is a little dated as with some other items such as towel racks, shower rod, shower facets etc. The room had a large balcony and an amazing ocean view. The hotel pool was very clean and well maintained, and all the front desk and housekeeping staff were very friendly. The location is perfect, just a block from the Waikiki Beach and close to all major shopping and restaurants. The buffet breakfast in Llima was included, the buffet was very impressive as a variety of hot/cold items were provided including fresh fruit and salads. We looked forward to our breakfast in Llima everyday "the perfect place to start your day!". I would recommend this property to others and would stay again if the rate competitive.

I don't have a problem recommending this hotel. It may not be on the beach but is a short stroll to Waikiki beach and shops. The check-in was little slow, we had a city view room and could also see part of Diamond Head. The room was a good size with a comfortable bed however the bathroom/toilet was a little cramped but the shower had ample pressure. Breakfast room is not large, the food acceptable but if you want different eggs than what is on offer you have to ask, (not a lot of communication from the staff on what's available). For the price and location it's a good hotel.

The resort was very clean and easily accessed. Parking was a little tight but manageable. Close to the beach and shops so we could easily walk to either. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Good value for the price. Our bed was very comfortable and we got a great nights sleep.

Came to spend my birthday in paradise and I did. Best location, access to food, beach, transportation,. Did some tours, swimmer, ate garlic shrimp. This place was awesome. Way to break up life. ,!!!!!

This hotel was very clean and the rooms comfortable. Beds were very comfortable as well. Very good value. Good facilities in and out of the room, especially the free dvds (obtainable from a machine in the lobby). Lovely pool and friendly staff. I would highly recommend this hotel. Didn't use the bar as only noticed it about a day before we left! Very close to the beach. Ten minute walk to the Zoo, 15/20 minute walk to the aquarium and Diamond Head. There is a great value LUAU at Diamond Head.

This mature hotel is very well maintained and is very convenient to Waikiki Beach as it is just one block away and on a quiet side street. You can walk to the beach, the stores and restaurants, Be in all the hubbub of Waikiki Beach but come home to a quiet night. Staff was helpful and very observant of whats going on in the open lobby. Breakfast was included in our package and was very good and complete.

The location is really good - close to everything. The staff were very friendly, cooperative, and accommodating to insure your stay was great. Room was clean and beds comfortable. Enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Seriously you cant get a better location! This hotel has everything you need and could want for the price you pay. Its far more elaborate than what the price tells you. One block back from the best part of Waikiki beach. This is in the central hub of everything that is happening. Don't stay up near the resorts, you will be walking every day, stay here and jump out of bed and straight on to the beach! The foyer and entrance says it all, its 5 star all the way and that includes the service! The pool area is so clean and space for everyone. The rooms are spacious and clean, the cleaners are beautiful people and do an amazing job. We WILL stay here again!

Room was outdated. Elevators smelled of mold/mildew. Many floors had mattresses leaning up on walls outside of elevators, including our floor! Quite a first impression. Service was good and breakfast was outstanding on the other hand. Location was also good as close to Waikiki Beach.

It was good accommodation for the price. We needed a quick overnight stay between islands. We arrived late at night and checked in nice and quickly with no problems and we also had the buffet breakfast next morning with had a decent selection. They had a great DVD card service which meant you could watch movies for free as well

Beds are good. The room and the hotel in general is in good condition.Waikiki beach is easy accessible (200 meters away), just go to the basement, pickup a towel and then go for a swim. Ok breakfast at a decent cost at the local cafe'.

People are nice and friendly....room was adequate, however smallest shower I have Ever seen in a hotel! Pics online do not display the 30x30 standing box with no bathtub....misleading! When addressed with the front desk were told "that was what you get with the package you purchased". Checked online...nope no mention of that anywhere. Buffet and food were pretty good. Just like everything in HI... pricey!

We stayed here for 7 days. The hotel has perfect location.It is about 3 minutes walk to the beach.Our room was very good and clean.We got nice view. Everyone there was so pleasant and kind. Specially guy who did check in for us was really nice.Thank you George for everything!!!! Best regards!!!Girls from Ukraine!!!!

Good value excellent front desk service at checking and and out, the maids were excellent at keeping this place clean and comfortable, like other guests stayed in this facility the rooms needed some updating and newer furniture.

Our stay was very enjoyable at the hotel. Clean rooms, friendly prompt service. In room internet service was not acceptable, our devices couldn't connect at all. Close to the beach with great balcony view.

I stayed here at the end of a cruise. The horrible part was the extra $90/night to get a room with a view. A bit steep for a room upgrade. The room was nice, the refrigerator, coffee pot, small kitchen sink (no dishes or silverware) and coffee cups wonderful. As always, there's an enormous tv screen across from the bed - like you're going to spend your days in paradise watching tv. The pool was nice but it was annoying to have to get a pool towel in the basement and then have to return the towel there instead of leaving it for housekeeping. Don't eat the scrambled eggs at the breakfast buffet- they taste like whatever shortening they use to keep them from sticking has diesel fuel in it. There is a nice selection of breads for toasting and the toaster works well. Maid service didn't check the balcony so if you're staying for a few days you are in charge of tidying that area up. Very friendly reception desk staff - a huge plus! And the $12 shuttle to the airport is wonderful. Tip the bell desk guy and he'll put your luggage on the shuttle for you. But, I asked him to let me know when the PCC van arrived and he dropped the ball on that. That was the truly outstanding day of my vacation- book a trip to the Polynesian Cultural Center and they pick you up and drop you off at your hotel. Go "Super Ambassador" and you'll never forget it.

the hotel has a perfect location, one block from the beach. Close to malls, restaurants, stores, bus stop.Very comfortable, it is an old hotel, but the rooms don't smell mud or dust. I think it is a great stay specially if the price is not high. the wifi in the room is free and excellent connection.

nice view, good breakfast (Ilima)especially lobby crew is very kind(Reyes.. I remember)but facillity is little bit old..restroom is something wrong with water exhaust.. plz fix it (room 1716)thanks for your kindness

I came on this trip alone for peace and tranquility. I found the perfect place there at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. Everyone there was so pleasant and kind. James at the Expedia counter was fantastic and helped me several times planing my trips and rental car. The restaurants there were also very nice. I have just raved to all my friends about my stay there so now we all going to plan our trip there for next year.

The room was clean! It is about 5minites walk from the beach! It has the excellent location! The overnight parking cost $25 per night though. The counter will give 20% off coupons after you check in! And free dvd movies rental, which is awesome! :-)

stayed here for christmas 2015. it's a decent location, walking distance to waikiki beach and restaurants. the front desk staff and service was excellent, the breakfast buffet service was decent. but these are the only pro points about this outdated hotel. our biggest complaint would be the housekeeping. our room had serious bed bugs or something in those mattresses, and all three of us in the room were seriously plagued by them, and got rashes. also, the expedia concierge service should not be trusted. they completely overcharged us on a tour package. we wish we did more research and booked elsewhere.

Great place to stay for the price. Close to the stores, Waikiki Beach. The store in the hotel had great snacks. Even Green tea bags, instant vietnamese coffee, cup noodles which we could make in our room since there was a hot water maker in the room. We did not have a chance to try the restaurants. Pool was great.

Great hotel and fantastic location,...the hotel is located one block from the beach and the main tourist strip,it is also two blocks from the bus stop ...the rooms although not luxury are neat.....the front desk sstaffs are friendly and always willing to go the extra mile....

It is a great location with walking distance to the beach and shopping. We had plenty of restaurants near by. They offer free DVD rentals also. They had a buffet for breakfast but we did not have time to try it.

I am so impressed with this hotel, it's close to everything, beach, shopping and restaurants.The ovean view room is fantastic!!Room is very clean and spacious.Coco at reception was awesome, organising the same room again for me again after a 3 day trip to Kauai as requested.Book the superior room with ocean views, you will not be disappointed, every year I stay at a different hotel, but I will now keep on staying here, great value!!MahaloChris B

Nice view. Location is good and close to everything. But shower was small and hot water as not consistent. Beds were comfortable. Maybe lower price of parking fee a little bit. Better signs for underground parking.

Pros:1) The location is excellent. A short walk to the beach. Lots of restaurants and shops close by. If you join any tour, they pick you up at the hotel. 2) The services were good but not great. Staffs were attentive. You can use their beach towels for free (you pick them up at the basement and you return them at the end of the day). 3) If you are heading out to the Big Island or Maui for a tour and you don’t want to bring your big luggage, you can leave it in the hotel for a fee. 4) The Korean restaurant and the Llima restaurants served good food and we got a 20% discount as the hotel guests. Cons:1) The pool was not heated and it was icy cold. That’s why it’s always empty. I guess they just thought you would go to the beach instead. 2) It’s a no frill, plain looking room. I don’t remember if there was a mini fridge but I remember there was a small safe. 3) No tub, just a small shower stall. 4) You have to pay for internet connection in your room. The lobby internet connection was pathetic5) No gym. 6) The walls are little thin. Door closing make a big noise.

I travel to Oahu at least 3 times a year.Every time I come to Oahu, I try to book at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. It isn't always available during the times that I look for, but when it is I will always stay there.The location is excellent, the price is very competitive, the rooms are clean and nice and the staff is very friendly and helpful.I highly recommend The Waikiki Resort Hotel to anybody that is thinking of a trip to Oahu.

my stay was very good, i will visit again. The service was excellent, workers were very professional, I like the fact that the hotel was minutes away from the beach. I definitely recommend it to friends. I

This hotel is very beautiful .we loved our housekeeper she was very sweet .only thing is showers small but still liked wish i new there were no microwaves in rooms and would be nice to have continentel breakfast complimentary first time ive been to a hotel that didnt but was really a great experience

Reasonably priced one block from the beach. Staff were very helpful (thankyou Coco and Juan!) rooms clean, spacious, small balcony with table and chairs. Beds were comfortable, pool area lovely and an ice machine Resort fee here is much less than other places (US$10 per day). We were very happy..free wifi and a selection of free DVDs. If I have one small complaint its that we got only 2 coffee bags per day...we would have liked more! Overall I would happily recommend this place for a cheaper alternative to beautiful Waikiki!

Location of this hotel is very close to Waikiki beach so you are always close to the fun. I booked Superior Room, Ocean View which was on the top floor but there are too many buildings blocking ocean view so do not book this hotel if you want to get perfect ocean view, Front desk staff was very friendly. Had to pay $25 per day for parking in the hotel which I think should have been included in the hotel cost but again the close location to the beach was very convenient.

Need to have microwave in all rooms and refrigerator is way to small. Staff was very attentive and accommodating. View of the city wasn't a big deal except for the naked guy exactly across from our room on the eighth floor, and his naked girlfriend. We got quite the show.

Arriving and checking in at the Waikiki Resort was smooth experience. You appreciate that greatly after traveling for over 16 hours, 11 of them on a plane. Room was ready, clean, with a nice decor. Lanai had decent space, regrettably no ocean view but the city view on the 16th floor was not too bad. Rainbows looked great. :)Couple of issues though...location of fridge on floor, under sink in bathroom area is not ideal. One, as it is the bathroom area, upon our arrival, the fridge had several long hairs inside of it, which was kind of gross. Then the amount of bending required to put things in and take them out was annoying. You could not see into the fridge properly without getting on the floor. Elevating the fridge and relocating it out of the bathroom area would be fantastic. The addition of a microwave to the room would be great too (hint,hint)Full disclosure, there was a roach sighting in our bathroom and in one of our friend's rooms which lead to intense scrutiny of our luggage and clothes in an effort to make sure nothing followed us home. Yes, it is the tropics and bugs are to be expected but no one "wants" to see them.Thankfully, there was only the one we each saw, so as to not be creeped out completely.Hotel was perfectly situated for everything we wanted to do in Waikiki which was great. Even walking distance to the car rental office. Very close to the beach with a nice protected area for kids to swim in.Front desk staff was very helpful in sorting out who was smoking (in a non smoking hotel) so that we could breathe in our room as well as helping with our Buffet ticket issue for our child.The Daily buffet breakfast that was included was in the restaurant in the lobby and was good. Decent variety, some dishes had more of a Korean vibe but to be expected as it seems all of Korean Airlines staff stays there when in town. We would have liked the scrambled eggs a little less watery and bacon a lil more crispy but that is a personal preference.Overall, I would return to the Waikiki Resort.

Great staff everywhere, front desk, guest services, house keeping! The rooms are very clean and building is quiet. Not fancy as an upscale hotel, but we had everything we needed and have never been disappointed. This was our third visit and is located close to the beach as well! Good value!

I enjoyed my stay at Waikiki Resort. Location is close to the beach and the hotel is spacious and clean. Friendly and polite staff. Very close to all the shops and restaurants on Waikiki strip. I will come back to stay here again next time with my family.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for our spring break in 2015. This hotel is just steps away from the beach and in a perfect location off of Kalakaua Ave. There is a McDonalds right in front of the hotel, also a Haagen Dazz next door. We had a beautiful "partial ocean view" that we could see straight from the comfy bed which was lovely to wake up to. This hotel is an average hotel, mediocre rooms (ours seemed to be updated), the hallways could use a little tlc. A small kitchette was in our room, good for heating up leftovers. There is a breakfast buffet (which was okay), and sushi restaurant in the hotel as well as a small market. This hotel seemed to be where staff/flight attendants of a china or japan airline stay. The pool isn't very welcoming(we opted out of the pool and went to the beach). Pacific Beach hotel is just across the street with a nice breakfast buffet, The Hula Grill located in the Outrigger is amazing as well as Chucks! Great location, friendly staff, I would stay here again!

Rooms weren't anything to get excited about. The pool was small and shaded for most of the day. No hot tub. Staff was very kind throughout the hotel. I'd stay again. Good price for location but if it's glamour you want, there is nothing to offer here.

We stayed 3 nights. Excellent location for beach and other things. But Restrooms were not clean properly. Bed was not comfortable. Chekin and out is excellent. Customer service is also good. If Restrooms and bed are clean I will give 4 star.

We booked this place last minute. We stayed 14 days. About 75 yards from Waikiki beach. Very good rate for the location. Not much for amenities. No hot tub. Rooms are decently cleaned, not spotless. Bed and pillows were great. Street noise was very loud. Maybe better sliding glass doors would help. Most concierge were helpful and bellman were great. Worth what you pay for. Like the DVD rentals in the lobby. Would stay again.

The staff was very friendly.Hotel was clean and neat. Room was a nice size. A bet nosie at night , spring brake and I was on the 14th floor with slding doors closed. Awesome location,Beach a block away

Great place to stay, smaller compared to other motels which was great, not as busy as the big ones, more personal service. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are great and clean, good furniture and comfortable beds. Easy walk to all the main areas of Waikiki. Bus and trolley pick up close by. Few issues checking in, but Branden at front desk was excellent and helped us out. Would definitely stay there again next time we are in Hawaii. Aloha.

We enjoyed our recent stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel . Our selection criteria was price and nearness to the beach. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located only a half block from the beach. The hotel is very conveniently located near the main Kuhio Avenue city bus line. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

We love to stay at the Waikiki Resort; the location is excellent and the customer service outstanding.The only issue we have is that the price to stay has drastically increased since we started coming many years ago.

This our 4th stay at the Hotel, it has a great location, close to shops,beach transport, very helpful and friendly staff. We always stay in a corner deluxe room, which we enjoy the views of both the ocean and Diamond Head, and we find the location to be away from the noisy areas.

Nice enough hotel; Great location (in the heart of Waikiki)Friendly and helpful staffRoom was a bit small and dated; the tub is super tiny and awkwardBiggest issue was noise (hearing doors slam through the walls) and housekeeping coming at inconvenient times.

A brief but excellent stopover from the outer islands to home. Great location withthebeach, shops and restaurants all nearby. Amenities very good, although our trip was too short to fully appreciate them.

Nice and kind lady in reception, good lication, room upgrades, overall one of good hotels in hawaii. Enjoyed stay in waikiki resort and made me to think that will visit waikiki resort for few days in next hawaii trip

Just returned from a wornderful but short four night stay at the Waikiki Resort in Oahu. Excellant location on the Diamond Head end of the Waikiki beach, it sits back a short distance from the water but easy access to the beach and the main road of shops and restaurants. Clean room, comfortable bed. Safe place to park our car. Friendly reception and helpful staff, especially Coco and I believe it was Nancy who checked us in. The buffet breakfast was fresh and good with meats, eggs, pancakes or french toast and pastries and more. Great fast way to start our days. Only caution is keep the small fridge in the room on #1 or it may freeze your food. Would love to stay here again!

We didn't expect this hotel to be so relaxing but we loved it! Our kids didn't want to leave so we stayed one more night. We didn't get to swim in the pool but staying in the room so comfortable for the kids that they didn't mind missing out on the pool. We definitely will be back!

Staff was very friendly and helpful when we didn't have internet in our room. They upgraded us to another room, Internet was good . Rooms clean and close walk to beach . We would recommend and stay their again.

Location was great a few minutes walk from the beach.We had a comfortable bed, clean room and the housekeeping staff were great. We only had breakfast buffet in the hotel and found the food good and staff friendly.same with the front desk the older men were very helpful and friendly. We had to make changes to our scheduled trip and found Travis from Expedia the hotel concierge extremely helpful and efficient.We made many visits to the hotel shop and thought the service friendly.We would stay here again.

I had to choose and book this hotel after staying in the now closed Mirimar on several other stays. I hate to give bad reviews but there was just a few too many things that went wrong on this visit to give a positive review. Firstly we asked if we could book in as early as possible as we had been on a long flight, well when we returned to the hotel at 2pm we were told the room was ready 'ages ago' but no one called us as my mobile number was an Australian number?? I can't believe the staff have not called an international number in the past.The room was nice enough but there was no sheers on the balcony doors so we couldn't have the curtains pushed back and the door open at all as all the neighbouring buildings has a clear view into the room. The room was just a standard room, I accept that, but all we had was a view to a small back road with apartment buildings. I would never pay extra to have a partial ocean view room let alone an ocean view room, I just don't believe this hotel would have any rooms with such views. Apart from no sheer curtains on the balcony doors I did see a couple of baby cochroaches in the room, there was no other mirror in the room apart from the bathroom which made it difficult for 2 people to get ready if someone was using the sink or hairdryer and someone just needed a mirror and the toilet blocked up completely on the second day. House keeping was a bit hit and miss, it seems it depended on who cleaned your room on a certain day as to wether or not all tasks were done...The pool was on a deck on the 2nd floor and although there was no view (which is often the case in Waikiki hotels) it was a very nice pool, clean with lovely outdoor lounges around. The hotel has a small convenience store in the lobby which was handy but the Japanese (?) woman running it needs to take some 'friendly' lessons, I don't think I got one word out of her during my several visits in there. On the plus side the hotel is in a wonderful location. There are nice places to eat nearby, 2 small blcoks to Kuhio Ave where the buses run and 2 small blocks to the front street and the beach 'lagoon'.The one shining light in the property is a wonderful man called Leo at the 'bell desk'. He was delightful, funny, helpful -going out of his way to find out some information about a transfer to a local tourist destination. He worked hard and always had a smile on his face. Not surprising he used to work at the Mirimar! Thank you Leo for all your smiles and help.

Clean and tidy room but tired in need of upgrade. Staff helpful and friendly. We took Breakfast in the hotel and it was good value, plenty of choice. We had a pleasant stay both before and after our cruise. Good value for the type of hotel

Our 2 night stay at the Waikiki Resort was part of an i cruise package(2 nights land and 7 day cruise) which was a very good deal. The resort is located just a short walk from the beach and the staff was very pleasant and friendly. The room was adequate for the short time we where there. The buffet breakfast which was included in the package was very nice. The food was plentiful, and there was a variety of hot and cold dishes to choose from. I would definitely stay here again for a couple of nights.

Our bedroom is very nice and clean .. Only three minutes walk to the beach..very friendly and helpful staff... Nice breakfast and dinner... The only downfall is the Salesgirl at the gift shop.. We found her very rude...

The hotel location was great, so close to the beach and to the pick up points for sightseeing trolleys. There's plentiful shops and food around. The hotel itself was a bit outdated along with the rest of Waikiki, the hotel is on the cheaper end so you get what you pay for. We were out most of the time so it was okay. Family rooms were great value for money. Rooms are loud and we were on the 15th floor, you can hear everything from below, it was real windy at night and it howled through our doors all night long when we stayed.Front desk staff were quite underwhelming, everyone seemed confused with The Opera system, even the manager herself was unknowledgeavle, I use the same one at work maybe that's why I expect more; most of the front desk staff seemed miserable and we only came across one nice older gentleman at the front desk who actually smiled at us when we came and went in the hotel. The bell desk staff were nice and so were the housekeeping ladies!

Good: The resort fee is low and the room was fresh. Bad: Regarding the servicelevel: We asked the reception for help with a remote to the Tv/dvd, the Woman at the front desk looked at us like "why are you bothering me with this?" and didn't even write down our room-number. Off course we never got the remote fixed so we were unable to use the "rent a dvd" service. We have never been treated with this kind of negligence when we have stayed at a hotel so we don't recommend this hotel.

A stretegically placed hotel, half a block from Waikiki beach; close to shuttle buses, that take you on numerous excursions; as well as cheap breakfast eats! Wonderful staff, and pretty too! Tony DiBenedetto

Our family really enjoyed the Waikiki Resort Hotel over the holidays. The highlight of the stay was our interaction with the front desk personnel, in particular June Tsukayama. Our flight arrived early in the morning before check-in, and one of the elderly mothers in our family was sick. June noticed that our mom had fallen asleep and woke up her to inform her that an early hotel room was available. This was much appreciated!! Thank you for your excellent customer service.

eggs in restaurant were under cooked, need to change food . movies were great idea. pool was to cold to swim in it. location awesome, activity provider's were great at their job. enjoyed all activities planned

We stayed at this hotel as a family member was ill and at Queens Hospital--not your typical Hawaiian getaway. However, the hotel went well beyond expectations for our entire stay. June, at the front desk, was extremely helpful and extended a 6 pm checkout once things went poorly at the hospital. They were all very kind. The pool was small; however, it was very clean and never crowded. The location was fabulous and the price was very, very reasonable compared to others in the area!
