"I would stay here again "Its one block from the beach, and you can have a front door for buses to go on tours, pickup and drop off right here.Good location for tours,,terrible City View, Bathroom ventilation

Me and my family stayed there July 1st-4th . Our room (standard room) was located on Koa Ave side. Every morning @ 5am there were garbage trucks making their rounds and @ 6am a staging area for tour buses (nothing but the sound of air brakes) on Koa Ave . I complained the first two mornings. The first morning the front desk said the hotel was booked full and we couldn't be moved . The second morning I got the run around from the front desk saying the building is old and blah, blah ,blah . When I made the reservations there was no disclaimer saying " beware early morning NOISE ". The main reason this hotel gets high rating is because it is only a block from the beach .

Booked direct on line.Obtained very competitive rate from Mr Lee for a 2 night and follow up 11 night stay. Room ready on check in quoted a partial ocean view .Room was outstanding almoost full ocean view .Rooms are compact but spotless and well serviced daily. Small maintenance problem attended to promptly. All staff excellent from check in to check out .Resturant great value and quality for breakfast .Pool area spotless and plenty of room.Loaction is best value for money at any of the six hotels we have stayed in at Waikiki.Will look no where else for return visits

Great hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast buffet was well worth the price, needs to have the buffet open for dinner. The room was very quiet no outside noise at all. Wifi should be available in rooms at no extra cost not only in the lobby. I would definitely recommend this accommodation to any of my friends planning to stay in Hawaii.

We arrived at 10:45a.m. had to wait until 3:00p.m. check-in. It was a waist of our time. Was upset to see people checking in at 11:30a.m. as we checked out. Next time we will do better at saving our time. Has a good location.

The room is ok size but bathroom is really small and not airconditioned. Staff are friendly though. Parking is 25/night. Their spaces are very limited. You don't really need a car if you plan to join tours most of the time. Ther will pick you up. The location is great, only 1 block away from the beach.

The staff was excellent, very helpful, and also extremely friendly. 2 min walk to beach, and great buffet breakfast which was very affordable. Only one issue with the room that was corrected as soon as I reported it.

Nice hotel only 1 block from Waikiki beach. You don't need an ocean view room - just walk to the ocean!. The hotel was In decent shape but carpets could use an upgrade. Rooms were a bit cramped but again normal for the Waikiki area.Hotel caters to Korean guests with an on-site Korean BBQ restaurant plus has a Korean Air ticket office. No problems with parking, but it was full several times. We found better rates by going to hotel website - all of the hotel search websites wanted to charge an extra fee. It pays to shop around!!!! $25 daily parking fee and $10 daily Internet/DVD fee - pretty standard

We picked this hotel to celebrate my birthday with my family (2adts/2 chd) for a couple of reasons, firstly the location - it is so close to the beach and secondly the reviews of the excellent customer service. Well, the first didn't disappoint,the location is incredible you are literally less than a minutes walk and you are in the bluest water I have ever seen. The second, well......our first experience at the hotel wasn't great. Before we left we had emailed the hotel requesting early check in (yes we understood it was a request only), a high floor and telling them that we were coming to celebrate my birthday. We arrived at 8 and was told that in a kurt way that check in was at 3 and to check back at 2. I explained that we had requested early check in and was told the same thing, after a long flight all we wanted was a shower and to rest for an hour - the kids were exhausted. So we accepted the rudeness, and sat in the lobby. Then we saw other guests being served by a different person, who were also told the same thing, but in a much nicer way and they were having their registration forms done - we weren't offered that. I then went back about 1130 and asked if there had been any change, by this stage another staff member was there and the original staff member was now being very nice to me - wishing me a happy birthday doing my registration and said my room was being cleaned as we spoke. Our room was fine, it had 2 double beds, and a small balcony. The bathroom was small and adequate. Then we discovered a couple of small things that that cleaners had missed but that was enough for me to ask to change rooms. This is when our holiday got much better, I met Branden - he is the most amazing and kind person I have ever met. I explained what had happened to me this morning and the concerns I had with our room. He listened and then went and saw the manager to see how they could make our stay more enjoyable. They upgraded us to Penthouse A, which was incredible. We were more than happy - and very grateful. We then received champagne and those yummy Hawaiian biscuits as a birthday gift - once again so appreciative. Branden continued to check on us during our stay, to make sure everything is ok. He is a great ambassador for this hotel - he turned our average start to the best holiday ever. I have to mention the beds were the most comfortable hotel beds that I have ever stayed in, and we travel a lot!! If you are looking for a hotel that is close to the beach and not overly priced this is the hotel for you - would I stay here again - absolutely. Thanks Waikiki Resort for a great holiday.

I really enjoyed our stay before taking the cruise ship, staff was friendly, room a good size, 1/2 block from the beach great location. Price for the breakfast buffet was good compared to local restaurant that only gave menu items. Walking distance to the beach, local transportation and all the high end shops.

It is basic. You have a room and a tv. A shower that is sufficient nothing great. The view was of the roof to another building which housed the air conditioning so opening the window was loud. No Wifi in the room meaning you had to go to the lobby. What is this the 90's? they even have an internet room, I thought they had long since disappeared. Service was friendly and it was close to the beach. Very limited tea and coffee set up. No where to really dry your clothes.

Place has an odor in the hallways and the parking lot smells from garbage. Great location but would not stay there again. There is only one place to park and it is in the basement. Main selling point was the location of the hotel but too pricey for what you get

So many affordable hotels in Waikiki are either depressing or just plain gross! Not what you want for your hard earned money. This place caters mainly to a Korian clientele and is clean and reasonably nice looking. If only the rooms had bathtubs like I expect any hotel to have.

Lovely hotel with spacious rooms, just a short walk to Waikiki beach. Lacked the extra facilities of a more expensive hotel, such as free wifi in the rooms (only in the hotel lobby), no free water and shops a little further away.

The room we had was a dive.Small, smelly, no beach view (actually my windows looked right into the neighbors living rooms_and not pretty ones) the carpet looks like hasn't been replaced since the Orange days in the 70's. No frills but the basics. The sink had seen better days ....BUT, it was quiet, clean, and we had purchased it as a package with Aloha air.SO NOT ALL ROOMS ARE CREATED EQUAL when it comes to discounted prices. I guess we could have complained and gotten a better one, but I gave it 4 stars, because we are travelers, not tourists. We loved the fact that it was right in the middle of Waikiki. Just walking distance from all major restaurants, the beach and whatever you need.I do not recommend to have breakfast in the hotel because I'm a foodie :). It might be worth to walk towards the Sheraton and spend the money you saved on hotel in a memorable meal with a view.( but that is just me). All and all, I will keep this resort into consideration when planning another visit to Honolulu.

The staff are wonderful and attentive, Be aware if you are offered rooms on the penthouse level as some of these rooms are tiny. Breakfast is worthwhile and sets you up for the rest of the day. Hotel is ideally located for beach, shops and transport.

We paid $255/night for staying at this hotel. The location was great and the staff were nice but the check in process took forever. There's only free WiFi in the lobby, not in the rooms. The room was pretty old looking and the carpet was bad. The sink was the smallest sink I've ever seen and the light fixtures were crooked and missing in the bathroom. I've stayed in much nicer places in Waikiki for cheaper.

The room was beautifully kept, the beds were very comfortable and the staff was outstanding and always willing to help! However, the shower curtain smelled! That was our one and only complaint! The price can not be beat! You get WAY more than you pay for! If I ever return to Waikiki, I will definitely book with Waikiki resort hotel again!

I stayed here based off of other travelers reviews. The location is great...it's right across the street from the beach, within walking distance to great shopping and restaurants and the staff was great. However, I was disappointed with my room. I walked in and there was a musty smell, it was extremely dusty and moldy, there was hair all over the bathroom, and the carpet did not look clean.

Wanted to spend the night in Waikiki for my birthday, and the room was a great deal for the price, complete with partial ocean view so I could check the surf. The staff was very friendly and made me feel special. Room was clean and there is plenty of parking. Would stay again.

Necessary things are contented simply.Location is convenient for every activities.Staff of lobby counter is satisfactory in reception and information given for my request.Considering value and budget, first choice may possible in next visit.

As always our stay was very enjoyable and relaxing. We always look forward for our next staycation. We love staying at the Waikiki resort because the staff are so helpful and friendly. Thank you so much for making our stay a very enjoyable one. Sincerely,Mr. and Mrs. Caesar Caberto Sr.

Resort personnel are very cheerful, accommodating and quick! My room then was great facing the beach. Just that, no smoking in the terrace and swimming pool opens at 9 AM and closes early, too. Anyway, we have the beach as the first option. Great!

rooms were clean and basic which is all your need to sleep. close to the beach and bus stop made getting around easy. most of the staff was friendly and helpful. free internet in the lobby was great too.

I personally liked how even on the hottest day the hotel managed to stay cool. My room was spacious for my price as well. Due to experiencing only one night, I would happily stay here again. Very friendly service also helped.

We really enjoyed our stay here the room was quiet and beds were comfortable front reception staff were very friendly and helpful. It's well priced for Waikiki hotels and the breakfast was good. Close to beach and main shopping strip. Would stay here again thanks for a nice 5 night stay

The location was good but the room was a disappointment. The bathroom was barely functional and the ocean view was only from one side of the room, there were no photos available online of the bathroom and minimal of the hotel at all. I would not stay here again, it was definitely not worth upgrading our room selection. The lack of room service and gym added to the disappointment. The cleaning staff were on the ball which was a good point.

We enjoyed our stay, the location, one block from the beach & Main Street was ideal. The room service was ok however our room was made up very late most days and was missed completely on one day. Front desk staff were always very helpful with any requests we had.

My family does a Waikiki stay-cation once a year and only stay here. The staff & management are always very friendly and helpful. Branden at the front desk is so awesome! It’s been a year and he remembered us. The beds are comfortable and love the pillows! Text messaging from the staff to see how our stay is so far and if we needed anything is a great new service. We enjoy the daily breakfast buffet and Park is great, he can’t believe how much our daughter has grown over the years. We’re looking forward to next year. It’s like our home away from home!

Just a block back from the main beach and busy tourist shops yet surprisingly quiet. We has a sea view from our balcony which was great and everyday was perfect. Hotel had everything and the rooms where a good size as we had 2 double beds and still plenty of room for the shopping and souvenirs. Just a shame that there was no free WiFi available in the rooms.

Very good location as far as beach access. This is no 5 star resort by any means. It is what it is, close to Waikiki beach, decent for price. I gave 3 stars, because it is average. Nothing spectacular, nothing bad. The decor is somewhat dated, the room could use some maintenance and upgrades, but I assume that all the hotels are about the same. Part of our stay was here, part was on the East side of Island at The Aulani. If you can afford to stay at Aulani the entire trip, do it. Waikiki beach is really nothing special.

We got this hotel at a fantastic price for somewhere so close to the beach. I was a little unsure if it would be totally dodgy. But I was pleasantly surprised. It could definitely do with a refurbish but the rooms are a good size, clean and the beds are very comfortable. If I had to pick a fault it would be that the hot water isn't as hot as I like it and the doors are a bit thin so you can hear the noise in the hallway.It's a fantastic location. A 20 second walk and you are at the beach. There is a handy McDonalds for late night snacks. It's also very close to the Duke statue which is the pick up point for all the trolleys and buses. All the staff were friendly and helpful. My favourite staff member was June on reception. A real friendly face!For this price and location I would definitely stay again.

Good location with many surf rental near by. Warm welcome at front desk. Too bad for extra charge for in room internet service, but free only at lobby. I got seaview with the surf spot of Waikiki beach. Smoking at Balcony should be allowed. Over night parking was reasonable. Not bad for Waikiki

Awesome & Very Satisfied》Starting with Management: They were kind, helpful and very accommodating. Room service: Fast & clean :) ▪ room was adequate, very pleased. Air condition was cold and very quiet lighting was sufficiant, and carpet was clean.  ▪ bed & pillows was the bomb! Super Comfortable and so relaxing.  ▪ bathroom & shower-shower size was a bit small, but overall it was very  clean and up to date! The bathroom vanity was separate from the shower room but was spacious enough for 2 people. This hotel although small in comparison to neighboring hotels, it carries its own weight. It's self sufficient, and has all the ammenities larger hotels offer. This makes it very accommodating for those who wish to stay indoors. We had breakfast at their buffet every morning, Excellent, very resonable and large variety to choose from. Much of our time was spent at the pool, loved it, very clean and great place to lay back and relax.Hotel location is the reason why we always come back here. It's near everything and walking distance to Resturants, ABC stores, Shopping, beach, etc. Our overall assessement: Clean, Comfortable & Affordable. Great hotel choice in Waikiki. Looking forward to our next stay here. Mahalo nui loa ♥

Needed some updating and upgrades. The area is great very close to beach and shopping. The staff was very nice and helpful, especially George! Rooms very old looking carpets horrible and dirty. No water pressure in shower.

This was good value for money, comfortable accommodation in a great location. Yes the building could do with some cosmetic upgrades but it still provides travellers with clean, comfortable rooms in a top spot. Would stay again

Our vacation was amazing. The bathroom was making some weird squeeky sounds some of the nights we were there but other than that it was great! The beach was close by and all of the stores were too!!!!

Bathtub very small; could not determine how to turn on shower (seemed to be no valve). Desk staff very helpful. Drive in area small. Limited parking in basement area; had to park in Manager's space one night. Excellent location for walking to beach, shopping, restaurants.

Loved the room and I recieved a complementary upgrade to an ocean view which was awesome. I have to say this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were awesome. I felt very comfortable in the room and the the temperature was well-controlled. Did I mention the ocean View. There are a couple of minor things: one is parking which is limited and the spots were really tight downstairs. I recommend valet. The downstairs lobby bathroom is key entry only so if you have kids they have to have the key, same if you have guests. Lastly you have to pay extra for Internet access in your room. Overall I high quality hotel. The breakfast buffet was delicious with wide variety including miso soup. Yum!!!!

So close to the beach and other amenities. Enjoyed our stay, outdoor pool could have been bigger but other than thst , very happy with our accommodations. Concierge and staff were very helpful. Thank you.

This was a Stay-cation for us, which we do on a regular basis and I have to say this hotel was the best yet for the price we paid. The beds were fantastic and the bathroom was newly renovated. What it really needs is new carpet but that was minor for me. The staff is very friendly and helpful. To the location you can't complain at all because it is right by the beach. The pool area is also great. My overall experience was awesome this is why I defiantly will stay there again.

The hotel was very nice and more importantly very convenient to the beach and surrounding area. We would definitely stay there again.Your associates were always helpful and friendly. The rooms were always clean and set up in a cheerful way. We had a 6 year old with us and she was so happy to see her special pillow and teddy bear on the clean bed every night when we got back to the room. it's these little touches that made the stay even more enjoyable.

The resort is not a fancy one but the price is pretty reasonableThe thing I would like to give 5 stars is the location, Just 30 sec to the beach.staff are very kind and supportive!plz don expect too much things with this price.

First off, Branden at the front desk provided fantastic customer service.This hotel is also located very conveniently two blocks from the beach, and within walking distance of many restaurants, shops, and even a grocery store.Definitely worth a stay.

We enjoyed our stay at Waikiki Resort. It is good value but the bathrooms need renovation. The rooms are comfortable, the staff very helpful and the location is excellent. I would recommend the hotel to others. It is within easy walking distance of the beach, shops and top restaurants.

Have stayed here on many trips. Great location just off main drag. Central to everything. Big rooms with brekky. Great value for money. Staff very friendly and efficient. Nothing too much trouble. Highly recommend this to anyone wanting great value for money in waikiki

After realizing that Korean Airlines (KAL) owned this hotel, considering the sleek ad campaigns of this company & the handsome uniformed crew, the look, theme, maintenance & appearance of this hotel should have been consistent. There's lots of wear & tear notably the carpeting in the guest rooms that should be the first order of business once they renovate. The bed is surprisingly comfortable. The Front Desk staff that are predominantly male & Asians were very friendly. The restaurants on the premises, the pool & the spa are definitely plus factors.

This hotel was a pleasant surprise. In a place where everything is a little overpriced, this is a fantastic place where you can stay very comfortable with great value. The fee to park the car was a little too expensive but, regardless, the overall experience is very positive.

Great view from our 16th floor room. Friendly staff and close to beach and all that Waikiki has to offer, will likely be back. Close to great restaurants and shopping, shower was small but adequate comfortable bedding.

3 nights at Waikiki resort were fantastic. Breakfast was really good each morning and location as well. Comfortable bed with a good view. I would definitely stay at Waikiki again. It's close to the beach, zoo,aquarium And shopping center.

I got this hotel for a weekend last minute for a great price. The hallways were creepy but the room was nice. I wish the hallways were a bit brighter. However the service was very exceptional and the staff were all so friendly!

Great place...our mini suite bathroom left a little to be desired given the 1/4 sized sink but over all comfortable accommodations. I would definitely recommend this establishment for families looking to be close to waikiki beach.

The GOOD-This Hotel is in a great location just back from the beach.-The staff are extremely helpful and courteous.- The beds are comfy not that we spent much time in the room when there is so much to see and explore.The BadThis hotel was completely full with Korean tourists and groups which would not bother me in any way shape or form under normal circumstances. However someone should courteously informed them of some simple Hotel etiquette. Firstly one does not continue cramming people into a lift when it is already full.Secondly one waits for people to exit the lift before one barges on in.Thirdly Just because one person in your group of 50 is at the beginning of the line for breakfast does not mean that the rest of your group can just push your way past all the other people patiently waiting.And lastly one closes a hotel room door not just walk out and let it slam behind you.All in all we had a great week the Hotel was good for the price and in a very convenient place.

Great location Very helpful friendly staffVery clean rooms that had great beach views only one street back from main part of beach central to everywhere Tours pick up outside the door and they arranged some great day trip at affordable prices

The location was excellent, just a block away from the beach and close to restaurants and shops.The area felt safe and secure during the day and not too bad at night. We confident enough to walk outside at night.The room was clean. The elevator was reliable. Service at the front desk was effective and efficient. Asking about our experience by text message the day after our arrival was very much welcome and gave us a convenient means to ask questions and share our impressions.

Location ideal being only one block back from beachAll the staff were very friendly and helpful on a number of queriesWe were very happy with an upgrade to a partial beach viewfrom our balcony which was allocated upon our arrival

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort for 7 nights with our 2 year old son. It is a very nice hotel in a very convenient location, very friendly & helpful staff - all our needs were met and we will not hesitate to stay there again. It is within walking distance to Honolulu Zoo, the Aquarium & main Waikiki beach. We absolutely loved our stay!

Conveniently located 1 block from the beach. Some rooms have small kitchenette, great for health or budget conscious travellers. We stayed in a Corner room which had ample space so you don't feel like you are running into each other. King size bed was heaven, & room clean. Karaoke Bar offers great meals & an extensive drinks menu. Also Korean Restaurant, convenience store, Beauty Spa & a couple of specialty stores also to satisfy most immediate needs.

Nice hotel, surroundings slightly dated. Great reception staff, who were very friendly and helpful. Tour operator very knowledgeable and suggested some good options. Hotel was easy walking distance from Waikiki beach and public transport.

We were very pleased - room with view out towards the beach, beds and all facilities we needed (wifi, laundry, little shop off lobby), everything was clean and in good repair. We found staff very helpful.

Great spot good staff helpful and nice!Rooms ova priced but that's Waikiki very close to beach And restaurants shopping etc! Nightlife a little up the main road but not too far to walk! Overall a great spot I'm very happy to go again

My husband and I visited Oahu for our anniversary and I thought I could save some money by booking a cheap hotel. Unfortunately, I ate my words as soon as we got there! At first sight, you can tell that the hotel is older and in much need of a renovation. We pulled up and immediately noticed that the hotel did not have valet parking! In fact, there are 2 self-parking places to choose from (basement or outdoor in the lot). Parking is scarce and $25 a night. When my husband and I would return late at night, we would be lucky to find any parking in their tight spaces. In addition, I didn't think the service there was anything special. I actually found their service rather slow and was hesitant to ask the front desk of any questions in fear that I would have to stand there for too long just to get an answer.The hotel itself doesn't have much to offer. The pool is tiny and was always packed whenever we checked it out. There's a convenience store downstairs next to another small vitamin (I think it was a vitamin shop) store, bar, and restaurant. In addition, the rooms are pretty small with an even smaller bathroom! If you have a fear of tight spaces, I wouldn't recommend this hotel for you.The only positive aspect to this hotel is its location...other than its price in comparison to nearby hotels! It's a few minutes away from Waikiki Beach and is within walking distance of Waikiki's main attractions. If you're willing to sacrifice luxury and decency, then this place is definitely for you. Otherwise, you get what you pay for and it isn't much...

I have stayed in 18 hotels/resorts in the past 32 days.Five star to 2 star.I rate this resort very highly now returning back for a second time.Extremely pleasant and well priced accommodation.Highly recommended.

My wife and I recently stayed at Waikiki Resort Hotel and it was wonderful. Great room size, clean and extremely helpful staff. The place was great and we would recommend this hotel to all. Breakfast was great too!

Great open lobby, all staff were really friendly and helpful. Breakfast place was good value for money. Rooms were a little out dated but did the job. Pool was good needed a few more umbrellas. Great location only a 2 min walk to the beach. Also had a emart down stairs would stay there again.

We booked this trip through Expedia as a flight and 5 night stay combo. Upgraded to a one bedroom penthouse as a birthday treat for myself. We had penthouse A. Upon arrival, there was a nice little box of cookies from Honolulu Cookie company and a welcome note which was a nice touch. The room is a little dated in terms of the decor...but very clean. What it lacked in sophistication, it made up for in space. I loved the large 3 bay room layout...a kitchenette and dining table, a living room, and a separate bedroom and bathroom. The view from the large balcony that spanned the length of the entire suite was pretty good too...Facing West towards Waikiki. There was a small view of the ocean over the parking garage across the street. I didn't care for the quality of the toiletries..the soaps and shampoos didn't lather, and the smell of the body lotion was a bit foul (so you might want to bring your own). The location of the hotel is great...one short block from the beach and tonnes of shopping and restaurant options. The pool was ok...clean and not used often. Probably because it is very small and basic. Overall it was a decent stay. Staff were very friendly. The lobby was a little crowded at times but it is crowded almost everywhere in Waikiki. This is a good budget option if all you need is a conveniently located, clean place to sleep and don't care about decor, a glamorous pool, or views from lower floors. If I had more money I'd stay somewhere a little more renovated, but with the penthouse upgrade we were quite happy.

Great location, friendly staff. Wonderful open air lobby; clean rooms.Suggest getting room on upper floors to minimize street noise. Elevators are fast, so no worries there.Good breakfast, pricy unless included in room package (ours was). Tiny shower stall in our room, but others we traveled with had tubs in their rooms, so not an issue.Didn't use pool, but it looked nice. Beach is SO close, you'll want to go there instead!

We have just retuned from an 11 night stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel and after reading some of the reviews were a bit aprehensive about our choice,from the time we arrived until we left we couldn't have asked for more,Bell Captain Dennis,Reception staff Nancy,George and Branden were all so helpful and polite,housekeeping excellent,and location sensational,yeah it's a bit dated but rooms were clean ,beds and pillows comfy,we hardly were in our rooms ,so much to do and see,not sure what all the negative reviews are about,if we ever get the chance to return to Honolulu we wouldn't stay anywhere else

This was a good hotel with a good location. Some of the facilities were a little worn, but this was generally a good value given the location. We used the pool, which was good but a bit small. It is a block away from the beach.

Excellent location to everything. Good value. Our corner room had a decent view of the beach & Diamond Head even though it was looking through other hotels. Staff were helpful. Only negative was that the pool was a bit shabby so we didn't use it.

I am a repeat customer and would go back again and always.Convenient location, clean room and great service from staff. I don't stay at hotel room much but enjoyed the Ocena View from balcony whenever I was able to look out. Loren Shim and reservation team is always accommodating and go extra miles to help. Thank you.

Location was fantastic and room was nice and big. The bed was comfy and the room servicing was to a high standard. The kitchenette we had was a little limiting as it only had one small saucepan and small fry pan however it was still handy.

If you are looking for granite bathroom counter tops and travertine floors, this is not the place for you. This hotel is a bit older and needs some updating here and there although it is perfectly acceptable with great service from everyone. My room was spotless and very well maintained. I was on the 18th floor with a "city view" room but I could actually see the water and beach Housekeeping made sure everything was ship-shape each day. The location of the hotel was excellent...maybe 1/2 block back from Waikiki beach. Two minutes at the most and you were on Waikiki Beach. The pool was very clean and mostly vacant of guests. It was like you had your own private pool. Very nice. I took of a package deal offered from the hotel that included free wifi and breakfast each day on top of the very reasonable room rate. This hotel is a great value. Everything you need without the high prices of the resort hotels that are beachfront. The wifi was actually fast and efficient. The breakfast buffet was tasty and got your day off to a great start. I would return to this place in a heartbeat next time I spend some time in Waikiki Beach. I can't say enough about all the great customer service I received from everyone . As I said, "What a great find"

Neat and clean a handy location. Very helpful staff. Bathroom was a little odd with door hitting the toilet when opened. Toilet was low. View from balcony was OK able to see the beach between other hotels. Main complaints were that doors to rooms were rather noisy when closing and bed was a little soft.

its a block from Waikiki beach and the restaurants and shopping, so location is great. my room had ocean view and balcony which was nice to sit and watch the surfers in the morning. others in my group were on opposite side of hotel so their view was of local apartments (not the most attractive sight)overall, it has all the basics and was clean, good location. good for one or two night. for longer stays, i would recommed looking into ones next door that offer a few more anemeties and luau discounts

Stayed there 3 years ago and are going back in July. Couldn't fault the service or the rooms. Comfortable and convenient location. Can't wait to visit again. So close to everything, just a short stroll to the beach and the Main Street. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Neat and clean hotel close to the main strip. Asked for a room with a microwave to make food for our baby and even though it didn't come with the room we booked it was available so they gave us that room. Baby cot was included at no extra cost.

Staff was friendly n the beds was comfortable. The hotel was close to 6he beach. The bathroom was a little too small, the hotel had a nice little balcony, but the view was of other hotels, didn't see the beach.

Great stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good accommodation. Close proximity to beaches and restaurants. Helpful to have parking on-site. Gnerally quiet hotel. Good service and clean and comfortable rooms.

Waikiki Resort is in an excellent position for easy walking around the Diamond head end of Waikiki beach. The rooms are comfortable and the aircon worked well. We were on the 14th floor and never had to wait long for the lifts. We found all the staff very helpful. It would be nice if the WiFi was included in the cost of the rooms, rather than having to go done to the lobby. In todays world we all need Wifi. The taxi service is across the street which made getting around easy also. While this resort is a bit aged I would stay here again if returning to Oahu.

This hotel was amazing! Great location, friendly staff. Convenient shops and restaurants within the hotel. Really great service! Highly recommend to all and for families.Came to Honolulu with my kids and we felt at home at this Hotel.

My husband & I enjoyed 8 day stay in this hotel. Older type but spotlessly clean. We had other family members staying in the hotel which catered to their budgets. We had a room with King bed, lounge setting & balcony where we could view the sea. My husband left his shopping bag in the lobby which was returned in tact. I left my book at the pool again it was returned by housekeeping. we arrived a day before our booking but were catered to immediately (late flight in). Brandon on front desk gave excellent service to our needs from this first night until calling for our taxi to the airport on last night. This hotel situation was perfect for our needs & central to all that we wanted. Yes some noise from buses outside and the doors do make a clanking noise on closing but hey for the price we paid I have no complaints. Would stay again.

This hotel is an older property in a great location. Out room was decent sized and fairly updated. There was a lot of noise in the hallways in the late evenings, and a lot of street noise. I believe wifi was only available in the lobby. I would stay here again.

On arrival we were told we had been placed in a room with two double beds instead of a king bed because I did not specify in my booking we were a married couple travelling. I let the attendant know there was no where when booking directly through the hotels website to specify what bed I would like or that we were a couple travelling together. I was then offered a room upgrade at a cost to me and declined this. I was then offered another room that myself and my husband went to look at but this room only had 1 double bed and was not appropriate as it was next to the elevator. Finally after a long period of time they were able to locate a room for us in our price range. The service was fairly average and I don't agree with offering upgrades to people on arrival because they are in a room with 2 double beds at there own expense, if I had wanted a better room I would of booked it. The room was adequate although I stress this that the hotel is the nosiest I have ever stayed in. You hear everything, including the elevator and we weren't all that close to it, anyone in the hallways and every door closing. I had a few awful nights sleep and was woken up early everyday.Breakfast is advertised to be served until 10:30 am in the elevator although my husband and I arrived before 10 am and they were packing everything away and we were told we would have to get only what was left and could only go up once to the buffet as they were packing it up. WiFi at the hotel is good in your room but you have to pay extra for it.On that note you have to pay extra for everything. I wanted to print off our boarding passes for our flight home and had to pay $4.00 to access them and print them in there internet centre even though I had already paid for internet in my room. They also charge you to mind you bags so I didn't bother with that. Lots of little add on extras, nothing is included.Good location to everything however very windy around the hotel.Staff service is fairly average, and had to go down to the car park to get some pool towels not ideal. Leah in housekeeping was lovely I left my safe open by accident and she made sure security came up and locked it just in case and a note was left to let me know. I spoke with her when I went down to get towels and she remembered my room number and told me again about the safe. A no frills hotel, don't expect too much if you decide to stay there, however is one of the more affordable hotels for it's location.

We thoroughly enjoyed our seven days at this hotel. We were on the fourteenth floor and enjoyed everything. Our room and amenities were Great. The Airconditioning worked great. The cleaning staff was the Best we have ever had and the staff downstairs were very helpful in ever way aspect. This building has some age but it is very well maintained. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. The only thing I really didn't like was their $25.00 per day car parking space fee. Other than that we enjoyed everything this hotel had to offer. It had free wifi downstairs in the lobby.

My family of 4 stayed in a standard room for a week, and we enjoyed our stay. The pros of this hotel are that it is a very affordable place to stay in Hawaii, it is close to the beach and shops/restaurants, the room was clean and beds were comfortable, the front desk staff, bell man, and restaurant (Ilima Café) staff were very friendly. The Ilima Café had a great breakfast buffet for a good price. We received a discount since we stayed at the hotel. Matt at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. I cannot remember his name, but my receipt says C. Barnett was the one who helped us book our day trip to the North Shore. He was full of helpful information and very friendly. The bell man was nice enough to store our luggage for free on our last day since our flight didn't leave until 7PM. This made it possible for my family to spend our last day on the beach instead of worrying about our things. This restaurant is within walking distance of many stores and restaurants. You are literally 1 minute away from the beach. The only cons that I can think of are that our refrigerator in room 612 was not very cold, and I didn't see a setting to adjust it. I mentioned this to the front desk and the man didn't act very concerned. My husband and I chose not to worry about this minor issue since we were eating out everyday anyway. The one and only time we did put food in the fridge it reeked the next morning. There is no microwave in the room, but maybe it is a fire hazard. The noise coming from the street may be an issue for light-sleepers. It wasn't an issue for my family since we were all exhausted every night and slept like rocks. If you want less noise then you may want to move to a higher floor. And the pool was clean, but ice cold. My kids were a little disappointed that the water was freezing, because they usually love swimming in the pool, as well as the beach, when we go on vacation. Over all, we had a good stay and would return. The front of the hotel is beautiful since the lobby is open and the nice, Hawaiian breeze can be felt. Free wifi is offered in the lobby, but not in the rooms. This hotel is not "luxury" by any means but it was exactly what my family was looking for. Through Expedia my flights and hotel were booked for less than $4,000 and this is the type of mid-range hotel that you can expect in Hawaii for that price. If you're looking for luxury, then expect to pay about $10,000 for a weeks stay. My family spent most of our time on the beach and walking around, but it was nice to have a clean, comfortable room to return to.

i loved this hotel, had amenities such as parking(is a nightly fee) laundry, in room safe, comfortable, all of the employees are courteous and friendly, even the maintenance guys. expedia person was very informative. hotels is very close to the beach and bus stops and trolley stops, stores restaurants. loved the location of this hotel. would chose this one next time i come to waikiki. room cleaned on a daily basis.

Excellent location, close to beach. staff very helpful, concierge organised all our activities, no hassles . Package included free wifi and breakfast, so great value. Shop in lobby has most items you need. Room clean. Had problem with toilet and fixed straight away. Would highly recommend.

Waikiki Resort is a nice hotel.The hotel was very close to the beach..The staff was very helpful and pleasant.I would recommend this hotel to a friend.I plan to Stay there again in my next trip to Honolulu.

Our Stay was comfortable and pleasant. Staff were helpful all round. Location is great - 100 yards (meters) to beach, main road with all stores, restaurants and public transport. No need to pack Beach Towels (were provided free of charge).

Great location from the Beach. Lots of things to do close by. Stand up paddle boarding was great. Rooms were cleaned early and always ready when we came back in the afternoon. Close to bus line which we used often. We would stay there again.

We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was great. We stayed on the 17th floor and had a partial ocean view, the view of the city at night from our Lanai was gorgeous. We got the deal that included breakfast and internet, the internet was touch and go from our room but the breakfast was lovely, plenty of variety and the food was always hot and well cooked. The rooms are a bit out dated as many have said but we didnt care, the bed was comfortable and it was really just a place to lay our heads while we were there. The toilet broke while we were there and maintenance was there within minutes to fix it which was great. There was a pool but we didnt get around to trying it out. The room was made up daily and the staff were all friendly, the concierges were helpful and helped us book in a few tours. All up its a comfortable no frills hotel that compared to the prices of other hotels is worth the money and is located in a fantastic spot 3-4 minutes from the beach, and close to transport, shops and restaurants.

We truly enjoyed our stay. We ended up not renting a car since everything was either within walking distance or reachable by bus! The staff was excellent and full of real aloha. Although the room was not as big as we would have liked, it was adequate.

Front desk staff not helpful. Requested a room on a higher floor and desk clerk replied he could move us but we could only stay for an hour.......we were not amused. Room and bathroom are dated. Our view was a run down apartment building. Seems the Asian guests received the best rooms. On the positive side, our room was clean and quiet for sleeping.

The lobby was beautiful but I was disappointed with the room which desperately needed an upgrade. The shower was dingy and the carpet wasold. The location was great, close to the beach and shops. My room was on the side street so it was quiet. The staff were very helpful. I made 3 calls the first day about issues in the room and the response was prompt.

Room is a little small but clean except the shower place is a little old. Location is closed by the beach and free parking area (nearby the zoo). I'm happy with my stays overall. Thank you very much :)

As always staff was personable and friendly. Our upgraded room had a great view, was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was exceptional. You exceeded our expectations as always! We will come again soon! Thank you!

My daughter and I had a wonderful time in Waikiki and we both enjoyed our stay in the hotel. They are always clean and tidy. The room is just right for two of us. Not so fancy but pretty average for people who doesn't need luxury accommodation. Recommended for couples and singles but not so much for family.

I chose a hotel that would have easy access to the beach and to shopping and restaurants. Waikiki Resort Hotel fit that bill very well. From the hotel lobby, it's a short block to Kuhio Beach Park, so there's no excuse not to hop over to the beach and enjoy some sun and surf. You also can't walk more than a block without encountering shopping and restaurants. The shopping ranges from the always-present ABC stores (which are actually quite convenient) to top-line designers such as Ferragamo or Harry Winston and brand names such as Coach, Crocs, and many others. The hotel is located about 2-3 blocks from the Royal Hawaiian Center, so if your idea of vacationing is spending a lot of time in a beautiful ocean-front shopping center, this is a good venue for you.The rooms were average (and the bathroom less-than-average) and the interior furnishings are pretty dated. The carpet in my room had definitely seen better days, and given the close proximity to the beach, it probably would have been better if the room were tiled. As it was, every time I came back from the beach I tracked sand into the room, and although it was vacuumed each day, it never felt clean. Although I have to say, even the tiled parts of the room (bathroom and closet) were not cleaned well and lots of sand was left on the floor. I'm not sure why they didn't do a better job of sweeping or vacuuming - I mean, this can't have been the first time someone tracked sand in.My room had a sink/closet area with separate toilet and bathtub. Well, I think it was a bathtub - I've literally never seen one so tiny. If you wanted to bathe small kids in it, it would be fine. For an adult, however, there would be no way to get into the tub for a relaxing bath.Housekeeping was so-so - it definitely depended on the day and the staff. Some days, the room was cleaned well and supplies restocked. Other days, they missed the trash and didn't leave me any coffee.The bed was comfortable, the flat-screen TV worked fine. I had a balcony with a "City view" which basically meant that I was not on the ocean side of the hotel. However, I was 14 floors up and there was a lot of wind, so I was not comfortable sitting on the balcony.Parking was available in a garage below the hotel for $25/day, with unlimited in and out. Apparently, there is other parking as well but I never figured out where it was. There is also a small laundry area (wash for $1.75, dry for $1.75 but you get 54 minutes on the dryer so that should be plenty).

This hotel had everything that my wife and I required for a most enjoyable eight day stay. Excellent position, friendly staff, comfortable - and a welcome Gideon Bible beside the bed. The Hotel shop had a very good range of reasonably priced goods.One complaint - traffic noise due to no double glazing outside our high street facing room!.

Had a wonderful time staying at this hotel. It is only a block away from the Waikiki beach. Had a minor issue which was taken care off by Brandon, one of the awesome staff members. Highly recommend it to anyone thinking of staying at this hotel!!

Very strategic location on Waikiki beach. The hotel itself is nothing fancy but it is clean. If you want affordable accommodation, close to everything, and you only need a hotel to sleep at night, this is the place.

This hotel offers many great opportunities to see Waikiki, its close to many of the restaurants and the beach. Safe, clean and friendly. The staff is polite and helpful. Zoo is right around the corner

I liked the location of the hotel - very close to the beach and walking distance to many amenities. The beds were very comfortable. Coffee maker was very small (making just one cup at a time) but the maids were very willing to provide extra coffee pods. The pool & pool area was very nice and kept clean & tidy. Towels always available at housekeeping desk. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was a bit small, and not a lot of drawer space, only 8 clothes hangers. We were given lots of towels and toiletries every day. We had a nice time staying at this hotel.

Just a few random comments but the overall experience is 8/10.This hotel has all the amenities of a typical 3-4 star hotel. "Resort" is in the name but it's not a resort.The location is really close to Waikiki beach, but costing less than half as much as those on the beach.They don't include free breakfast but there are so many food options right outside, you won't care.They also don't include tooth brushes so we had to buy some.Parking costs $25 a night.There is a laundromat and car rental all within walking distance.I believe this hotel is owned by or has a partnership with Korean Airlines as their flight crew stays there.

The beds were comfortable. A bit over priced for an older hotel. Would have liked in room wifi & a bathtub. Exceptional service by front desk staff & housekeeping. Location was good, just a block off the beach.

Excellent location a few minutes walk from the magnificent Waikiki beach. Great value for money with breakfast and wifi included in deal. Helpful staff. Only criticism is tour buses park in side street early in morning with loud engines running, alarm clock preferred method of waking up.

We just spent 11 weeks at your resort to get away from the Canadian winter.We had an excellent time and our gal "Shufen" took very good care of us the whole time. She kept our room to the same standards that I do at my own home and always with a smile on her face.The staff are all very good and friendly and very little turnover which we like.Our only thing is the rooms could have better lighting and it would be real nice if the pool could be heated for the winter months.We stayed in a one bedroom suite in a quiet corner which gave us the extra space we needed for our winter stay. The decor could do with some upgrading but the rooms are always clean.We are very happy with this hotel and will be coming back for our winter stay next year. We have been recommending this hotel to our family and friends each year who also have enjoyed their stays.Thank you to all the friendly staff at the Waikiki Resort for your hospitality.

Waikiki Resort was an affordable stay on a 1-week trip to Oahu with my wife. The property is 1970's vintage but well maintained. Staff was very helpful - we were feeling the Aloha for sure! Tips: Get a room on the upper floor to avoid the street noise (this IS Waikiki after all), forget the pool - Waikiki Beach is just 1/2 block from the hotel - grab a towel from housekeeping and GO! Cheap eats aplenty on Kuhio (1 block north of the hotel). Cons: Parking is $25 per day (OUCH!) and non-negotiable, though looking for parking is a waste of time and tickets can get expen$ive. A microwave oven would have been nice as well. Again, nothing fancy but a clean room, great location and an amazing staff made this a really nice and memorable trip!

We stayed for 5 nights at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. We had a room with a fridge, sink and microwave, perfect for quick breakfasts and little lunches. Bed was very comfortable also. The location is perfect, a short walk to the beach and oceanfront activities. We could watch the surfers from the balcony. The Front Desk staff were friendly. I would return with pleasure.

Overall it met our needs. The location was good. Rooms do need to be updated. We did have an adjoining room which I asked to have the door unlocked between the 2 rooms. No one ever showed up. The swimming pool was extremely cold.

Nice location, nice view, near from the famous waikiki beach and many nice restaurant and shooping districts near from this hotel. The room also nice and clean, if you want to stay here ask for the higher floor and beach view. The breakfast was nice too.

My friends and I booked a 2 bedroom 'suite' as advertised, thinking we were getting a good deal. It was disappointing that the 'two' lots of fees, charges, taxes were not made clear upon booking or checkin as the three of us would have shared a room. We got a rude shock.Despite this, the resort is perfectly located, has a shop with everything, a decent breakfast and clean rooms.

this is our second stay in this hotel. the location is perfect. it is a little noisy.the service is good and front desk people are friendly and helpful.the location is excellent close to the beach and restaurants.

Best location, reasonable prices, half block to beach. Hotel starting to show its age a little bit, but very clean, all amenities available, and staff very nice and helpful. Plenty of eateries nearby and plenty of shopping.

It was a quite good service while I was staying Waikiki resort hotel.and also I am very appreciated reception colleagues strong support when i faced problem. they supported to find a towed away rental car. even rental car company did not support.

Room abd bathroom a bit small but we only use it to sleep, so not matter much.Love the open lobby, very enjoyableLove the buffet breakfastLove the friendly staffsLocation wise it's very convenience very close to the beach and tour pick ups at the open cafe across the street

Its in a convenient area to get to everything but the hotel itself really needs an update. I kept asking does the room I stay in have a closed off bedroom and they kept saying yes but when i get to the room it was not. I wanted to be able to close a bedroom door so when my boys wanted to stay up I didnt have to hear them. The parking every night for your rental car was crazy they say u don't have a resort fee but the parking makes up for that. I guess for using the phone to make local calls charges .75 a call in which should be free its local so maybe we should have used our cell phone. The service was great but I don't think we will stay there again next trip

Waikiki resort was awesome! It was a block away from the beach. Shops were nearby. Staff was excellent in accommodating us! Rooms were super clean! They give you a 20% off coupon to eat at ilimas downstairs! Brunch breakfast with so many choices! Great place to stay for the price!

My room is in level 12( upgraded automatically by hotel staffs) , how nice . Staffs are nice and always friendly , helpul. We will book this resort again next time. It's very close to the beach, safe area.

This was a great place to stay on Waikiki. We had a corner room with a view of the ocean. Everything was well maintained and comfortable. The location was very close to the beach. We had a car and parking was reasonable and easy. Would like for internet to be available in rooms with out a charge.

The location is great, the beach just around the corner! The room was clean and tidy and beds very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The price of the hotel is great and very affordable. Would stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

Excellent service from concierge Rico. He was really helpful and spent a long time with us booking our itinerary so we could make the most of our holiday. He made sure that we could do all the things we wanted at a fair price . Thanks Rico. Very friendly staff.

Awesome location close to everything ...shops, shops, more shops and of course the beach. Helpful friendly staff. Second visit to Waikiki but first time staying at this location and would be happy to stay here again. Will be back soon

Very close to the beach, tourist locations and shops. This is a simple hotel, I'm not sure why it's called a resort as it is just a standard hotel, no bells and whistles here, however the room was clean and the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. If you are wanting a basic hotel room that is clean and tidy this would be perfect, if you are looking for a relaxing resort style hotel perhaps look else where.

It got off to a bad start when the day we arrived we discovered that all the accommodation fee had not been taken out of our account on booking in January this year. If it had not been for a large discount we received when we registered, we would have had to come back on the next plane. This really put a damper on our holiday and we had to watch every cent we spent during the 2 weeks stay. We NEVER leave home without knowing that air fares and accommodation are fully paid for and then we know exactly how much money we have for spending. Had we known the day that we left home that it hadn't been paid for, we would not have left home and would have got airfares back on our travel insurance policy.

We booked the hotel for the night before a cruise. We were very impressed when we arrived after a 10 hour night flight to find we could book into our room at 10am. Our room was on the ninth floor and good size. It was old fashioned but adequate. The bed was comfortable. Only negative is the dust cart that comes at 5am to empty the bins and makes a horrendous noise for what seems like ages and also sets off car alarms. Free wifi in the lobby is good. Location is a short block from the beach and lots of shops, restaurants and lively.

Location is perfect, close to everything that you need. Concierge was very helpful, as to was the Front desk, nothing was to much trouble. The beds are very comfortable and Housekeeping was good, this was our second time that we stayed here and will have no hesitation on staying here again.

My girlfriend and I had a great time in Hawaii thanks to waikiki resort Hotel. Great Location..very friendly stuff..the room was great..spacious.. very clean..the bed was the best! top notch mattress.room fully equipped..The only negative thing is that for the price, breakfast should be included.

Location was perfect, so close to the beach, shops, transport & restaurants. Housekeeping were polite, quick & thorough. Concierge were very helpful with information and bookings of tours. Front desk and Bell were also attentive, helpful and polite. Hotel restaurants were tasty and good value for money. This was a return trip for us and we will always stay here on future trips as it is perfect for us.

Recently stayed here 10days. Check in efficient. I had room 1209 very comfortable bed, good space, tea and coffee making and fridge. This room has a shower over a bath, everything you need. We had a special deal obtained off their website free breaky and free wifi. Well worth it. Didn't use the pool as the beach is about a 2 minute walk great location. The only suggestion and it's only a small one. that there is no full length mirror but plenty of room for one. Great holiday would definately recommend this hotel.

I liked the very clean room. The Staff was Friendly and helpful. We had a short walk to the beach, even had MacDonalds on corner across from beach. The Beach is Kuhio Beach, and the part closest to the hotel is called The Wall, It is walled off so no waves, perfect for kids, laying on floats, doing aqua aerobics.

This hotel was in a great location, less than a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach, shopping and food/bars.The hotel staff were very friendly and the rooms were fine. The only thing I noticed was that there were little bugs in the bathroom that I couldn't get rid off. We hired a car and had to park it at the hotel which I found to be quite expensive at $25 per day.Other than that, the stay was great and I would recommend this place to anyone.

We have just finished a 5 night stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and really enjoyed our stay.The check in process was very smooth and the staff very helpful, they even managed to check us in early after we arrived around lunchtime from Maui.We had a room with two double beds on the 9th floor. The room was plenty big enough, with a small desk, and set of draws. There was also a balcony with two chairs and a table. Both my sister and I found our beds comfortable.The bathroom was a good size, with the sink separate to the toilet and shower which was handy. The shower is a little different to the usual but reception gives you a quick run down on how it works. Water pressure was good too.There was a small fridge and also a safe in the basin/wardrobe area which was convenient.I would have ranked the hotel a 5 except for the fact that to get wifi in your room you had to pay a daily charge of $10 or so. We found this both good and bad, good that we didn't spend all our time on our phones, but annoying when you wanted to quickly look up bus times etc. Wifi is though free in the lobby which was good and relatively quick.The hotel is well located, only one block from the beach, and a block or so on the Diamond Head side of the Duke Statue. It was a very convenient walk to everything we needed in Waikiki, with a nice close bus stop to get to Ala Moana etc.This is our third different hotel (roughly all in the same price bracket) on our third trip to Hawaii, but it would definitely be our favourite. We would stay here again and also recommend to others, would just be great if they made wifi free everywhere in the hotel.

Great hotel. Love the location. Easy to find. The parking was good and there was a lot of it.The room was a nice size and clean. Everything was operational. Staff was fast and friendly. I have no complaints.

We were immediately impressed with the quality of the service & of the spacious & beautiful foyer. On check in we were very excited to find we had been upgraded to an ocean very room that was clean & as described. We didn't spend much time in our room but the location was ideal being 100ms from Waikiki beach & all the bars, parks & transport stops. It was really quiet in the room so sleeping was wonderful. We enjoyed the pool although we were surprised to find how chilly it was.We did not dine at the hotel as we thought it was too expensive. Only downside, no bar on premises until the restaraunt opens in the evening. Would recommend it to anyone who wants to be right in the midst of all Waikiki has to offer.

Easy check in, friendly staff and good location. Lots of restaurants and shopping around. About $45 taxi ride from the airport. Taxi stand right opposite or the concierge can call you one. Catching a cruise ship? It is about $15 taxi ride. Breakfast was good and quick.

We stayed at the Hale Koa hotel and it was a servicemen's hotel . the food was good but pricey. The PX shop was very good with lots of bargains at cheap rate as there was no tax..Being right on the beach it was packed but not enough to worry you. There was always somewhere to sit on the sand.

I asked a friend to make a booking for me, he said that the reviews were not so great but I chose it because of the lower cost. And I was pleasantly surprised when I got there. The hotel has a nice beautiful lobby, quite modern interiors and nice location. It is only metes away from the beach. The room was not big, but bright with a nice ocean view. You can get internet in the room for extra pay. The hotel has a nice restaurant - you can get a good breakfast for only 12-15$ The problem that I had with this hotel is the noise. Because of its location there is always some work going on on the street - taxi and shuttles, garbage pick up truck so on and so forth - it makes quite a noticeable level of noise from very early in the morning. Bottom line - I will definitely consider to stay there again because of the location and the breakfast.

The breakfast was very good and the wait staff were friendly. The front desk staff were very helpful. It was a short walk to the beach and many restaruants. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. The bathroom around the tub could use a little fix up.

Purpose of trip was 8 days of pleasure. Rooms were perfect & the breakfast buffet was well stocked & filled us up every morning. Hotel is in the heart of Waikiki & within walking distance to many attractions. For trips beyond walking distance, access to public transit was close by & plentiful. I would stay here again.

My wife and I were recently married in Hawaii, and we were looking for a suitable hotel for our 60+ guests to stay.We chose The Waikiki Resort Hotel, and are so pleased we did. The staff were extremely friendly, and accommodating, and our guests had a wonderful time during their stay. The hotels location is fantastic being only one block from Waikiki Beach, and walking distance from the Zoo and Dukes. My wife and I had an amazing view of the ocean from our room, and she and her bridesmaids had an even better one from the suite the night before the wedding. Housekeeping arranged for our suits to be cleaned and pressed, and they were delivered to our rooms.The in house restaurant and karaoke Bar supplied many nights of entertainment for all of us.Special thanks to Loren and Sherrie for all their help and communication in the months leading up to our arrival.

Had a lovely time staying at the Waikiki Resort. It was comfortable, clean and tidy. However there were a few minor concerns in that some of the snack food I bought from the hotel shop was out of date and the foyer often seemed busy due to the availability of free wifi. But those minor things aside, for a low fuss, no worry affordable stay in Hawaii close to the beach, I recommend the Waikiki Resort.

We have stayed at this hotel for 7-10 days a year for 4 years and have always been very happy with the complete package! Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Free lobby WiFi may be challenging at times to get on. Overall we will definitely stay again! Thanks Waikiki Resort!

Excellent hotel. Great location, a short 2 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Easy walk to the shopping centers in Waikiki as well. The concierge is amazing, happy to help and provide honest opinions about what to do and what is worth doing. The only downside to this hotel was the pay for wifi - there was no free wifi except in the lobby. It was $10.46 a day - reasonable but in this day and age you expect free wifi. Staff were great, the cleanliness was also great.

Although we only stayed one night at this hotel it was great. Check in was easy, staff were friendly and accommodating and the room was nicely appointed. The king bed was very comfortable. We ate breakfast in the hotel's restaurant and had the same experience. We would book again.

We had a wonderful stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, although the bathroom's could use some upgrades, The hotel staff were all very helpful and courteous.I would recommend my family or friends to This hotel.

Only good thing about this hotel was the location and beach towelservice. Old, falling apart, tiny shower, ants and lots of banging noise starting early in the morning as early as 6am. I would not return here.

We were two couples with rooms on the sixth floor across the hall from each other. First, yes there is free wifi; however, it is very weak. When we asked, we were told to go to the lobby! So,free wifi in the hotel but not necessarily in your room.So, the first night, I was awakened multiple times from partying, singing from the street. At 7 a m. a recycling truck came by and was dumping bottles into the truck. Not a quiet process! I asked the front desk and was told we could move to the 8th floor as nothing else was available. We decided to stay in our room and, fortunately, the first night was the worst. I had read about the noise issue and it is for real. If hotel is full, you are stuck.Now that I got the bad off my chest, the good: room,staff and location are all great. We did use the valet parking for the convenience and safety ($35) and figured that was just part of our vacation costs. Our housekeeper was very kind and friendly. Our rooms were city view, lowest cost,and had a balcony with a partial ocean and street view. Nicely furnished and clean.Overall, everyone was satisfied with our hotel. There is an ABC store directly across the street, plenty of reasonably priced restaurants, Sail boat ride on the beach side and a 10 minute walk to Duke's statue and outdoor stage next to it.

The rooms were nice and the service was excellent and very friendly but you can't beat the location kind of off the main shopping drag but a block from the beach I would definitely stay there again and recommend a friend

We really enjoyed our stay. Hotel is a short block from the beach, enough to have easy access, but quiet enough to get some sleep. The Korean restaurant had very nice and tasty food. The staff was great and very helpful in setting up our Hawaiian adventures.

A great location for anyone wanting to be close to Waikiki beach. Staff were friendly, courteous and helpful all of the time. Breakfast buffet was enjoyable and coffee was great. We had an excellent ocean view from the 17th floor. The bathroom could be updated with a walkin shower instead of a little tub to accommodate disabilities. The area around the hotel was safe at night and the hotel security staff were always around, but not in your face.

First time at this Hotel and we were presently surprised by its great location. Lobby very spacious and front desk employees very polite and helpful. Room was clean and any small issues we had were dealt with very quickly. Cleaning staff very friendly and did a great job. Only 1/2 block from beach and very close to many restaurants. For the price this is a great hotel and we have already booked it for next year.

Awesome location,only one block to Waikiki beach,Dennis the bell captain and his crew awesome,helpful, Sherrie in reservation the best,Nancy on front desk, friendly,helpful. Have already bookEd for next year

You pay as it was a resort but it is too less. The room is old and ugly, only the bed was super confortable. Near to the beach, just one block. some employees made a mistake with my reservatio and wanted charge more than the reservation that I had made.

My husband and i only just stayed here a couple of nights ago. Checked out our internet banking to find that the hotel has actually charged us twice for our stay but refuse to give us a refund. We were informed that we would have to wait a week for the refund of money that they should not of taken in the first place. Over all the hotel was convenient, clean and tidy. Good place to stay. But after such poor customer service, i will never stay nor recommend this place to anyone. Extremely disappointed and ripped off.

Apart from awesome location this hotel had very little else to offer. Rooms are extremeley dated in need of desperate makeover. $10 fee per night for internet. Wifi in lobby so slow it was quicker to walk down to Hyatt and get fantastic wifi reception simply by standing out front of Hyatt hotel. Parking $25 per day. Would I stay again? Prob not.

The rooms here are nice and the location is great but there a better options - the customer service wasn't good at all and it annoys me when massive hotels like this don't have free wifi when you aren't paying budget rates for a room.

We are checking out today and had a great time here. Two seconds from the beach. Great Korean restaurant. Near all the shops and super clean. Staff is friendly. Much better than the Hawaiian monarch we stayed at the first day!

This was an awesome location. Close to everything. 1 block to the beach!!! The rooms are a little dated & bathroom is tiny. But I would stay here again. **This survey wouldnt let me finish until I used all the characters in the box! Dumb!!!**

Stayed in this hotel for three nights, good room, good service from hotel reception.Erna and Park in the breakfast buffet give first class service with a smile, nothing to much trouble,so helpful. THANK YOU

We chose this hotel for the price. It's off the main Waikiki strip so it's not as loud.The rooms were clean and in room temperature control was convenient. The beds were comfortable.Service at the front desk was quick and friendly. One misleading fact is that the free wifi is only free in the lobby, not in the rooms where it is $10 a day. Their underground parking also serves as an extra storage area for the hotel which meant covered parking was limited. Outdoor parking seemed plentiful.I would probably stay here again if I needed a cheap hotel.

the hotel location is good for wakiki beach swimming and for shopping. breafast buffet is convenient for start of a day. staff are friendly. room cleaning is somewhat late, it was done around 3 pm. I will stay again.

Our stay at Waikiki Resort was very good. The counter staff were great. They were very helpful in providing information for the weather, buses, things to see and general information. We really enjoyed ourselves in the resort.

We arrived late for a short stopover on our way to Australia. The staff was friendly and helpful and our room was clean and comfy. It was just minutes from the beach and shopping. The bathroom was a bit dated but still clean and provided everything we needed. Would definitely stay again

We stayed here prior and after for a few days of cruising the other Hawaian Islands.A very nice hotel,clean and walking distance to beach and shops.We had breakfast included in our stay and there was plenty of hot and cold food.There is a swimming pool which doesn't get much sun and is freezing cold.Not much use if you don't like the beach and sea.The staff were very polite and helpfull. The Korean Airline uses this hotel for their pilots and flight crew.The airconditioning was noisy in both of the rooms we stayed in.If your room is on the roadside the trafffic noise is continuous from early morning to late at night.

Loved the room and the view. There was a lot of noise like garbage trucks every morning. Other than that, which I'm sure you can't control, it was a great place to stay. Loved being able to open the door and hear the surf and get the fresh air.

This was the 1st. time we had stayed at this hotel in Waikiki. The desk staff was wonderful, helpful, and friendly. Our room was fairly basic, but always clean. The elevators were really quick, which was nice ! This hotel is 1/2 block from the ocean, and very near the zoo. We found the location to be ideal. The open-air lobby is beautiful, and huge, Lots of couches and chairs, so it was a pleasant area to spend time. There are a couple of stores / shops , and a restaurant off the lobby. We would go back to this hotel, as we enjoyed our stay so much.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights. Foyer and front of hotel lovely. Rooms in need of a makeover! Bathroom old, carpet worn and towels thin. Room was neat and tidy, bed comfortable enough. Part view of ocean from our room.The aircon vent above our bed had condensation on it which dripped on my head all night. Bathroom floor extremely slippery, be careful with socks on! Nice and close to beach. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. I wouldn't stay here again though for the price we paid purely because of it needing renovating.

A week stay with breakfast & wifi package. Overall all a satisfying stay and close walk to the beach.Breakfast was decent. Wifi connection was ok (8th floor)Room was nice and spacious. Floor might need a check for unevenness. Amy our chambermaid did a great job cleaning our room and very friendly.We were woken up a couple of nights from water pressure noise that lasted more than 10min. Headboard was same wall as the bathroom. Hope it won't cause them water damage in the future (rm818)Overall hospitality again is good and will stay again.

With the pricing of other locations, this place gave us what we were looking for. A nice place to sleep while we explored the island. Centrally located in Waikiki, 1 short block to main street and it's night life and glitzy day shopping, while less than 5 min. to beaches, (Walking!). Buffet breakfast OK., but wife really enjoyed Teriyaki Burger!! Great base to co-ordinate all site seeing of Oahu from.

On arrival, we were impressed by the external hotel facade and grand foyer. That was it. When told that our room was on 4th level, we asked for a higher floor due to the noise as hotel is located in a busy area. We were told this cannot be changed as we were upgraded to a superior room that has a partial ocean view. The room given was on 4th floor, and was indeed larger than average, but no ocean view at all. Decor was very run down - room looks dirty, carpet was old and there was an exposed wiring for about 3 metres hanging along one side of the wall. The TV was mounted on the wall next to (instead of facing) the bed, which makes viewing difficult. Service is poor - no smiles from receptionists. Impressive hotel foyer, location, and good buffet breakfast aside, we went away vowing we will not return.

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is located one block from the beach, in the heart of Waikiki. It is a short walk to the beach, shops and restaurants.The provided a typical standard room. There was nothing to find fault with. The hotel staff were very helpful. They were even willing to tell us how to catch local buses rather then trying to sell us expensive toursThe rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. There is a nice pool, overchlorinated but otherwise acceptable.We were only looking for a room for two nights between flights and a cruise. So we were not looking for a luxury resort. It perfectly filled the role.The hotel has strong Korean links and most of the customers are Korean as it has Korean Restaurants. We only had breakfast in the hotel. That was an excellent buffet.

The Waikiki Resort is fine for what it is, a no frills hotel in the heart of Waikiki and 1/2 block from the beach. The room is basic and acceptable. I was here on business and it worked out for me fine. If I wanted a vacation resort, I would have gone to the Hilton Village. However, this hotel is exactly as advertised. Staff was very nice and very helpful. Wi-Fi in the hotel rooms should be free in this day and age, as necessary as television and air conditioning. To pay for Wi-Fi is frankly off-putting. I paid for it because frankly, I had some work to complete. However, I would use this hotel again in the future.

the room and location were excellent. staff was great. i have always looked forward to a dip in a pool after being on the beach. the pool water was way to cold to stay in. i was very disappointed about that. i would recommend your hotel except for the pool.
