Check in easy and staff helpful. Had disabled bathroom which was good.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights in December using some Korean Airline miles.The best thing about this hotel is its location. Couple blocks from Waikiki Beach. Plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance.Not happy about the rest. The underground garage is very cramped. Entry is gated and unmanned. The key card failed to work several times, we had to walk back to the lobby for help, while other cars had to wait because there is only one narrow lane for exit. They charge $20 pr day for parking which I find to be an outrageous price for such a cramped garage. If you don't mind walking two blocks, park in the Banyan Hotel garage for $12 per day. They have a huge garage.Some staff unfriendly. I'm referring to the Korean man who checked us in the first night. No greeting. No smiles. The white lady at the desk on the 2nd night was friendly and efficient.Room is small and very dated. No mirror except a small one above the very small sink. Towel thread bare. No king bed. Two double beds. Would not return.

We booked this hotel because of its great reviews and honestly we were a bit let down. I guess I was expecting a little more but this hotel is slightly below average. As far as we were concerned the only two things it had going for it was the location and price. If you've got the money I'd spend more and stay at a nicer hotel

Stayed here for a week in October, price and location made this our choice. I wasnt overly impressed to be honest - the reception area is like a 1980's time warp and needs a bit of a face lift. The room was okay but again rather dated, clean but a bit sad.The airconditioner was pretty useless and very noisy. The towels were a bit threadbare and there was a distinct lack of mirrors in the room - not that I like to look at myself a lot - but this is something I noticed!! All in all I wouldn't recommend this hotel although the location is good. There are much better hotels in the area for a similar price.

my wife and i spent 3 days here during this past halloween and found the waikiki resort to be a nice surprise. most reviews seem dead on. nice hotel on the quieter end of waikiki. very close to beach area and enough restaurants, so no need to wander very far from this hotel. undergound parking is minimal and very tight (no surprise), although we were able for find free parking between the hotel and the canal without much problem. you just need to be willing and able to walk several blocks for this perk. the immediate neighborhood can seem a bit dicey to some if you head in the wrong direction. if you have young children with you, this is where a resort may be a nicer, although pricier, experience. each year we come back to waikiki the area seems to contain more and more homeless sleeping in various odd locations and seedy characters in general hovering in dark. stay on the beach side as opposed to the back side of the hotel and things seem friendlier. we booked well in advance and got a pretty good price on the mini suite. plenty of room with a small fridge, sink and microwave. room was supposed to have a queen, but we had a king? not really luxurious, but clean, pleasant staff, and nice enough with a decent price.

Our room was clean and very small with two double beds. No queen or king beds. The air conditioner was noisy but turning it off and opening the sliding glass door was more noisy. Air conditioner blew directly onto the bed and there are no adjustments. Our view out the window looked directly at the side of another hotel. The location was great; close to the beach and the main shopping/dining area of town.

This is quite a nice hotel, it's only one block from the beach and 10 mins walk from the main Waikiki shopping area. The rooms are clean and tidy, the reception area is spacious, the buffet breakfast is excellent, and overall the staff are quite helpful. Couple of things to watch out for, the underground car park is really tight, you are better off using the open air one instead, also, do not book any trips with the concierge is that is always a mark up on what you pay, better off buying and trips direct.

We stayed at this hotel for 2-nights November 10 & 11th. The best thing about this hotel was it's close proximity to the beach. It's only a short block (30 second walk) to the beach. This is an older hotel with a nice lobby, restaurants, store and pool (all of which we never used due to having so many other amenities close by).The negatives were the very small, poorly laid out room. Only one small mirror over the sink, very small shower that you couldn't turn around in, low quality bedding and linens. (No king sized pillows, no duvet, lower quality sheets). It did have a small fridge, safe and lanai though. The staff were friendly and overall the hotel was good and decently maintained if you're not fussy about better quality like I am.

We stayed here for 5 nights inbetween travel and it was perfect for us. I'm not a big Waikiki Beach fan since there are much more beautiful beaches on the island to explore, but it was a great location for shopping, dining and getting that real Waikiki feel. We were able to park our rental car on the hotel parking lot for a very reasonable cost. The breakfast buffet was included in our booking and we enjoyed it very much. Great value for the money.

This hotel has a fantastic location. It is literally one block from Waikiki beach and the main road running through Waikiki where all the restaurants and shops are located. I stayed here for 12 nights and was really impressed. I didn`t encounter any problems throughout my stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. My room was of a large size with a massive bed! They were installing new sky tv when I was there, so obviously trying to update the services. It was nice having the balcony so that you could sit out in the evening. I didn`t use the pool as I was always at the beach, however i did read other peoples comments about it always being in the shade and I did see it in the sunshine more than once! The hotel had everything that you would need, shops, restaurants and a tour desk. There is a gym but its not at the hotel and you have to pay, I did think that this was slightly misleading as the website states that there is a fitness room. I would stay here again!

Hotel is in a nice central location for Waikiki Beach. Reservation process was easy. Even thought my friends all booked separately, they made sure we were roomed near each other. Staff went out of their way to help us and find fun things to do. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the beds very comfortable. It all made for a great trip!

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel before embarking on our cruise of the Hawaiian islands. Our stay was extremely comfortable and the hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. Yes, the rooms were a little dated, but who cares? We were there to see Hawaii and experience the best Honolulu had to offer. Shopping is amazing on the main strip and with the taxes at 4% we had a shopping extravaganza! Taxes where I live are a whopping 14.5%! The locals could not believe it! And, to top it off, the hotel was nice enough to accomodate us when our flight home to Vancouver got bumped to the next day. We could have wound up sleeping on the beach if it were not for the staff at the hotel. Our airline (Westjet) could not have cared less. We were not even reimbursed for the inconvenience! But all in all, I would recommend this hotel. Clean, friendly staff and the buffet breakfast was outstanding. I am still dreaming of that trip. That one was checked off my bucket list, but I think I would like to add another column for a return trip to the islands. Aloha!!!

Stayed here while on tour. Hotel owned by Koreans. Think our group of 35 were the only Caucasians in hotel. It was packed with Korean, Chinese, and Japanese school kids and tour groups. Breakfast buffet impossible to get to one morning with so many kids. Lobby crowded at 8 am with kids getting towels to go to beach. Room slightly dated but clean. Room was in back of hotel - considerable street noise, even on 15th floor. Restaurant food so-so. If returning would try one of the many other hotels in the area.

Good central location just a minutes walk to the beach.Booked two stays pre and post cruise. As with a lot of hotels in the area it is getting a little dated, but our rooms were clean and neat. First stay (shorter stay) we had a room at the back of the hotel. Small mix up with our booking but rectified by staff fairly quickly. Second stay we had an upper floor ocean view room which was nice with king bed. Our room was available prior to lunch which was great as check in is normally about 3pm. Fridge in the room which was good for drinks. Coin operated laundry in basement which was helpful for us as we had been travelling for a while and needed to wash clothes for our onward journey. Free WiFi in the lobby which we used also without any problems. The concierge was really helpful with directions and suggestions (not pushy) Booked a tour and Car Hire via him. He recommended some great spots to stop at on our drive around Oahu. Over all would probably stay again.

Although not too modern, the location was great. Very close to beach and beach walkabouts. Lots of restraurants nearby and bus lines to all over the island. Expedia concierge in lobby was very helpful and wasn't too pushy for booking tours. Gave lots of info on local restaurants and atractions.

Having just returned from a 2 week holiday in Waikiki Oahu I can honestly say this hotel is not aimed at english speaking people. The whole hotel is aimed at Koreans, Chinese and Japanese holiday makers, It even has a Korean Travel Agent in the hotel, a Korean resturant and bar. The Pros:- Comfy beds & pillows, clean room, good view although we had a city view it was very pretty at night. Fridge in room.The cons:-Not enough storage for clothes, coffee was provided but no Tea, no internet in room, no full length mirror (only one mirror over sink). The patio doors are single glass so you hear every thing out side early in morning and at night.We got this hotel at a very good price and when we arrived we were told we were in the penthouse - BUT not what we expected for a penthouse, we actually had a bedroom attached to a suite with two bedrooms so the people who were in the suite did not want two bedrooms hence why we had one. It was just a bedroom nothing special at all.There was supposed to be Internet Free in the Lobby we has 3 devices with us my phone, an Ipod ad computer none of them worked beacuse the IT dept had not put the IP Addres on the system properly so no ne could access the internet. You had to pay if you wanted to use it in the internet centre in the hotel - they are not silly. So I was not a happy bunny as I picked this hotel for the internet to keep in contact with home. If you wanted to use the internet you had to go to MacDonalds or Starbucks not convenient but a must.2 days before we were leaving we had a not left in the room saying they were upgrading the internet to WiFi and upgrading the TV to HD between 8 and 4pm and if you did not was to be disturbed ring housekeeping which I did and told them not to disturb us until we had left. I might as well have spoken Japanese and thye took no notice and on the day before we were due to leave they came - BUT my husband had left some change on the bedside cabinet and when we returned it had gone, we presume stolen by the workmen. We told reception who did not seem to be bothered but sent a Security guy up who was not bothered either so that was then end of that.I personally would not stay at this hotel again but thats my choice.

The hotel is perfectly located for anything you'd want to do around Waikiki. It's looking a bit dated and the decor inside of the rooms is in need of a modernisation. But it's clean, the staff are helpful and friendly and the location is great. Aside from the dated decor, the double room we stayed in was spacious and clean. Showers are very basic though and shower/toilet area of the bathroom is small. If you're just looking for a base to explore, then this is ideal and an affordable option in an area where accommodation can be expensive.

Lobby was quiet when we checked in - we asked where our room was, hoping for a "high floor" with perhaps a bit of a view. We were on the sixth - we asked if there was anything higher and something possibly with a kitchenette. We were SO lucky to get upgraded to the 17th floor...we had a one bedroom suite with a kitchenette and a view. The decor was lovely and we had lots of space to spread out plus 2 balconies, one off the living room where the sofa bed was and the other off the bedroom. My only negative (if you can call it that) about the room was the size of the bathroom sink and counter area - it was super small. There wasn't a spot for cosmetic bags or anything like that.We looked down over the pool and several time thought we would go down and lay there as the area was very inviting BUT the window of opportunity for sunshine must have been small. It seemed to us that it was in shade all the time or at least every time we looked - I guess from the surrounding buildings. So we spent all our time at the beach. Our only other issues were that there was wifi in the lobby but while we were there we had trouble connecting a number of times...which is frustrating. One time it was not available until the following day. Our flight did not leave until late in the evening and we asked to leave our bags with the bell concierge - we were charged to do that. I have never paid to leave by bags at any hotel and was surprised.The rooms were super clean and the service the front desk provided was great. We would go back.

This hotel is fine. Clean with good facilities. The beds were comfy and very large. Rooms also large and well appointed. We liked it. Only draw back lacks its own bar, although there is one in a sushi /cocktail bar in the foyer. Good breakfasts in the hotel lobby although not cheap. In fact we found food was on the expensive side in Hawaii. The hotel has a pool but it is in shadow for most of the day at least when we were there October. The hotel shop is good value. Lifts are fast and clean. I would recommend this hotel only 2 minutes from the famous beach. The car park under the hotel is readily accessed and easy to use, down there you will find a launderette which is good value. Get a good map of Hawaii, it is quite confusing. The north east and north have the best beaches, in our opinion. Waikiki is overrated and too busy. Hotel staff v friendly and helpful. Macdonalds close by, if only they would sell an acceptable breakfast for the UK pallette.

The Hotel has a good location. DO NOT try and check in Early. They always take care of the Airline Employes that stay there ( And there are a lot of them ) first. I di not think the frint desk staff was as helpful as they could have been in geting me into m room. I had to wait in the lobby for 4 hours.

This hotel was average but considering how close it was to everything in Waikiki it's a pretty good deal. The rooms weren't as clean or updated as I'd like but they were acceptable. The city noise got kinda loud at times. It's a budget hotel that's worth trying. The breakfast buffet wasn't anything special but it was there for a quick bite before heading out. The parking is limited so if you have a car it's first come first serve but we didn't have any problems.

The hotel offered location, service, amenities, views (we had ocean view Junior Suite) for a very reasonable price. Very happy to have chosen this hotel. Did not try the hotel breakfast as numerous coffee shops, cafes and bakers located nearby. The staff is very welcoming and helpful.

This was my first stay at Waikiki resort hotel. The rates were fair and the rooms were clean, yet nothing fancy. The beds were comfortable, and I was able to get a good nights sleep. The Jr suite is the way to go as you get a mini fridge, microwave and bar sink with utensils, plates, bowls, coffee cups etc. the only drawback to the location is Koa Ave is the major tour bus stop and buses are coming and going very early in the am if you chose to sleep with the balcony door open, it gets loud quickly! Overall the hotel was a great base camp for my visit to beautiful Oahu

We just got back from Waikiki Resort, stayed there the first two weeks of September 2012. Very pleased with our stay, as the hotel:- is very clean and well maintained- hotel staff is amazing - we felt welcomed and appreciated, with extra attention from the housekeeping staff (especially Rocely).- hotel is situated in a very good location - 1/2 block from the beach and the only McDonalds in the area (which is open 24 hrs ;)) - in case cheap food is important to youEssentially, lots of positives, so why not 5 stars?- pool and pool area - although clean and well-maintained is not super-inviting for lounging hours at a time (it's tiny and in shade a lot). We did not care for the pool with the ocean around the corner, but if that is important to you, keep this in mind. - ability to change after check-out - everyone has to check out at noon, but most folks do not fly until later in the day so they end up going to the beach, etc. Once you check out, you cannot access the washroom in the lobby (need room key) to change or use facilities. I find that the lack of ability to use the facilities on the day of your checkout is a small minus. I realize this is standard hotel procedure, but would've been nice for hotel staff to have the capability to let us into the lobby washroom and change. These two small issues aside, excellent stay and highly recommended!

I have delayed writing my review of my stay in August. I have stayed here before and was more than very pleased. Most everything is still the same - the wonderful staff, the location, the calm lobby.When I checked in, I was told I had a room in the Penthouse. My first thought was I struck the jackpot! When I opened the door, I thought this is really small, where's the rest of it. The diagram on the back of the door shows some really small penthouse rooms and some large rooms. Well, I knew the hotel was sold out and since I dislike moving from room to room, I stayed with what I had, my little room. But what I most disliked was the dirty, worn carpet. Way beyond time to shampoo and/or replace it. Spacewise it would have helped if the office style chair had been removed, leaving the one chair to use at the desk. I had to call maintenance twice and they took care of the problems very quickly.Again, the staff is truly wonderful - front desk, bell desk, tour desk, housekeeping, maintenance. Having the laundromat in the basement was helpful, too. The two meals I had in the lobby restaurant were good.

We were allocated this hotel as part of our package holiday, we were thoroughly satisfied, the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean and perfectly suited to our needs. We used the hotel as a base to explore Oahu from, we had a hire car and parked in the underground car park at the hotel, Parking was $20 per day and we were able to pay for this up front and to then come and go into the secure car park at our convenience. We took breakfast in the hotel restaurant and the buffet was fresh,hot and tasty.I think the hotel is ideally situated just a block away from the beach strip so that it is a convenient stroll away and does not have the inconvenience of the hustle and bustle of hotels located on the strip.Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, would happily stay there agin if we were visiting Honolulu.

The rooms were kept clean and tidy. The staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet had good variety. We had an ocean view room but felt the room was a little small and the double beds took a little bit of getting use to. Location.was great, close to beach, bus stops, and a main pick up point for most day trips. Overall we enjoyed our stay and have already recommended it to several friends. We would stay again next time.

Loved this hotel! The staff was very helpful and went the extra mile. The housekeeping staff and very friendly and efficient. This hotel has all the amenties you need: restaurants,lounge, pool, store, lobby wi fi, and underground parking. The location is great. Steps from the beach, close to restaurants, shopping etc.This resort is the best value! I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

This hotel was great and suited our needs so much. We have been to Hawaii 9 times now from Sydney and I have tried different hotels looking for the right one for us. Well I have found it!!!This hotel is nestled in a quite part of Waikiki away from the noise and hustle. The most important aspect of a hotel for me is that it is quiet and peaceful and this was. It is still so close to everything so you get the perks without the cons. Yes the rooms are a little old fashioned but I would have to say I am not sure I like all these modern decor trends Hawaii is going for I love walking into my hotel room and seeing the big tropical prints of Hawaii on the linens. That said they could use some updated ones. I love the open reception area and I found the staff helpful. We stayed the last time with my parents and 3 children, my youngest child still had a bottle at the time so the fact that there was not a microwave could have been a problem but housekeeping very kindly allowed us to warm our daughters bottle each night in there microwave. All in all everything suited us. I LOVE Waikiki and I will be returning this November to my new home away from home at the Waikiki Resort.

Third Time Still just as Charming - August 2012Aloha!We recently returned from our third stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and I am writing again to say what a wonderful time we had. This time we spent a full week enjoying our room, the ocean and mountain views, the incredible location in the heart of Waikiki just half a block from the beach and the sincere hospitality of the hotel and staff. Another couple joined us on this trip and they, too, had a terrific time and loved the comfort and amenities of their room as well as the impressive views. Most mornings we got up early and went for a brisk walk along the beach-walk passing by the Aquarium and the Zoo before returning to the Ilima Restaurant downstairs at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for a buffet breakfast. The food at Ilima was excellent, as was the table service. The restaurant staff is very friendly and attentive. I am watching what I eat these days so I avoided the breakfast meats and the pastries and muffins but there were plenty of other healthy choices available. I definitely got my fill of great tasting fruit each morning. The melon and the pineapple were consistently excellent. We also dined twice at the Seoul Jung Korean Restaurant on the second floor of the hotel. The food was so good the first evening that we ate there that we had to go again two nights later. The mouth-watering Gal Bi ribs were unbelievably good. I had those on both nights and I will return for those ribs again in the future. With all of the trips we made up to our room and back down to ground level over the week I noticed how convenient the elevators were to take. We never seemed to have a long wait for an elevator which isn't always the case in high rise buildings. You'd push the button and just moments later the elevator would arrive. A small thing I guess but it made for more more enjoyable, frustration-free experience.One thing different on this trip was that we did not have a car the entire week so we learned about the bus system and the trolleys, which were actually quite convenient. Plus it was nice having someone else drive while navigating busy Waikiki. We managed to get to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Pearl Harbor to see the memorial and exhibits (the Missouri Battleship was awesome and inspiring), and even Hilo Hatties with relative ease. Another day we walked to the near-by Diamond Head Recreational Area and watched the windsurfers with their colorful sails riding the waves in and then letting the powerful winds carry them back out past the waves to do it again. This is near the historic lighthouse and many of the homes in the area are quite stunning. From there we could see the “ant-sized” people up on top of the Diamond Head crater rim, which is a great hike that we made the last time we stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel.Wow, the week went by so fast – that is my only “complaint” for this trip.We love staying at this Hotel!

Front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming upon our arrival. They were helpful with questions and quick to respond to requests we had throughout stay. We had a mountain view room with 2 double beds on the 16th floor. The rooms were a bit small, but that didn't bother me too much as I didn't spend much time in my room anyway other than to shower or sleep. The bed was okay and the room was fairly clean. I did notice that there were lots of sirens throughout the night. I would not want to stay on a lower level floor because I would imagine the noise would make it even more difficult to sleep. The location of the hotel was what I liked most. We were 1 block from McDonald's (where we ate breakfast every a.m.) and beach. Also, quite close to International Marketplace (about 3 blocks away, which was good that we were far enough away from noise at night but close walk for shopping) and Duke's restaurant (where we went nightly for our favorite... Hula pie). The only recommendation I would have for the room was that it could use a microwave and a second mirror. Having another mirror in the bedroom area would have made it a bit easier for all 3 of us to get ready at the same time because the one in the bathroom area was barely large enough for two. Anyway, overall it was a good hotel for the price we paid and I will book again if we return.

We enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Resort for the second time last November. The rooms are very comfortable and the Staff are friendly and helpful. The location is close to the beach and a great variety of restaurants and shops. The Staff at Reception and Bell Desk were particularly helpful to assist us in finding our way around this great holiday venue to the extent that we hope to return for our third "annual" holiday this year.The Staff at the Bell Desk greeted us warmly and frequently arranged shuttle bus services when required.We happily recommend Waikiki Resort Hotel to anyone looking for comfort and convenience.

We just got home, from a weeks stay, at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, our home away from home! We live in Hilo, so when we go to Oahu, we chose to stay at this great Hotel! The staff is so friendly, even our cleaning lady, the people in both restaurants, and the front desk, and yes, even the General Manager, Glenn Vergara, take care of our every needs. We were fortunate to stay in a suite this trip, actually, it is room 1808, which has totally been remodeled, and the bathroom is handi capped, which is so useful, for a 80 year old, like I am! We were on the Island, this trip, for medical reasons, and everyone kept asking how I was doing!! The Hotel is the best place to stay, if you are going to be on Oahu!! The art photos, in the elevator, are taken and done by the General Manager, we found out, and are so beautiful. We saw many improvements that have been done, since our last stay there. Feel free to ask me any questions, regarding this great find, in hotels!! Aloha, Evonne

On our fourth and possibly final visit to Hawaii we decided to stay at Waikiki Resorts a second time. The hotel is only a short block to the beach. The rooms are clean. The staff is friendly. The rooms have a safe, hair dryer, coffee machine with coffee provided daily, a small fridge and newer tv. There is free Wi Fi in the lobby. There is also a nice pool. We were not disappointed that we picked Waikiki Resort for our last visit. ( We also like the green beach towels but wished they were still in the lobby.) Thank you for keeping up your great hotel.

I have stayed at several hotels in Waikiki and I keep coming back to the Waikiki Resort Hotel because it has everything I need when I stay on O'ahu for a good amount of time. High maintenance or picky travelers need not stay here. I have never had any problems staying at this hotel.

We’re staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. The lobby is open & spacious I always like in warmer climates when areas are open to the outdoors, the staff is friendly. Our room is clean however the air conditioner fan is very noisy & needs to be fixed. There is no Wi Fi in the rooms, for a highly ranked Trip Advisor hotel who doesn’t have Wi-Fi available to their guests in their rooms? I will have to go to the lobby to use their Wi-Fi there… but the location is perfect a half of a block off of Waikiki beach. there is no Fitness Facility which is disappointing but 24 Hour Fitness is just around the corner ($20 drop in fee though)

spent 3 days 3 nights there. we arrived at night to check in and the front desk clerk who greeted us was not friendly. he made us wait a few minutes while he and another agent did something on the computer. not a good impression to start with esp. with 3 tired guests who just want to get in their room and rest after a long day of travel.knob on the shower fell off and was never fixed during our stay. We were still able to use the shower thank goodness. water pressure was ok.Customer service overall was up and down. some were helpful and some were downright impatient. The best one was the bell boy who was very helpful. Travel agent on site selling tours, etc was helpful and informative but was a little on the flirty in a slimy way. ugh!Room itself was comfortable enough and clean although i didnt trust the carpeting. Hotel overall was very dated.I didnt use the pool like i intended but i talked to some families who enjoyed using it.The best thing I can say about this hotel is it has a fantastic location walking distance to everything you needed. it is right in the centre of tourist trap shops and restaurants but that was what we wanted for this trip. it's 1.5 blocks from the beach and close to all bus stops.Overall, it was a satisfactory hotel but I will probably go to a different one next time.

The resort is extremely conveniently based just a block off the sea-face, in main wai-kiki. Its easily accesible to the beach, shopping, touristy spots and the general store. The rooms were large and spacious (for a reasonable price) and were well maintained, stocked (iron/safe/dryer) and clean.The tourist desk for good! they had an expedia expert- who had good knowledge on all the tours.Quite VFM - would recommend

We just came back from Hawaii and we stayed at the Waikiiki Resort. The staff was wonderfull, very accomodating. Now, to be honest, this is not a 5* hotel, it is kind of old and in Canada, we are used to very comtemporain hotel with lots of space and gadgets... however, after 1 day, we realized that we had everything we needed... the room was clean, the housekeeping was done every morning, the location was excellent. The hotel provided the beach towel, their Korean restaurant is excellent and the prices are good. The concierge is very helpfull. The hotel is so close to the beach and the shopping was good. We do not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

3 star hotel in an area close to beach, shops and easy walk to everything. Our room was a junior suite on 14th floor and was very large, clean, comfortable and had an ocean view. The kitchenette was adequate with a microwave, some cutlery, mugs, plates and bowls. Free wifi in foyer only. The staff were helpful with the bookings and during our stay.

We were initially booked at another hotel simply because of the great budget price but weren't too convinced since we had stood there before and knew the location of that hotel was not the greatest. I then started looking around for another budget priced hotel with a better location. With the advice of TA I contacted Discount Hotels Hawaii and came across the Waikiki Resort. We knew we had made the write choice to switch when after our cancelled flight in we were reassured that our room would be ready at whatever time we arrived. Once we finally got there (9hrs later) the reservation desk knew exactly who we were. Location was great, a short walk to the beach, restaurants and shops. Room was very clean, beds were comfortable and the room itself was spacious for the 4 of us. We will definately stay at the Waikiki Resort again and recommend it to friends and family. Thanx for making our vacation a great one.

We just spent three (3) nights at the Waikiki Resort Hotel before moving to the Turtle Bay Resort for the remainder of our stay on Oahu. We were accompanied by my cousins from England who were visiting Hawaii for the first time.The Waikiki Resort Hotel is located minutes from Waikiki beach and close to all shopping and dining. The rooms, although not recently renovated, were clean and comfortable. The entire staff was unbelievably accommodating and helpful. For those reviewers who complained about the rooms, there are nearby hotels that were available for 3 times the money. We were also very encouraged when we noticed that Korean Airlines uses the hotel for their flight crews who were laying over in Honolulu.Our room was on the 14th floor, which offered us an outstanding view of the ocean.This was our first stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel, but when we return to Oahu, we will stay here again.

My husband and I stayed in this hotel in July , liked the hotel with ocean view room, the staff were very helpful specialy Sue, close to beach,shops and restaurants, will come back again, but check in should be earlier then 3pm as we arrived at 12pm could not go to the room.Buffet breakfast needs improvment.take shuttle for $5 each way near duty free that take u to Pearl harbour and Waikele outlet its a must.Enjoy ur trip

We stayed during the month of July. It is truly great hotel. The staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are great and very confortable. The morning buffet is excellent and I ate to my heart's content. I wasnt hungry until late in the afternoon!!! If you are like me, I dont like to wait for elevators.The elevators were quick and I didnt have to wait long. Many times, the elevator was there already. The Hyatt (where I stayed for two days), I had to wait several minutes and as long as 12 minutes for an elevator. ( Hi Vicki!, I am still thankful though!) The parking for the Waikiki Resort is very convenient. The resort is close to the beach (about a couple hundred yards or so).All in all, this hotel is great. We were very confortable at the hotel and felt very safe and secure. My family enjoyed every minute of our stay.I recommend this hotel to everyone who reads this. For those from the neighbor islands(like me), this hotel is one of the last great secrets in Waikiki. I lucked out by remembering this hotel by its location and went to Google maps to find out the name.I am glad I found this hotel. I will stay here everytime I visit Oahu.Also to help anyone out about eating at night(take out) Burger King and McDonalds is a short distance away with Chucks Cellar and Round Table Pizza as well as Rock (Something) Diner but.........Blazing Steaks is a few steps away and closes at 10PM. Do not miss the Korean BBQ called Me BBQ (9PM closes) located at a pink building on Uluniu Ave, just around the corner of Waikiki Resort. Make sure to "Take Out" because after you eat, you want to lie down in the soft bed at the hotel and go to sleep...Plenty food and good!!!! It was an awesome stay and I look forward to the next time!!!!

Stayed here with a friend in May. The other reviews are pretty spot on. It is clean but hotel is worn. Towels in bathroom were worn and we had to keep taking towels from the pool area because we didn't have enough for two people. Reception staff could be more friendly but Walter on the concierge desk was great he makes up for the reception staff, and is recommendations were spot on. Quite a good location close to the beach, pool does not get sun in the morning. Good budget hotel.

We are from San Diego, CA and stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Excellent location, close to the beach. The staff is very friendly. The underground parking is a challenge to park. Outdoor parking is great. Its swimming pool is outdoor one on the 2nd floor. Our 2 boys loved it. Overall it was a great experience!

We were very satisified with our stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. Nancy at registration was extremely helpful and very pleasant. Our oceanview room (1818) was perfect, with a kingsize bed and lots of space in the room. The bed was extremely comfortable with nice soft sheets and plenty of pillows. Lots of closet space, fridge in room, very convenient. The very short walk to the beach was a breeze, with shops and restaurants all around. Definitely would recommend !

We had a great stay at the Waikiki Resort in Honolulu. We were in Honolulu for 6 days and this hotel has a fantastic location! It really is 1 (very short) block to Waikiki beach! It is just off the main drag along Waikiki beach, where there are lots of shops and restaurants. The lobby is bright and open-air, with colorful stained glass on one side. We booked a mountain/ocean view superior room and were located on the 17th floor. The room was a good size and very clean. The bathroom was separated into the sink/closet area and then a separate toilet/shower room. The toilet/shower room was very tiny, you had to squeeze in to shut the door behind you, but no big deal. There was a mini fridge in the room which we found helpful so we could keep snacks/drinks cold for the week. The bed was comfy and we didn't find noise to be a problem at all (from other rooms, the hallway or outside). We overlooked the pool and since we were so high up we could see Waikiki beach and the ocean from our room/lanai. The pool was small but a nice spot to go to if we didn't have much time between activities, or if we didn't feel like heading to the beach. They have towels for you to use at the pool and beach. There is a shop off the lobby with basics in case you forget anything, or there are ABC stores on almost every corner where you can pick up essentials or souvenirs. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly enough, nothing over and above though. The bellman was very helpful with getting us taxis (and pre-negotiating rates), and writing up bus routes to and from various destinations around Honolulu. We had a car for a couple of days so we parked in the garage 1 night. It was small and crowded but did the trick. Our only suggestion to the hotel was to have a courtesy room where people can freshen up quickly before their flight. We checked out at noon and didn't fly out until 11pm so we would have appreciated a quick shower/face wash/teeth brushing after the afternoon in the sun before we got on the 12 hour jouney home. We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely stay here again or recommend this hotel to others!
Half a block from beach. Excellent location. clean room. No wifi in the room. clean swimming pool.

This hotel was excellent for a couple of days. Very close to everything, two minute walk to Waikiki beach. Loved the fact there were no front doors. Location is excellent and we had a junior suite which was very spacious and clean. Would definitely recommend.

I picked this hotel on a "mystery hotel" promotion for $99 a night, standard room for 3 nights. Arrived at the hotel, and was surprised with an unsolicited upgrade to the 18th floor, a one bedroom suite. Beautiful, huge, and very clean, with fridge and microwave and regular dishes and utensils. It does not have the "resort" amenities, of valet service and doorman, etc..etc..., but for the price, and how clean the room was, who really cares about anything else. What can I say, I will come back again to Waikiki Resort.

The hotel was adequate for an affordable stay in Waikiki- half a block to the best stretch of beach in Waikiki, right near the big banyan tree and the statue of Duke. Parking was $20 a night, small lot under the hotel, but we did find a spot every night. One thing I wish we would have discovered a little earlier was the lunch specials at the restaurant in the hotel, for $6 you can get ceaser salad, noodle soup, pots stickers, or the delicious fried rice. The room was kind of small, it had a mini fridge, and a tiny shower. We stayed on the ninth floor and had a decent view of the beach.

The Desk Staff is friendly and efficient. Ho Jin gave me Room # 1401 and said you can here the elevator but it has a queen size bed so I said "OK". Well, for 15,000 Korean Airline miles I ended up with a 2 room suite with large LG flat screen TV's on the wall in the living room and bedroom. There was a small kitchen with microwave, mini-fridge and a deep sink with plenty of hot water. Also 2 lanai's (Hawaiian for 'balconey'). A bathtub would have been nice but you can't have everything for free anyway(LOL). The main McDonalds in Waikiki is just up the street for a cheap morning coffee (Americans expect a free re-fill). Starbucks is to the left about 300 metre when you get to McDonalds on Kalakau Ave. I can't wait to stay there again!

W ate had such a wonderful experience at this hotel when we stayed in it last year that we decided to stay there again this year. We are very, very happy that we did! The hotel is spotlessly clean, the personnel are uniformly polite, helpful, and cheerful, and the rooms are very comfortable. Our housekeeper made sure that we received personalized service and was very friendly.This time we elected to dine one evening in the Korean Restaurant, and the food was truly excellent.This hotel is very well located one block off Waikiki Beach, but far enough away from the main street to be quiet at night. The International Market is only 3 blocks away.We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Honolulu.

My husband and I stayed here for the first few days of our honeymoon. It was a great value hotel. Location was good, although not right next to the beach near enough. Clean, stylish rooms and bathrooms with everything you need. Very helpful receptionists too.

This hotel has a very good location in Waikiki, and isn't a bad property, not sure what the official star rating is, but I would say about a 3 star at best. We found the rooms were very small with not a lot of room at all. We were given 2 double beds, which meant one of the beds turned into a suitcase holder! It did have a nice ocean view however. Pool area is small with not many seats, specially for the amount of rooms. Overall I found this hotel to have a very old feel to it, the lobby needs an upgrade and a new look to look more inviting.I would recommend this hotel for younger people who will spend more time out at the beach, doing day tours, and eating at restaurants and bars, mainly using this hotel as a bed and a roof!!

The Hotel is only rated as 2 star but could well be compared with 3 1/2 to 4 star equivalent. We stayed 5 nights are were delightfully surprised with the location, view , size of the room general cleanliness and the support of the Desk Staff throughout our stay. There is a nice little cocktail bar hidden over in the corner of the foyez which also serves meals, comfortably laid out but not very well attended by the guests although we had very reasonable cocktails presented very efficiently by the bar lady. The swimming pool is of reasonable size and well kept but as the sea is only 3 minutes away it provides an alternative when jelly fish are around. The fitness centre is actually a share with the the hotel next door at a reduced rate.All in all we enjoyed a very pleasant stay at the hotel and would return again

Other than the waves I had a perfect week in Hawaii and I was treated very well not only in the Hotel, but everywhere else(airport, hotel area and Ala Moana Shopping area).But the tips: plan well even if it´s only through the internet, but out of all the reviews always discard the worst one because the perfect Hotel either doesn´t exist or is very expensive. For example, one person reviewing this hotel noted that the bath tub is shallow and small. In my case I didn´t mind at all.Being my second time in Hawaii, I knew what to expect and I chose this Hotel because the streets around it are more quiet and more discreet than just one block away. Also, if you stay in the lower floors in the streets near the Hilton, you are more likely to hear everything that is going on in the street at night. People arrive from all over the world in the afternoon and many stay up until late at night in the streets making noise. Also, the guests at this hotel are mostly asian families and they don´t make much noise. But again, if you are young and don´t mind late night noise there are many other places to choose from.But as a matter of fact it was so quiet at night that I had to open the windows to hear some noise to sleep. I was staying on an oceanview room the 16th floor . This time I didn´t hear the garbage truck at 3 a.m. and didn´t see many homeless around. I woke up early everyday and didn´t go out much late at night, so I didn´t get to see any hookers. It´s best to enjoy the beach and shopping early in the morning before the crowd and avoid trouble being out late. Even though I think it´s rare that something bad would happen. I think Waikiki has gotten much better than many years ago and I look forward to visiting again.For me it was the perfect vacation.

From the time we checked in, it was a seamless and relaxed vacation experience, owing mostly to the gracious staff. The staff helped us when we forgot to bring our hotel voucher printout from our Travel Agency by immediately calling up the agency and having them fax it while we got settled in our room. All our requests were met promptly and with a smile, from the hairdryer and iron we exchanged to the towels we checked out and brought back from the beach. The staff even delivered our clean laundry straight to our room right after noticing that we had returned from the beach when we brought back our towels. Great location near the Waikiki beach meant we could easily walk there and back, stopping at the shops along the way during the day and late into the night (great nightlife all week!)

We stayed here pre and post our cruise and loved it!! It may only be a 3 to 4 star hotel but for the price it was great. We went direct through the hotel to book and got a 'special' stay 2 night get one free so it worked out very reasonable. The location was 100 steps to Waikiki beach and secluded lagoon area where you can just float on the water without waves and especially no coral on the shoreline which kills your feet trying to get in on the beach side. We got a partial oceanview room which had a fantastic view of the street, beach and ocean!!! with a view to the left of the volcano. King size bed (could have been more comfy as we seemed to slide to the side of it) but over all the staff were more than friendly and obliging to help and it had a guest laundry which was handy. Pool was OK ..nothing great but cooled you off !! but the beach was 1 minute away so only used it once. Close to restaurants and buses and of course the ABC shops which was handy.Would definately stay there again!!!

We had run out of towels and I went down to the housekeeping room to order a few things - by the time I took the elevator back to the 17th floor, the maid was already on it, restocking us! The housekeepers were the high point of the hotel - make sure to tip them, they are worth it. Nigel

This would be our 5th trip to Oahu, we chose on this hotel based on the review of other tripadviser members. We arrived at the hotel fairly early, 1:00 PM and the room was ready for us. The room is clean with a small balcony facing Waikiki beach, rarely spending time on the balcony though. We parked our vehicle at the underground garage for $20 per day; this is average price for Waikiki. We didn't have the problem with the maid like the other reviewer; our room is spotless when we came back from the beach. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants; you have hundred of choices nearby. Three nights stay at this hotel was pleasant and hassle free, no complaint at all.

very close to the beach, great value, wonderful location. the beds very comfortable, good balcony although the door did rattle with the wind. found the bathroom on the small side with two ladies, but would definately stay again. Plenty of other places to eat than at the hotel.

I recently spent 10 nights here and would definitely stay again. We had an ocean view room on the 17th floor and found it spacious and generally well appointed. I would only stay in an ocean view room, and am prepared to pay extra for it.We found the housekeeping staff friendly and helpful but the concierge was quite indifferent to our needs.

My hubby & I got a room via our airline mile rate. The hotel room itself & asmosphere are fine. Sea View from room is good. Location is excellent. It's walking distance to all kind of shopping malls and restaurant.Thing is when I left 3 dollars tip for cleaner lady. She took our tip but hardly doing anything. She just re-covered the bed. She didn't even bother to change towel or empty the bin. However, her service improved after we made a comment at reception.

This hotel is only 1 block and 1/2 from Kuhio Beach Park, Waikiki beach. Close to shopping and restaurants. The hotel is nicely decorated and clean and we really liked the open air lobby. We only ate the in restaurant for breakfast which was just average, but the coffee was awful. (I'm an avid cofee drinker and expected much better coffee, being they can get Kona or Kauai coffee pretty easily) Great hotel for the price we paid.

This hotel was not the one our travel agent was recommending but through a little research we choose to stay at the Waikiki Resort. Well this was a good choice and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to anyone that like us are on a budget. The room is spacious and though reasonably priced does not have any downsides. Great value for money, close to the beach and between two pick up points for the tours we choose to do. Recently renovated and it was nice to have both coffee making facilities and a small bar fridge. Airconditioned and when you draw the curtains and have the balcony door closed it is nice and peaceful. Will be our choice again for our next visit to Waikiki.

This hotel sited only a couple of minutes' walk from Waikiki beach has a very impressive entrance/lobby area and the desk staff are efficient and friendly. Rooms are large, with very comfortable big beds, but they could definitely do with some redecoration. The bathroom fittings in particular look rather "time-warp" (like much of Honolulu), as do the telephones, etc. Balconies are narrow and vertigo-inducing if you are on a high floor, so not much use. The hotel has a nice pool and terrace, shaded by surrounding blocks and seems to be little used. Free wi-fi in the lobby is a definite plus. The in-house restaurants only really offer Korean food to cater for the majority of the hotel's guests, but there are plenty of eating places within a short walking distance.

We have made many trips to Hawaii over the last 20 years often times to the other islands. This Spring we decided on a last minute 8 night trip to Waikiki. It couldn't have been a better experience! We considered several of the resorts but so glad we chose Waikiki Resort Hotel for multiple reasons: great location, friendly staff, and clean/comfortable rooms. Plus, on arrival we were upgraded to a lovely ocean view room which exceeded any expectation we had. If you are looking for a GREAT value, this is the place! Highly recommend. No doubt, we will be back. OregonCoastCouple

I would highly recommend this place. The people are nice and pleasant. The room is clean and big with plenty of spaces to move around. The bed is so comfy. I was pleasantly surprised that my room has a balcony with a great view. For the price of $89 per night it was more than worth it. The beach is only a block away and so are other places to see. Definitely going back there again next time. Aloha and Mahalo!

we have stayed in Waikiki many times, This was our first stay at Waikiki Resort Hotelit's position is excellent, only one block walk to the beach & amenities.The rooms are nicely furnished, This hotel is also one of the few that have beach towels available for guests to use, (Nice touch) Easy self car parking (not valet) underneath the hotel, charges are like all hotels $20 per daythere is only wifi available in the hotel lobby (Not BedRooms) not good for ipad users.This hotel is great we will stay here again on our next visit in November.

I stayed at this hotel in Aug 2010 and I went back in April 2012. It's still a great place if you're looking for a basic, no frills, clean and convenient hotel in Waikiki. It's in a great location. During my first stay, my room was very close to the elevators, and I found that a bit noisy. This time around, I asked for a room away from the elevators and it was great! No complaints!

Tired hotel in need of some updates, but can't beat the location and good value. Bed was mushy, tiny shower, and decor did not all match. Parking is very limited. Front desk staff was friendly but clueless as concierges.

I was in Oahu last week for my annual vacation. I stayed at the Outrigger Reef last year but decided to stay at this hotel following the recommendations of friends and TripAdvisor reviews and am happy to say that the reviews were correct (great location, value and friendly staff).First the perks: Location - it's short block away from the beach, McDonald's and other restaurants are a 3 min. walk. Amenities - you have free access to a mini-fridge where you fill it with drinks/snacks purchased at an ABC store (literally, there is 3 or 4 ABC stores within a 5 min. walk) and an in-house safe where you can place your valuables. The staff were helpful and friendly (I was given a free upgrade from partial to full Ocean view on the 18th floor). The additional perk being in this room was that I was able to receive free wifi access (via. shakanet). The rooms were clean, bed was comfortable, there were ample towels, loved the view from my balcony and the great air conditioner control system.I really don't have anything bad to say about the hotel. Just realize because of it's great location, expect some traffic/noise (if facing the beach). It's an "older" hotel that was remodeled and contains only a shower tub. I found the alarm clock radio a little confusing to use so I used my IPhone alarm instead.I would definitely stay at this hotel again. To make a smooth transition (to/from airport, go with Roberts Hawaii shuttle service). Mahalo!

Best hotel in Waikiki, away from the noisy busy streets yet just a block away from the beach. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable with lots and lots of pillows, we slept like babies. I would definitely stay there again.

My wife and I travel often and do a lot of research before booking any Hotel....we have learned the hard way through the years...That said, this choice Hotel will be our new "Home " next time we visit....Great location..close enough to everything in the area but far enough (one block) to avoid the night life carnival that takes place nightly on the main drag.

This hotel was terrific. The bed was very comfortable and room met all our needs. We were on the tenth floor with a king size bed and could see the ocean. The room was very clean and the service each day was great. Always enough towels. The bathroom itself is a little small but it works. The area with the sink provided lots of room to get ready. In reference to the location of the hotel, it was perfect. Only one block from the beach. We had a car and the underground parking gave you the flexibility of unlimited in and out access each day. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, the check in was smooth and quick. We would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I went for a delayed honeymoon and we had a great time. The hotel was in an excellent location for the beach, bus, and people watching. It was clean and the hotel staff was friendly. I only wish they had wifi throughout the hotel. The bathrooms were small but it worked for what we wanted to accomplish.

Have you ever gone to a hotel and felt like you had just come home. That is the feeling my wife and i have every time we come to the Waikiki Resort hotel. We started coming to this hotel in 2005 and have been there 7 times since. Every year the hotel has been improved with renovated rooms to new bedding but that is only part of the reason to stay there. The biggest reason is the staff. They never seem to change. They were friendly in 2005 and even more friendly when we got there in early March this year. There are so many faces that are the same as in 2005 and all seem to remember us every year(June and Erna have been there a long time and always can give a history lesson). The location is fantastic and the cost is reasonable so i recommend that everyone give it a try. This year our family came with us to meet our Hawaiian resort family and they had a great time.Thanks to the staff for a great vacation and we will see you next year.

Just got back and had to comment on this hotel, we spent a week here and will be back. We had room 1115 and the partial ocean view was great, watched the surfers while having our morning coffee, turned to the left and had a great view of Diamond Head. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The balcony was larger than other hotels we tried and the cleaning staff washed them down everyday to ensure that the local birds did not leave us any presents. My husband enjoyed the TV as it was March Madness after all. The front desk was great for checkin and check out. Location was awesome, just a short walk to the beach, 10 minutes to the international market, 20 minutes to Diamond Head. There were 2 restaurants but we did not try either. We will be back and will try for a room a little higher up but if not 1115 will do just fine.

I enjoyed my stay here. The staff was very helpful. It seems to cater to Korean visitors so we felt a little out of place. Good location. Able to walk to most Waikiki locations. Security was very helpful.

gday everybody,,, a mate of mine decided to get married in hawaii.. so being an average punter with a couple of kids i thought this is gunna hurt( financially) so i got on the tripadvisor sight and looked and looked and looked... WE stayed at this resort for the first half of our stay 4 days there .. the other 4 days hilton hawaiin village.. By staying at this resort we saved enough to allow a few days at a fancy place..this place was EXCELLENT location..mcdonalds for the kids about 1 minute ... beach 2 minutes.. As soon as you walk in you got greeted a lovely smile..no problem attitude,,very nice front desk..The rooms were ordinary looking but very clean and the beds were as good as the fancy hotel.You can wash your clothes down stairs for 2 dollars. park the car undercover for 20 bucks which is good by hawaiin standards.You dont wait for the lifts like the fancy hotels.Everything you need is a slingshot away..Next time i go to Hawaii i will stay there for the whole stay and spend my money on better things then a bed..(fancy hotel).. When your in hawaii you want to get out and explore the island,, do things.. come back to a nice clean bed!!! this is that place.. ..free wifi in lobby... a small clean pool if you wanted a dip..this place never felt crowded.. go to the abc shops which are like little convenience shops.. good value.. hard rock made great burgers.. tony romanos was a great rib joint that was tasty..plenty of places to eat and drink.If you want to go and swim at the fancy hotels just throw your towel over your shoulder and walk on in...you are allowed.... by a cocktail sit down..relax. hire a car from alamo for $480 dollars fully insured for everything for 4 days.....jeep cherokee soft top.. the other 4 days caught the bus which was easy as..Anyways i could tell you all about our holiday .... but rest assured you will not go wrong staying here!!!!!!!!! queensland mick........aloha..haha
We enjoyed our stay there, it's close to every where, beach, Shopps, every thing.Very nice staff, free Internet at the loopy.Highy appricited.
We stayed again and we were not disappointed. The staff were again great. It's close to everything clean and a good bang for your buck. We will be back again next year. Again thanks to Susie.

Just spent ten days at the Waikiki Resort, this was our fifth time there and I must say they are five for five in our books.From the moment we arrived we were treated like family.When we arrived we were met by Branden and Nancy who have been there since our first visit so it was nice to catch up.The first morning we looked forward to seeing our good friend Gary at the Bell desk, he is always happy to see return guests and always takes the time to say hello.Gil in the Ilama cafe always has a smile and warm welcome when he see's us.The room we had was great, our housekeeper Shufen kept it spotless and always stocked with towels.One morning we were coming back from breakfast and we ran into her in the hallway, she had a big smile on her face and said welcome home.Branden at the front desk and Trent at the bell desk usually work afternoons, if we have a question on where to eat or something to do they always have a great suggestion.We can hardly wait to go back next year to catch up with our friends, and take in all of the Aloha spirit the give out at the Waikiki Resort.In short we would like to say Mahalo to Branden,Gary,Gil, Shufen,Nancy and Trent.Thanks for everything and we look forward to seeing you next year.

Stayed at this hotel for 18 nites. 30 seconds to Macdonalds and 60 seconds to the beach. Great reception upon check in and out. Great maid service at least on the 18th floor. Above average clean and rooms just 3 to 4 years old. Best price for Wiakiki area. Ask for room with sun most of the day if you like sitting in the sun. Our room had a view of the partly ocean, diamond head and mountains , as they call them there. Good things,-- Beach towels, towels at pool, good shower, good elevators, good laundry, good size rooms, great maid service, CENTRAL AIR COND. internet, close to major bus stops 2 minutes, front desk friendly and helpful, Thanks to Sue, Nancy, and Shufen the house keeper. Will return for sure.

Upon discovery that my cancer had returned, my oncologist scheduled a PET-SCAN and a follow-up visit the next day with another oncologist on Oahu. Being from Maui, this meant an overnight stay on Oahu. No where was a room to be found until the Waikiki Resort Hotel management came to my rescue. An opening occurred and they plugged me right in.Once again, I am returning to Oahu for surgery at the height of the season. Naturally I called upon their Aloha spirit and accommodations for my husband have been found. He will get to enjoy this beautiful hotel with its wonderful, friendly personnel. We cannot thank them enough!

I recently went to this hotel and found it to be in a very location to the beach but terribly noisy at night. The fridge, the plumbing and just general loud noise made it very difficult to sleep without ear plugs. I also found hairs in the bed. When I asked to change room because some horrible black stuff filled up in the bath they moved to a room that hadn't been cleaned yet. Eventually I got a new room that was clean but still very noisy. The view also isn't what the pictures suggest unless you pay a lot of money for a better room. Mostly you will see the concrete hotels surrounding this one. The manager was however very good about my complaint but and has offered me two free nights there but I'm not sure I want to go back. Also the internet never worked for me. The staff in the restaurant are lovely though.

This was our first trip to Hawaii. I generally do extensive research before we travel and will comment on our own experiences and supply some opinions on previous reviews.The Hotel: Is somewhat dated but appeared to be clean and safe for anyone travelling on a budget. I used the free WiFi in the Lobby and it was suitable for my needs. We were on the 4th floor (Room 404) away from the elevators. It was a small room but adequate. The washroom door opened on to the toilet bowl - no big deal. Street noise was OK but it is located in an active area, there is always something going on. Door slams from other rooms were annoying but I think this was more a factor of inconsiderate patrons. There are ways to close your door to limit noise. On windy days the lanai door rattled as did the adjoining room door. Stuffed a folded piece of paper in the crack - problem solved. People were up and about very early to catch tour busses, thats just they way it is on holidays, good luck on trying to sleep in (bring ear plugs). Maid service was good and they were extremely friendly. Front counter service was adequate. As previously mentioned this hotel caters to Korean Airlines flight crews and Korean visitors. They tend to keep to themselves and seemed to go out of their way not to interact with other Patrons?Location: Excellent. Close to all amenities. Stores, restaurants and bus stops. ABC stores everywhere. Varied selection of restaurants, budget and higher end. "The bus" system is good, used alot by tourists and locals. You can get schedules on-line or from the McDonald's restaurant 1 block towards the beach. Be patient on the bus it is cheap but not speedy. If you choose to rent a car use www.discounthawaiicarrental.com they have a Budget Car Rental office 1 block away at the Hyatt regency Hotel on the second floor. Rented a car for 2 individual days and drove the North shore. I did not want to pay the high car parking fees.Misc: Stayed on the Diamond Head side of Waikiki Beach. Not as busy. Snorkelled and saw a large variety of fish. Bring water shoes as the bottom is rocky. Bishops Museum was good as i learned alot of Hawaiin history and the Geology of the Island. Pearl Harbour was Ok. I enjoyed the displays before the USS Arizona memorial the best. North Shore was lovely and more layed back. Snorkeled at Kuilima Cove (Turtle Bay) and had Shrimp Scampi at Giovanni's Shrimp truck, just past (East) of the Turtle Bay turn off. Used Speedy Shuttle to get to and from the airport. Very good service. Snorkelling at Hanauma Bay was good. Saw green sea turtles, eels and a large variety of fish. Take bus #22 on Kuhio street. The bus tends to fill up. Best to walk westward on Kuhio a few blocks to ensure you can sit down on the bus instead of standing.Thats it! Hope this helps.

I did lots of research online before picking a hotel for our first trip to Hawaii. This hotel seemed to have the best balance of value, location, and positive reviews of any in our price range. Our stay was even better than we expected. We were there for our first anniversary and I had contacted the hotel GM prior to arrival. He was nice enough to upgrade us to an available room with an amazing view and even had a bottle of wine on ice for us at the time of our arrival. Thank you Mr. Vergara!We loved the balcony and used it every day to sit and relax and enjoy the warm evenings. The beds and pillows were probably the most comfortable of any hotel that my wife and I can remember. We really did sleep well. The location is great. There is so much to do in such a close proximity even if the beach (which is 1 block away) isn't tops on your list.We would definitely go back.

I stayed five nights at the Waikiki Beach Resort. My quiet room on the fourth floor had two double beds, a telephone, a television with many satellite channels, a safe, a refrigerator, a closet with adequate hangers, and a balcony with a small table and two chairs. The bathroom was clean and had a shower, but it had no bathtub. There was adequate shampoo, body lotion and bar soap. The hotel is well located only one block from Waikiki Beach. The lobby has no door; it is open to the street, which causes the lobby to be very noisy from the motor traffic (especially busses) that pass by frequently. There was free WiFi but only in the lobby; there were few places to sit there. The breakfast buffet was satisfactory, but it costs $15 per but person, which I thought was too expensive.

I am a travel agent and was escorting a group that stayed here a few days before our cruise on Norwegian's Pride of America. We were one block from the beach, and with the oceanview rooms, you could watch the surfers on Waikiki Beach from our balcony. Although the rooms are rather small, they were clean and the bed were very comfortable. Check in was the easiest I've ever experienced, and the employees were all top rate--friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable. They even have a self service laundry on the lower floor, which was also very handy.

I am a frequent traveler to Honolulu due to business and have stayed at several hotels in the Waikiki area. By far this hotel was the best in this price range. I found the front desk staff helpful, rooms clean and comfortable, and an excellent location one block off of the beach. What was even more of a surprise is the availability of parking included with your room which is a premium in Waikiki. Though the rooms were a bit on the smaller side, they are comparable to most in the area. The biggest drawback is the bath configuration being a bit awkward to move around with the location of the door, shower and toilet. Other than this minor inconvenience, this is an excellent location for a business traveler, and a short walk to the beach or fast food restaurant for coffee in the early morning. Without a doubt I will stay again on my next business trip.

Every time I am on O'ahu, I stay at Waikiki Resort. The employees are friendly, helpful, and savvy; parking uncomplicated; business center, laundry room, and Internet access is available. There is a great cafe and sushi/bar lounge downstairs, spa, and pool. The rooms are large and have kitchenettes- microwave, fridge, sink, dishes, and utensils. The hotel is situated half a city block from the main boulevard and the beach on a street not crowded by tourists.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Waikiki before moving on the Maui. They offered a special online discount. Pay for 2 nights get the 3rd free which helped me to decide on this hotel as the other hotels in the area were so expensive, and I was not there to spend time in my room. The 18th floor room had a good view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach and the ocean. The room was very tired looking. The carpet and bedding has seen better days and we did make sure to keep our shoes on when walking on the carpet. We booked a junior suite and it was good size and had a small kitchenette which we used to keep cold drinks and snacks in and to make coffe and tea in the morning. Bathroom was in dire need of an update. The location was very close to everything in Waikiki. I did find the staff pleasant and helpful and buffett breakfast was good but would get boring if you ate there everyday for a week, as it didn't change at all. I did hear some traffic noise at night but we were in the middle of a big city, so it is to be expected and it wasn't bad enought to keep us up.We did try the pool one afternoon and it is not heated and was so cold we didn't get past our toes. Since I paid alot of money to go to Hawaii the last thing I wanted was a polar bear dip!All in all it was an OK hotel and served the purpose, but I think the management should look at replacing the bedding and carpets and freshing up the decor.

Great location, well priced clean basic hotel. Helpful staff, parking available. Laundry available. I didn't use the pool because it is so close to the beach! Nearby restaurants, board rentals. A very nice hotel and vacation

Booked the hotel due to location, price and visitor reports, but found the hotel and staff not as reported in some reviews. I had excellent help from the front desk (print out of bus routes as an example), concierge very helpful, staff doing the room always pleasant, bellhop willing to help in directions. Found food at Ilima restaurant good and had fun with the staff in the lounge. Spent 13 days and enjoyed it all. Great location, would stay again and recommend to friends.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikki Resort Hotel last year and we are going back for sure!!!!I cant get over how the staff looked after us at the hotel.we stayed for 6 days after our cruise. they helped us find the best of everything in Waikki at the best price and the room was always clean. Susie if the best giving us a great room and made us feel like family. This year we called the hotel and again we were looked after top drawer. This is why we are staying twice as long at this hotel this year. Close to the beach the stripand resturants and its quiet. I will keep you posted on this years stay.

This hotel is one block off Waikiki Beach and my room had a balcony where you could see the beach and surf. It was the first time I had ever visited a hotel with no front door. It is open because the temperature never gets cold. It has very good restaurants and service. I spent most of my time exploring, so I wasn't in the rooms much.

We vacationed here with a family of 4, having very low expectations for this hotel due to reading previous reviews. What willed us to stay here? Location. I cannot express how greatly located this hotel is, but due to several issues such as customer service, cleanliness of rooms etc, it heavily weighs down the hotel to be nothing but very average, if that. As stated in the title, the hygiene and cleanliness of our rooms were very questionable. The carpet was of a colour and texture that encouraged us to keep our flip flops on whilst staying in the room, the shower was moldy with a hair on it when we arrived and the bed sheets had holes in it. Now thinking about it, the hygiene of rooms being questionable may be an understatement. We may as well have been staying in the same room as our neighbours due to being awoken at all times of the night by them. I'm not blaming them for the noise, but simply to the paper thin sheet that divided us and the adjoining room. Now, should you ever need help for entertainement or cuisine options in Hawaii, look no further than Walter the concierge located by the front desk. But do not be allusioned by the fact that he works for the hotel - he works for expedia funny enough. He has a vast range of knowledge, especially of Waikiki and knows the Island inside and out. Walter was indeed the highlight of the hotel for our family.Overall stay here if you want to save that extra cash for shopping but are willing to compromise on hygiene, are never acknowledged or helped by the front desk and are willing to live all cozied up. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Waikiki because of the location this hotel had to offer.

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort hotel from December 27-January 1 and were quite pleased with the location of our hotel. We paid a little more to get a room with a view of the beach ... well worth it. It was very close to the beach and shops. No internet or wifi in the lobby or the hotel room. It seems that this hotel caters to the client of Korean airlines and the front desk certainly makes their stay a priority. We had problems with the parking access every day and had to constantly get assistance from the front desk to let us out of the hotel parking. The hotel could also use an interior update as well ... the carpeting appeared to be very dirty. I would try a different hotel on my next visit to Hawaii.

The only things really going for this hotel is it's great location and the concierge, Walter. One small block back from the beach it is literally a 30 second walk to the beach and the shops and restaurants of Waikiki. Yet you didn't get much street noise at night.Walter is very knowledgeable and informative. He clearly has a passion for his job and Hawaii. He was friendly and was always happy to chat, pass on tips and good deals on activities. What's more he is just a very interesting and cool guy to talk to. Ironically he works for Expedia, not the hotel.As for the front desk staff. Well they were unfriendly to the point of being down right rude! Some of them obviously do not want to be there and don't deserve the job. The housekeeping staff were always friendly and smiling, but the housekeeping itself was very average. The Bell staff were also friendly and helpful.We stayed for two weeks and had a standard room with two double beds. It was a bit small for a family of four but we weren't in the room that much so it didn't really bother us. The room had a door to the adjoining room which must have been paper thin. A couple of times I woke up in a panic early in the morning thinking a Chinese market had opened up in our room but it was just the racket in the adjoining room!The hotel is quite tired an worn out.The manager advises on this page that they intend to spend some money on refurbishing and updating. That will be interesting but they should also invest some money in customer service and house keeping training.On the whole, as the heading says, don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed. We chose to go the budget route to have a bit more spending money so didn't expect to much. Having now seen the location of some of the more expensive options we considered, I am happy with the choice. Would I stay here again? Probably not, although I could be swayed by the proposed refurbishment, given the location. I would however pop in to see Walter to book my activities and have a chat.

December 2011 stayed at the Waikiki Resort.Good room , but the view over the other hotels was not good.Lots of apartments that are shabby to say the least.Room was always cleaned well, furnishings nice and good size television.No internet in room but they advertise wifi in the lobby, which didnt work on several occasions.Small fridge and coffee maker in room. Great location, within 2 mins walk to beach and 5 mins to Int Market place.Front desk was helpful and reservations good as well.Parking , the cheapest i have found in waikiki at 18 per day.would stay there again.

Excellent value for a location so close to Waikiki beach - just one street back. Staff are very helpful and the rooms are fine although the bathrooms are small.Hotel is orientated to Asian guests so you'll be fine if you want Korean or Japanese food. If that is not your thing, there are plenty of other places around.Our room was near the lifts which were noisy so avoid that if you can.

The best thing about the hotel was Walter, the concierge. He was knowledgable, funny and very helpful. The front desk people were not very nice and helpful. The hotel is located in a greatr spot, but it is located on a very windy street, so hold on to your hat! I would stay here again because of Walter.

My husband and I, along with my sister and her husband, stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel in December for two nights prior to a Hawaiian cruise. We found the hotel very comfortable and the people very friendly. It is not a new hotel, and shows some signs of aging, but the recent remodel includes all new furnishings and amenities.
