The Ilima restaurant serves a very good breakfast, and is also open for lunch. The waiter in there was particularly pleasant. There is also a nice looking Korean restaurant though we didn't try it. The hotel is less than two blocks from the beach and all of the shops and restaurants of Waikiki.

It would have been an above average hotel (in it's price range) but being greeted by pee stains on the bathroom toilet seat upon check in does leave a bad first impression. Otherwise everything else was OK, but note that it is an older hotel, and you get that "worn" smell from the bed sheets. A definite highlight was our wonderful concierge Walter, who was extremely helpful, efficient, knowledgable, funny and animated.

My sons and I stayed at the Waikiki Resort hotel this past summer and I can only say that it was a truly pleasurable experience. Obviously other negative reviewers may have been affected by loud neighbors or some random street noises--but overall you can have that issue with ANY hotel near a boulevard. The staff were extremely friendly, the breakfast restaurant was small but very accommodating--and you're located right across the street from the beach. Unless you wish to pay 2 to 3 times as much money--this is a fine choice.

Hi..My english is poor..sorrybut thank you for your serviceI called my family in korea for your helpingSincerity for your helping.And. Almost staff is kind..I think so..This resort is the central part of a cityBye see you again..

I write this at 5am as I have been woken up ONCE AGAIN by the extremely loud door latches and people coming and going. The wind rattles the patio slider almost constantly. This hotel caters to Asian Foreigners, which means the restaurants and gift shop are a bit off in terms of what an American might expect, my 5am brain cannot put it any better than that.Parking is $17 per day and Internet is $40. Don't use the Skywave internet, it does not work.

This hotel was booked by a travel agent for us and was not what I expected. Although facilities were adequate the hotel looked old, tired and tatty. The carpets in the guest rooms looked like they needed a clean, bedspreads were very faded and their was not an electric jug to boil water for tea or anything else. There was a sink, mini fridge and microwave, cutlery and some crochery but only an american style coffee machine. No tea bags or anything else provided. We travelled with another couple and their room did not have any of these facilities in it and their room was not ready when we checked in. They had to wait several hours for it to be ready.Breakfast provided was not of the standard I expected. Food was oily and not much variety although tasted OK.

This hotel is a great 3star property we stayed here for our first 4 nights in Waikiki. Rooms are a decent size, the beds were comfortable. Overall no complaints about the room we had. Though the shower/bathtub was a bit weird i have never seen such a small bathtub! I dont even know if it would classify as a bathtub... if you needed to bathe young children or babies its great, for an adult, well you could really only sit crosslegged. We just used the shower! Outside noise is also quite loud considering how high up out room was (16th floor) But noise doesnt really bother me when i sleep.What i loved about the hotel was the location!! literally 50ms away from the beach, a few min walk to the moana surfrider and to where all the shops/restaurants are. The hotel has free wifi for use in the lobby, there is also a restaurant where you can have breakfast at - though i would give this place a miss and go elsewhere, we ate there on our first day due to the convenience and the food was basic. there are other places you can eat at for breakfast that have better selection and are cheaper. The biggest disappointment for me there was that the fruit was canned....... uhmmm i did not fly all the way over to hawaii for canned fruit!! lol  I found the staff not overly friendly... they didnt ackowledge us when we walked past or even smile (but then we didnt exactly go out of our way to acknowledge them either. Im sure if we asked questions etc they would have been more then helpful. Paid around $120 a night and aside from a few tiny little flaws I would recommend this hotel to my family/friends travelling to hawaii that want to stay in a 'budget' style hotel that is in a great location and if all you want is a place to sleep that is comfortable then this is the hotel for you.

This hotel was awesome. I came with 2 friends and we stayed for a week. The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms had plenty of space and we loved the ocean view. I had no complaints about the noise from the street.. .in fact it was pretty quiet. It is in a great location just a minute from the beach. Make sure to check out Duke's breakfast buffet on the strip and Dixie Grill near the stadium ( great BBQ after a day at the Swap Meet ) We also went to Senator Fong's plantation... and had an amazing time. The drive out there is beautiful and it is so green and lovely there. Also Ko'lina and Lanikai are must sees. The beaches there are beautiful and not crowded. I am already planning my trip back and will be staying at this hotel again !

We just spent 10 nights at the Waikiki Resort with no major complaints. I was disappointed at no free wifi in room but I knew that before I stayed and used the wifi for free in the lobby. I was annoyed that you could not make a local call in your room without first providing your credit card details where in most hotels local calls are free. Then when I wanted to call international from the phones in the lobby, you had to either have a phone card or again use your credit card and this was really annoying. The housekeeping staff were really nice, as with most of the front desk staff. Parking is cheaper than other hotels in Waikiki at $18 a night but still expensive. We had a junior suite on the 15th floor which faced the ocean and it was lovely to sit on the balcony at night as we were able to look down on Kalakaua ave between the hotels in front. We were there during APEC but did not have too many drama's which was good and the staff were helpful in advising of potential impacts. I would recommend the hotel but would recommend to the hotel that they should look into the phone situation!

Best part of this Hotel is the close access to the beach - 5 minute walk tops. Your also a block off Kalakaua Ave, which is the main sidewalk/road in front of the beach. There is a Health club a block away, and you're in the heart of restaurants and shopping. I did a package deal combining airline, room, and rental car on orbitz, and for five nights six days it was roughly $850 per person total - great deal!Rooms are average, nothing special. Restaurant is average, with overpriced buffets - but again, you're a short walk from all kinds of restaurants. Didn't even make it to the pool, because the beach was so close. Parking is additional, which seems to be standard for all, (we paid $18.00 a day), which was on the cheaper side comparatively. Everyone from the front desk, housecleaning, and restaurant personal were all very friendly and helpful.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. Our room was compact, but clean and tidy and we had a view of the beach, which was a bonus. There was a connecting door to the next room and this was not well sealed,as we smelt cigarette smoke one day when we entered our room. Considering it is a smoke-free hotel, we reported it to the housekeeper who promptly reported it to security and they sorted it out immediately. The room rate was reasonable considering we were only a block back from the beach. There was a laundry in the basement for guests to use. The hotel is in a great location, it may not be as fancy as some of the other hotels in Waikiki, but we were out and about most of the day and as long as the bed is comfortable and the room is clean, we are satisfied.

The location can't be beat! It is literally steps away from the beach, shopping, and restaurants. And there is the ever-present ABC Store on the corner across from the beach. The rooms are average. We had our room switched after the first night because the bathroom was so tight. It had a tiny shower you could barely turn around in. Our new room was larger and more comfortable. The bathroom had a tub/shower and the lay-out was better. Room 1712 doesn't have an ocean view, but the view was still pretty of the homes on the hillside. This hotel has 19 floors, but the only floor with ice and vending is on the second floor. The soda machine was out of service when we were there, so we bought it at the ABC store. The pool is small and basic. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Just basic, with no fancy amenities. There is a mini fridge in the room.What my husband and I liked the most about Waikiki Resort Hotel was that it's walking distance to just about everything. We walked to Duke's Restaurant at the Outrigger for the breakfast buffet. Right across the street from there is the International Marketplace. We walked to the aquarium. We took the bus to Diamond Head. It's a 10 minute walk from the bus stop to the start of the climb. But we actually walked back to the hotel afterwards! It took about 45 minutes. If you're looking for an affordable, comfortable place to hang your hat while in Waikiki, I would recommend it. We would stay here again. But, if you're looking for more amenities and more of a true resort, then stay at the Hilton!

My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October.. we stayed here as it was a cheaper option and the other reviews seemed quite good. The hotel is absolutley crawling with Japanese and Korean Tourist and Tour Groups, so the lobby is always crowded! Their was also a few school groups that were so rowdy!!! We were "upgraded" to a Junior Suite.. I shudder to think of what our room would have looked like if it wasn't a Junior Suite!! The rooms BADLY need a refurb, however the beds are still quite comfy. The hotel is in a good location, only one block back from the beach, but we just were not impressed at all. I would not reccomend this hotel and I would not go back.

Great value for money located only one block from the beach. The concierge Walter gave us lots of excellent advice. We paid extra for an ocean view room and it was very worth our while. Had almost everything we needed. It would have been good to have free WiFi. Didn't use the pool as the ocean was right across the road. We would stay there again.

Hoping for a reasonable hotel we weren't disappointed. Just 1 block from the beach, it's location is ideal. Not sure what the views are like from the front, but there are taller buildings in most directions...but who cares when you're not planning on sitting on the balcony looking at a view when you can actually be out there and part of it. The outside pool area has ample room for chilling out away from the busy beach front...and the freely available pool side towels are very handy. The reception area which is/was completely open to the outside at the main entrance, in terms of having no doors, is a most welcoming space and the on site booking of trips by a great guy from Expedia could not have been handled more professionally. There is a ramp to complement the front steps, but there are steps in the breakfast area (couldn't tell if there was a movable ramp available should one be required). There were some signs of wear and tear on the building, and our room, but not enough to detract too much. We did not try the Spa, main restaurant, or 'Karaoke' bar. There is a trolley bus stop right outside the front of the hotel, and restaurants of all types within a few minutes walk (although some are worth walking that bit further to get to). Hawaii is very popular with Korean visitors and this hotel sems to be the hotel of choice for some of their flight crew/staff (as well as there being an on site Korean Airways 'shop'). A more expensive hotel would probably not have added anything to our overall experience/trip.

super convenient location, and great value in Waikiki. Not fancy, but clean, well kept and was as expected (the website photos matched what we actually experienced!) I would stay there again in Waikiki

Having stayed in many locations all over Oahu was very happy with the Waikiki Resort. Older property like all in Waikiki, kept in good shape.Location 1 block off the ocean, many choices for food within walking distance. our favorite take-out Korean just around the corner.I don't think the Marriott next door is that much better, just more $$$ and so crowded. Three of us stayed in a large room with double plus couch bed, kitchenette and partial ocean view This suited our needs.

I stayed for 7 nights at the Waikiki Resort Hotel in September because I was attending the wedding of a friend on the beach on the north shore of Oahu. I arrived a little early (12:30 pm) and was still able to check-in to my room on the 11th floor facing the Hyatt Regency - a city view rather than partial ocean or mountain view. The room included a free safe that I was encouraged to definitely use, an iron and ironing board, coffee maker, hair dryer, microwave and refrigerator. In the lobby there was a very costly Internet computer with printer (I found a much cheaper place just around the corner), a laundry, coffee shop and bar. The room, in my opinion, was clean but the decor definitely needs updating. There was some noise between rooms and even on an upper floor I could still easily hear street noise because of a gap between the glass doors leading to the balcony.The room was a little small and the shower was very small but the bed was large and comfortable with mushy pillows. The room also included a flat screen TV with a very limited range of channels and no premium options but then who goes to Waikiki to watch television.The hotel was located in a great area just off Waikiki Beach between Kalakaua Avenue and Kuhio Avenue so getting to the beach was literally only a 1-minute walk. Also, all the buses to Diamond Head, downtown, the Ala Moana Shopping Center, etc. run down Kuhio Avenue so the entire city is also only a 1-minute walk and $2.50 bus ride away.I took the Robert's Hawaii bus from the airport to the hotel in less than 60 minutes. I made my reservation and paid the round trip fare ($9 from the airport and $6 to the airport) online but you could just get on the bus at the airport and pay the fare in cash (most did it this way) and then call at least 24 hours before to arrange the return pickup. Since this hotel is located at the far eastern end of Waikiki I was one of the last off from the airport and one of the first on for the return trip. Both trips were on very large, clean, air conditioned coaches and was a nice stress-free and cheap way to get to and from HNL.I enjoyed my stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and would return. The price was very good, the location great and everything was as I expected it to be - this isn't a 5 star resort so don't expect that. This is a good value hotel with clean rooms in a good location.

I have to say it is rather nice to be reading positive reviews about this hotel! We stayed there for (sadly) only four nights in September and it could not have been better. I always use Trip Advisor to check out a hotel before we go, but the golden rule is: read as many as you like but take a balanced view! One review I read complained about the room/food/service etc on TA before speaking to the manager and giving them an opportunity to put things right.We arrived quite late at night after a very long flight from England (30+ hrs) so we were very tired and not in the best of moods. The check in staff worked quickly and efficiently to get everyone into their rooms with the minimum of fuss. The room was quite high up, 16th floor, which was a blessing because of a little traffic noise, and first impressions were excellent. The main thing is always cleanliness….if a place is dirty; you are not going to enjoy it. The room was immaculate, with two Queen beds, a washbasin area and a separate shower. The beds were comfortable, the aircon was good, there was a TV if needed and a small balcony. We stayed for four nights and I can honestly say it was superb. The only (small) problem we had was with the safe….it wouldn’t lock. A guy from customer services came within minutes to fix it and although it took another couple of visits to sort it out, this was again done with courtesy and efficiency. I truthfully believe a lot of reviews on Trip Advisor are from serial complainers. If you want five star service, go somewhere else and pay a hell of a lot more for it. In our case we want a good clean hotel in a nice location, with friendly staff and at a good price. The Waikiki Resort ticks all these boxes and more. We will definitely be returning to Hawaii for another longer stay at some point and we would be happy to stay at this hotel again. Thank you and well done to the management and staff!
Great location, 2min from the beach in Waikiki. Extremely clean and friendly staff. Basic 3* hotel but ideal as a base. Will go back definitely

We stayed at this resort in April.The staff were friendly and helped us with info of the area.The rooms were Clean and of decent size but the bathroom was very small and if you like a tub there is none only a shower which was ok for us.The room was very stinky when we entered but i think that was because the room was closed up with the air conditioning on.I purchased a can of Fabreze at the ABC store and sprayed the room when i returned there was no smell the rest of the week.There was a safe (free),small fridge,and a coffee maker with Tea & Coffee in the room which was replenished every day.We also had our Bed made and new Towels every day.The hotel was just a block from the Beach and most sites like the Zoo which was worth the 10 dollarsUS.The hotel also included three restaurants which i honestly wouldn't recommend mostly because of the lack of ambience and the price you pay for it,there was plenty of nice restaurants in a 1/2mile radius from the hotel.Its a decent 3 star hotel and for the price we payed it was well worth it.And would recommend it ,especially for families.

Greetings ! we stayed in this hotel for 10 days.(2nd time in O'ahu)The location was great. The room was clean and updated. We had the city view and glad we were on the 18th floor. We still heard a lil traffic from Kalakaua but as I said we're glad we're the top floor and it filtered most of the noise. The parking was quite steep at $18 but it gave you in and out priveleges. We didn't get to eat in any of their restaurants but will try nextime. The front desk staff were accommodating and special thanks to Mr. Efren for accommodating our requests. You are a gem in this hotel. Thanks Nancy, you were right the room was nice. Special Thanks to the cleaning staff who cleaned our room everyday. it kinda got messy as we were out almost everyday exploring the island.Wifi was a plus for checking quick emails. although i found myself downstairs ffor almost 2 hrs with a lil slow connection. I will definitely consider to stay here again. It is a 3.5 star hotel not fancy BUT i'm so glad they kept it clean and basic is what we needed. See you guys next year.. I wish you had a frequent visitors card and perks for 2nd 3rd 4th time visitors or even more. Cheers!( wow my first ever post!)

I stayed here with my husband for four nights. The reception staff were polite and efficient. The room was spacious and comfortable, with plenty of towels and toiletries and in room coffee and microwave.The only drawback was the noise from outside, although this didn't interfere with our sleep.The location was great one road away from the beach.

Spent 4 days in this hotel & the service was exceptional. All front desk were polite, friendly & helpful. Walter the concierge went out of his way to assist us.Any staff encountered smiled & spoke - lovely. The location of this hotel is excellent, everything necesssary within 2mins of front foyer. Coffee/ice cream/clothing/general shopping.The foyer itself is a great place to sit & chat with other travellers & wi-fi is available.The rooms are clean but are in need of a spruce up.The pool area is too small & quickly becomes crowded but hey the beach is only 2 mins walk.These are minor issues & the Waikiki Resort is value for money & a great place to stay.Recommended & will return.

Well, my wife and I just finished our second stay at the Waikiki Resort and we must say we had an equally wonderful time – maybe even better! Waikiki is the most amazing place and your stay at the Waikiki Resort puts you right in the heart of it. Access to the zoo and parks, the Aquarium, Diamond Head (exceptional 360-degree views from the top!), shops and the International Marketplace is unparalleled from this location. Everything (except Diamond Head - take the trolley) is within easy walking distance and the people watching and sight seeing make every step enjoyable. Returning to Waikiki Resort felt like we were returning to our home away from home. It is the best of all worlds when comparing location, views, price, hospitality and amenities. It has to be the best deal in Waikiki!Our room was lovely, comfortable and most welcoming. While not quite oceanfront views ,at just half a block away, we still had exhilirating views of the ocean and mountains. We made sure to spend adequate time lounging on the balcony to enjoy the views.We love living on the Big Island but visiting Waikiki is special even for "locals". Waikiki Resort maximizes our enjoyment while keeping it affordable. We now hope to return annually. On this trip we purchased the tourist's bible "Oahu Revealed" and we will do more pre-planning to get the most out of our future stays. We like playing "tourist" and taking advantage of what Waikiki Resort has to offer, we expect that someday we will be almost as familiar with Oahu as we are with the Big Island of Hawaii.Aloha!

My family and I stayed for 2 weeks in June 2011. We traveled with another family member and they stayed in a separate room for the same length of time. We were treated exceptionally well by the Front Office Manager, Adam Miyasato! We had a couple of issues arise during our stay, which is to be expected when staying for such a long duration, but all of our issues were dealt with promptly and exceeded our highest expectations!! This was our second stay at the Waikiki Resort, due to the proximity to the beach, clean rooms, security, value, parking, washer/dryer availability, and friendliness of staff! In my opinion, this hotel is a tremendous value for the aforementioned reasons and many others!! Mahalo to the Waikiki Resort for making our stay in Waikiki such a memorable one and we will see you again in the future!

My daughter & I just spent 8 days at the Wakiki Resort Hotel. We had a partial ocean view room which was great to wake up to every morning. We tried the buffet breakfast during our stay which was very nice. The location was so convenient, one minute walk to the beach & one minute walk to the bus stop to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The tour desk is run by Expedia staff who were fantastic in arranging a few day trips and an evening Luau for us, thank you, Walter, once again for all your help. There is free Wi Fi in the lobby which is very handy & laundry facilities in the basement area of the hotel.They will supply you with towels for both the pool & the beach. BTW, nice pool area too, great for dipping into after the beach. Just to sum up, it felt like a home away from home. I'm going to recommend this hotel to all my friends. To be honest, I spent hours looking at other hotels & reviews before I booked this Hotel and I was very pleased with my choice. Thank you Wakiki Resort Hotel for making our holiday so wonderful! I'm looking forward to spending more time in the future at this Hotel

After an arduous summer schedule, my mother and I took a much needed vacation and stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. The staff, especially the Expedia staff, was helpful. The rooms were kept in clean condition with complimentary coffee and a beautiful partial ocean view. What I appreciated most was the location--it took mere minutes to walk to Waikiki Beach.There was also free Internet in the lobby for those who have wireless connection. Otherwise, there is an Internet "office" with several computers for use. I will definitely be returning!

My cousin got married on August 16th, 2011, & chose this hotel to reserve a block of rooms for her guests. I didn't check the discounted rate because I was able to get a government rate for at least 33% off on the Jr. Suite. That was the first thumbs up.We arrived 2.5 hours before check-in and the room was already available. A very big plus for them to generously let us check-in early. The wedding was at 5pm in the Kahala Resort. So we were able to eat, take a nap, & visit my aunt & uncle in another room.We stayed in room 1713, a corner junior suite. The extra sink, microwave oven, & fridge were very convenient. The double bed was comfy and the sheets felt very clean. The sofabed is comfortable as a couch; as a bed, it was small for two adults. My father ended sleeping on the couch cushions on the floor.The partial ocean view showed us the surfers in the light blue-blue waters. Balcony had two chairs and the breeze was nice.Parking is free, unlike most hotels in Waikiki who charge $20-25 per day. Our stay was short (14 hours) so we did not have time to use the $15 voucher for the restaurant adjacent to the lobby, we received on check-in.I liked that we were near the International Marketplace, a block from the beach, and on the Diamondhead side of Waikiki Beach. It was quiet and relaxing.

I'm going to make this review short since already reviewed it last year. My wife and I returned to celebrate our third wedding anniversary. Like I wrote in my last review. We made friends for life. A very big Maholo to Sherri from reservations and her family for making this a very memorable trip. She bought my wife and myself a beautiful fruit basket for our anniversary. The front desk staff as usual was excellent with directions, answering questions or just greeting us everytime we passed the front desk. Maholo to Nancy, Branden and Susie. As you can see from other reviews this place is a hidden gem just a block from the beach. Don't hesitate to book here. The property is nice but the staff is even nicer.

i had a nice vacation in hawaii with my mom last october. the hotel is good.. basic .. though our room was a little small but still ok. its just a block away from the waikiki beach. at night we simply walked along the streets and reach nice places like the international market. the breakfast was basic.. but the people there were so nice and attentive. while waiting for our airport transfer we were entertained by a simple cultural presentation at the lobby.

Stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for a week stay and I was truely impressed. The staff was great, and the location was perfect for the family. It was right around the corner from McDonalds (which is a plus with young kids) and just a short walk to Waikiki Beach. I have a 5 year old, so when I mean short, it was short. He never had a problem, in fact never fussed at all. (He always does if he needs to walk alot) The tour bus pick ups for most all the major events was just across the street. Another great plus for myself and the family. I have to send Kudos out to Brandon at the front desk. I am in the customer service/hospitality business. His mannerism and superior customer service really shines through at the front desk. Also our housekeeper, Tae...become a very welcome person to see each day. Always asking and making sure our needs were taken care of. Overall, a very friendly and great experience. It was our first time there, I can honestly say that we'll be back.

We couldn't believe how nice and friendly everyone was. Our rooms were even ready before 3 pm. Our room had a balcony with trade winds cooling us off as we watched white doves flitting about below. Beds were ample and comfortable and the TV gave us all the shows we like to watch on the mainland too. As soon as the elevator door opened on our floor we heard one of the housekeeping staff wish us , "Aloha!" After a long flight from Texas we really felt the welcome of the"Aloha spirit!!"The location could not have been better. We were only 5 minutes away from Waikiki. There were many restaurants as well as a McDonald's and many ABC convenience stores available with drinks, snacks and souvenirs at excellent prices facing Waikiki. Around the corner we even found a church we were able to attend on Saturday evening. Close by on Kuhio street we were able to take the bus for $2.50 to the famous Ala Moana shopping center which only took 15 minutes. We highly recommend this hotel and we would stay there again !!!!

We stayed with our two small children in a one-bedroom unit over spring break. I booked the one bedroom unit as it had the small kitchen and we wanted two rooms. I booked through Travel-Hawaii which always has good rates. I specifically requested the one bedroom King, I booked and paid for the 1-bedroom penthouse, listing all four of us. When I received my hotel confirmation, it listed two double beds, but because I looked at the hotel closely I knew the one bd units were one queen or one king only. I wrote Travel Hawaii, the rep promptly called the hotel rep and got back to me that I was in the right room but it was two doubles only. I called the hotel to double-check because this made no sense to me. Someone at the hotel had indeed decided to book us into a Jr. Suite instead of the one-bedroom: much lower floor, only one room, and no kitchen. There had not been any mention of charging me less either or any attempt to let me know they had changed the room. I told the woman I had booked, and already paid for, the one-bedroom penthouse. She told me that the hotel felt I needed the Jr. Suite because it had a sofa bed, so they changed my reservation. I told her I have inflatable beds for my children that I bring with me, we wouldn't need the sofa bed; we needed the extra room and the kitchen. She was very nice and said she would work on the problem. I wrote to Travel-Hawaii, the rep talked to the hotel rep again, and in the end we arrived and got the one-bedroom. If I hadn't followed up we would have been squashed into the smaller room without notice, because there are only a few one-bedrooms in the entire hotel, all on the top floor. After our stay I think the hotel changed it's room capacity for the one-bedroom units to two people only, which is a shame; we would stay again as a family if they hadn't. We'll take our own little inflatable beds over a used sofabed anyday, and they take up about the same amount of space. If it's just my husband and me we may stay there again someday.Other than this: the rooms were good size, the parking was easy, which is a huge plus to us. The staff very pleasant, we never used the pool because the ocean is one block away. No hot tub, but that was less important to us than location: this hotel is right by a great beach for children. The breakfast is expensive for a family so we never went to the restaurant. There are so many other places to eat and with the small fridge/microwave, dishes, counter space etc, we were set up to eat comfortably in the room. The hotel does not recycle, but the front desk told me to bring our stuff down anyway as there is a lady at the desk who takes it upon herself to recycle the glass and plastic. We enjoyed our stay and there were no glitches in our actual stay. Nice place for the price.

I arrived at 6.45am local time and was told check in was at 3pm which I expected. Was able to store my bags but it would have been nice to have been offered a shower and a place to change. Consequently walked around Waikiki in jeans and t-shirt until 3pm. Checked in and the room was okay. Beds comfortable, showers small but good enough for what you need. Close to all of the nightlife etc. Not bad but you wouldn't be walking across hot coals to go back.

We booked the hotel after reading some reviews and its close proximity to the beach and confirmation of being freshly renovated. This is supposed to be 3 star hotel – far from that. The standard room was of a very rundown decor and very unpleasant view. We decided to upgrade paying $ 20 plus tax per night for a partial ocean view.We ended up with a room that again smells of mould. Mould is clearly visible in washbasin. A photo was taken to prove it. Toilet and shower are in one tiny confined space. Power points in bathroom are loose and basically not fixed to the wall. Coffee and tea making facilities consists of TWO coffee sachets (one decaffeinated), no tea bags, and no milk in fridge etc. Standard of the room is below a motel room in the outback of Australia - an absolute disgrace. We have travelled a lot including China and health and safety where no problem. The Waikiki Resort Hotel is a disgrace it has health and safety issues. If you are allergic to mould don’t book it, if you are worried about accidental electrocution don’t book it. If you actually want a bit of room to move around don’t book it. If you want a clean bathroom without someone else’s hair and mould and dust don’t book it.Holiday takers from Sydney currently occupying room 1515.

This hotel is located in a really good spot, Close to everything. The decor is out dated and has a musty odour to it. This hotel doesn't offer much, but sometimes you can get a good price on-line for this place.

Rooms were too small ,, clustered,, cleanliness was okk,, location was just perfect... 1 block & u r at the world famous waikiki beach .. there is a mcdonalds right below & ABC stores. Just 10 min walk to International market place... otherwise rooms were ok ... guess in places like Waikiki u dont get spacious rooms as was ours in Maui...there can be better places out there i am sure...

My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel, and we were very pleased. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and fresh, and the location was very convenient to everything we wanted to do.We were too lazy to get up for the breakfast buffet, but took advantage of the cafe downstairs several times for lunch. The prices were reasonable and the portions were generous enough to share. I have to say I have eaten fried rice more times than I can count, and theirs is the best I've ever eaten, bar none.Thanks to the owners and staff for making this a wonderful stay in Honolulu!

The hotel is one short block from Waikiki beach(<5 minute walk) and within walking distance to all the high ends shopping and dinings(~10 minute walk). There are lot of smaller eateries nearby. The room is much smaller than average, not smelly or damp, but is showing its old age. The funitures and linens should be retired by now. Overall the hotel is old, but kept clean. The parking is $18/day and if you have a large van or SUV like I did, it can be a challenge to get a big enough spot. There are two restaurants, I ate breakfast and luch in the one in the lobby. The price was reasonable and so were the foods, nothing fancy. I did not try the more gourmet restaurant on the 2nd floor. Overall it was a good stay, except the parking and the passenger drop-off drive way. The drive-way only fits 2 or 3 vehicles at a time, and there's no room any where on the nearby streets to load or unload the passengers safely

Check in staff was efficient, pleasant and personable. The rooms were clean, neat and tidy. The restaurants were priced reasonably, good value, not at all like many hotels. Easy walk to sites, beach, venues, restaurants and shops.

Just like everyone says the Waikiki Resort hotel is a great place to stay since it is close to everything. We didn't spend a lot of time on our room but it was comfortable and convenient. The price and specials they have make it a great deal too.The laundry in the basement was great for washing a few things during our stay. The internet does cost 20 cents a minute but we didn't use it much, but it was nice to have since we didn't bring our own computer. We enjoyed our view of the ocean and Diamond Head from our balcony.We would definitely stay here again.

The problem when choosing a hotel off the net is that too often it disappoints. Not the Waikiki Resort Hotel. From the minute we arrived everything was great. Check-in was a breeze-even though we arrived early, and the room was perfect. Though the view of the ocean was between two buildings (see photo) it was what we expected.Location is really fabulous. A couple blocks north and there are eateries, grocery stores, pharmacies and so on. Two blocks South and you’re on the beach, and maybe 3 blocks from the International Marketplace. Shopping and great restaurants are on your doorstep. Also public transport in the form of buses and trolleys are right there, and I was pleased I did not bother to hire a car.Service was brilliant- we needed a taxi at 4am, and the concierge made certain it happened, with a smile. He even left me the cab drivers cell phone number just in case. It was unnecessary- the cab arrived 10 minutes early to take us to the airport.I’d certainly stay here again.
I loved this place while I was staying here for the 2011 Na Hoku Hanohano Awards.Great location, excellent room, and friendly staff... and can I say they had Hula Dancers on Friday Afternoon!!!!

Location is by far the best thing about this hotel. It's less than a block from Waikiki beach, allowing you to walk to all the shops, restaraunts, and of course the beach. We even walked to the aquarium which was only a mile or so away.The hotel itself is clean and the staff are nice. However, it is VERY out of date. My only real complaint is the beds: they are incredibly uncomfortable and the pillows are awful!

We stayed on the 18th floor with views of Waikiki beach and the ocean.View would be far more spectacular if there wasn't a building twice the size of this one almost directly opposite.Hotel has lift access, swimming pool, laundromat, air conditioning in rooms and only 1 small block from the beach.Partial ocean views from room 1815/1816.Highly recommended!

We stayed here from 3rd May to 11th May in room 1706. We had asked for a room that was away from the elevator and up high when I booked and we got both so we were very happy. Our room was very quiet and we heard very little street noise except for the occasional siren.Check-in was easy and our room was ready when we arrived at 11:30am and they let us right up. Didn't have much to do with the staff but they all seemed friendly enough.Our room was spacious and clean. We had two double beds which was okay because we had a whole bed to put all our shopping on. We had a view of the mountains which was lovely especially at night.The room was cleaned well each day and the cleaner was very nice and unintrusive.We got free wifi in the lobby which we used and appreciated. And although the hotel information stated that they had 3 computers with complimentary free internet, you had to pay for it - 20c for 5 minutes.Location was perfect - half a block to the beach and a nice wander down to the main part of Waikiki.Parking at the hotel was easy - $18 for 24hours with unlimited in and out.There is a small laundry room in the parking garage which was clean and bright.Overall, a good stay and great value. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed at this hotel for a week in March 2011. The hotel is ideally situated; 5 mins to the beautiful beach, 5-10 mins from all shops/restaurants. Rooms are a great size, very clean and the beds so comfortable. There is no noise from the street below. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant in the hotel serving breakfast is well worth a visit, food is hot and plentiful, if I remember it was about £12 for breakfast. If you are planning on spending a lot of time on the beach buy a beach chair from one of the ABC stores (there is one on every corner), I found renting the sun loungers expensive on the beach.If you can tear yourself away from the beach and shops, there are many island trips which take you around Oahu, the scenery is awesome. Hanamaua Bay is stunning and a must for anybody visiting Oahu, great snorkelling.

Settled on Waikiki Resort Hotel after extensively researching Tripadvisor reviews.Had never been to Hawaii but had heard good reports for so long & wanted to organise something out of the ordinary for our special occasion without costing us the earth.The plane trip from Australia is not an uncomfortable distance, (just), & from the moment we arrived on 21st March for our 13 day stay we were so glad we had chosen Waikiki Resort Hotel. The staff were super, the location was superb & so was our room. We chose a Junior Suite, (huge), nicely furnished with microwave oven & kitchen sink, beautiful ocean & Diamond Head views from balcony & virtually non stop transport at the door.Lifts arrive within seconds & the breakfast is excellent value. A mere stroll in any direction will find beautiful meals, (& Mai Tai's), at unbelievably cheap prices. A combined sushi & cocktail bar was under construction to the right of the concierge desk in the hotel & we hope to return to try their Mai Tai'sP.S We hadn't tried a Mai Tai before our trip but recommend it if you go to Hawaii.

I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel last week and thoroughly enjoyed my stay! The location was ideal, steps from the beach. Very accessible to Hawaiian Coffee and the rocking chairs located on the porch of the Moana Surfrider. The concierge was very helpful in renting my car and giving me helpful information. My room was very basic, but clean and comfortable, with a very nice view of the beach. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The pool was inviting and secluded, with few people ever using it. I really appreciated the friendliness of the staff, especially Rosalie, who was extremely friendly and caring. She was only responsible for cleaning my room but took care of many extras for me...like putting sunscreen on my back. Thank-you Rosalie.

After reading many good reviews for this hotel i was surprised to find rooms and condition of hotel to be so dated and old. the room was comfortable enough but towels were thin and worn out, and bedding not much better, I didnt even want to try out the restaurant there... The service and hospitality was good and friendly and it is a good location. Next time I go i will definitely splurge a little on a nicer hotel to be more comfortable.

We loved our stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. Great location- so close to the beach. We stayed in a Junior Suite and it had plenty of room. Nice bathroom and separate luggage storage/change room area. The kitchenette was so handy too. The view from our room was fantastic. The staff at the front desk were always friendly and nothing was ever too much trouble. After our stay here we cant understand why anyone would stay anywhere else in Waikiki.

Stayed here for 3 nights end February - (we moved from a 5star Hotel which was expensive, impersonal & out of town) - Waikiki Resort Hotel felt warm and inviting from the time of check in - staff were friendly and helpful - they had a room ready for us before check in time - the room was very clean, the beds were comfortable & the pillows gave me a great nights sleep! We had a partial ocean view which looked out over Waikiki Beach, where we could watch the early morning surfers. The location is great - few minutes walk to the beach and shops - close to Shuttle Bus for the Outlets, close to city bus for Diamond Head & Hanuama Bay. And very close to King's Village where there is a quaint Cafe called filled with memorabillia (called Rock Island Cafe) - don't miss the Changing of the Guard here at 6pm. I would recommend Waikiki Resort Hotel without hesitation - it isn't 5star, but I'd much prefer the warm and friendly atmosphere of Waikiki Resort Hotel .... and yes I'll be recommending it to friends - in fact I already have !! thx for the friendly service! (thanks for the bandaids, and thank you for bringing in a new set of scales so we could weigh our bags - this was a perfect example of how the staff at Waikiki Resort Hotel try to please the traveler!)

We had a great 7 nights at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. Wife and I took my Mom and Dad for our 1st trip to Hawaii. It was so much cooler than we would have ever guessed, and the Waikiki resort had much to do with us having so much fun.Great beds=great sleep.With th beach just 50 yards from the beach, it was fast and ez to go back and forth.The Concierge fixted out trips to the Polynesian Cultural center and Pearl Harbor. Mad it so EZ for us.To save money, we walked 4 blocks North to the (Food Pantry)? for milk and Raisin Bran, and snacks.So many great places to eat near by, that we never ate at the same place twice. We were always going to try the in house restaurant, but sadly, never did?In room coffee is a must for us, and the Wolfgang Puck pods were great, but I would have rather had a 4 cup pot so we could have sampled the diff. Cona coffees we bought at the Food Pantry.We will go back to Waikiki, and we will stay at the Waikik Resort.

The hotel is nice and the rooms are clean. Really close to the beach and all the Shopping.After read another review we decided to do the Bus to the Arizona as well. I would not ever do that again. What a nightmarewhom ever wrote take the bus to Pearl Harbor must work for THE BUS. Their was no room, some very un-happy folks on the bus. Next time I will take the Tour for 34 bucks

Really enjoyed our stay...only a block from Waikiki Beach. Room was clean and even had a partial view of the ocean. Only complaint was misleading information given out by the concierge. He seemed to be pushing tours, more than offering good advice. He discouraged us from taking bus to Arizona Memorial...tried to sell us $34/person tour...said tour operators get preference for tickets since they donate so much money to the memorial...Bull!,,,we took the bus and it was only $2.50...pick-up/drop off only 1 block from hotel, and stops right in front of memorial...easy 1 block walk to memorial...we got there a little before 7am...got first tour...back on bus by 10am...so easy!...bus #20 and 42 are direct to and from memorial and drop off at Waikiki Beach bus stops (announced stops along the way)...we didn't wait 5 minutes for the bus, and only took 45-60 minutes....taxi takes 35-40 minutes and cost $35+ each way! Before you go, check out bus system on line "Honolulu Bus System"....there is a phone # you can call to get correct bus info, very helpful and friendly...it was so much easier than we thought it would be, and we got to see sights along the way. So save some money and enjoy your trip.

My husband and I had the great pleasure, of staying in the heart of Waikiki, in a bit smaller hotel, the Waikiki Resort, for five days recently! We have stayed there twice prior, living on another Island, and coming to Oahu for business and medical reasons often. Hard to believe, but we found this gem of a hotel, to be in even better shape, then the prior trips! It appears, that they are constantly redoing the place, the rooms freshly decorated too, and the restaurants so great too. Dinner at the Soul Jung Korean Restaurant, on the 2nd floor, was out of this world, totally top food, so fresh and well done. The Ilima Restaurant serves a marvelous breakfast buffet, and the service is tops too. Also, lunch and take outs. As we were there for the Super Bowl game, and had friends over to visit us in our room, we took out the caesar with chicken salads, and they were very delicious. I can not say enough great things, about the management and staff of the hotel, starting with the General Manager, Glenn Vergara, who seems to be circulating too, through out the hotel, checking on the guests needs and also the staff's. He is friendly, efficent and well liked by his staff. All in all, you feel like you are at home in this hotel, and I would highly recommend it to all travelers. Let it become, like us, there home away from home when on Oahu. May I add, that I was the prior owner, of a 4 star bed and breakfast, for many years, on the big Island,( Hilo) so I do know quality and good management. This Hotel is ran tops! From the bell captain, front desk staff, restaurant staff, you are treated like you like to be treated, not just a number. After viewing the way the General Manager runs this hotel, I would say, that the credit for this goes to him!

This hotel exceeded our expectations in every area. The room was clean, staff were friendly and helpful, location was perfect, etc.... They even went out of their way to make sure I could get connected to the internet. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Note that baby cribs are now free at the hotel. Abosolutely no hidden charges of any kind.

Just got back from Hawaii,and stayed at the Waikiki resort for the fourth time in four years. For my wife and I it is just like going home. It's always nice to see our friends that work at the hotel. The staff is so very friendly, From Gary and Dennis at the bell desk it's always nice to chat with them in the morning on our way out ,and to Brandon and Nancy at the front desk to the ladies that kept our room spotless eveyday.A special thanks to Brandon at the front desk who was nice enough to draw on the map some of his favorite places to see on the north shore. Without his help we never would have seen so much in one day. And Gil in the Llima cafe who always has a smile on his face no matter how busy he is.So in short we would like to say MAHALO to Gil, Gary,Dennis , Nancy and Brandon.Thanks for making our stay great and we look forward to seeing you next year.

We loved it in beautiful Waikiki Branden Gaspar @ Nancy Short could not do enough for us all staff took good care.General manager Glenn Vergara sent glass and bottle wine for 14 anniversary thank you all yours truly . Gary Mia Foden. PS Cant wait till next time.

Derek upgraded our room to an ocean view for my 30th birthday when my mom called to make the reservations! Branden checked us in for our 8 night stay and was very personable and helpful throughout the entire week! By the end of the week Branden was a great friend! The value of this hotel was very affordable compared to others on Waikiki. We kept the "do not disturb" sign on all week and just went to housekeeping to get the stuff we needed. The housekeepers were very helpful and nice. Twice, security came to our room to make sure we were okay since the do not disturb sign was out so long. Very nice. The room had a small fridge and a free safe. We were a little disappointed that the coffee pot was only a one-cup pot. Too small. And the patio door windows were really dirty, but they were offered to be cleaned for us when we mentioned it. Also, the shower was really tiny, but that wasnt a problem for us. The shower and toilet were separate from the sink/vanity which was good for us girls who were alwasy getting ready at the same time. The balcony was nice and had a partial view of the ocean. The hotel sits one block off the beach, and there were other hotels partially blocking the view. The hotel is VERY conveniently located within walking distance of everything you need: Mcdonalds, 1 bk; Burger King, 2 bk; KFC, 3 bk; International Market Place, 4 bk; other dining all around, zoo, beach. Great Location! The hotel has a restaurant, but we never ate there. Also, there is a pool, but never even went to it. (busy week) We planned many things to do and the shuttles were always there on time to pick us up at our hotel. We rented a car for a couple days and the parking per night is $18 which is a little spendy. Also, on our last day, Branden gave us a late checkout, at 1:00, and we were allowed to leave our luggage at the bell station all day for $1/p luggage, as our flight didnt leave til later that night. So that was nice. Would recommend this hotel and hope to be able to take this trip again! Thank you!

Less than a block frombeach. Close to everything, yet not in a noisy or busy area. Very clean, nice staff & helpful. Only con - always the last pick up if you do a tour. That was frustrating. Local buses come by frequently (one block up). So easy to get around & cheap. Didn't need a car rental. We even went to the north shore for a day. Best time to go is May. Not busy & weather was just awesome. Plus less expensive over all. Will definitely go back & stay here again.

My family and I had a great time at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. We're a local family that just wanted a short relaxing day and night on New Year's Eve. Our young boys had a great time at the pool. And probably one of the highlights was the great view that we had of the fireworks being shot off from the ocean as we welcomed in 2011. Wife and I enjoyed it from our lanai, while the boys slept soundly -- couldn't have asked for more!

I have been to Waikiki several times (four different hotels) and the Waikiki Resort Hotel has become my home away from home. The staff are excellent, friendly, and helpful. The Front Desk staff welcome guests and are never too busy to answer questions. The Bellmen go out of their way to help guests with transportation needs. Maid service is prompt and thorough. Security personnel are visibily present. I feel so safe.The location is convenient to everything - the beach, lots of restaurants, catching the bus.Rooms are extremely clean. I appreciate the deadbolt on the door - it just makes me more comfortable. And I alwasy make good use of the mini-fridge, coffee maker and in-room safe.Sometimes, I think I should try a different hotel next time. Then I ask myself, why?I love this hotel. Feels like home. Feels like family.
Great value for money, good location and very friendly, helpful staff. Easy walk to central Waikiki and lots of public transport nearby.

The room was very nice, clean, modern. For the price of 90 a night you cant beat it! The location was perfect. i walked downstairs to Lobby and 50 feet to beach. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Staff including the concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. It had a lot of Asian guest and Asian theme to it but that did not matter.

I found this hotel on Trip Advisor after reading the favourable reviews and it lived up to my expectations. I booked through their website and got a good deal, better than the general travel sites were offering.Being just one block away from Kuhio Beach Park was great, the hotel is close enough to the action without being so close that you can hear all the traffic on Kalakaua Ave. One block inland is TheBus stop to get to the Ala Moana Centre and the Airport (buses 19 &20).The rooms were comfortable and had all the amenities I needed (I'm a fairly unfussy traveller so don't need all the bells and whistles). The mini fridge and safe came in handy and the bed was fairly comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful.If you're going to hire a surfboard, turn right out of the hotel and walk 50 metres to Moku's (corner of Koa and Uluniu Ave), its half the price of the rental places on the beach.I'd definitely stay here again and have no hesitation recommending it.

The hotel is not fantastic but it is definitley clean and you just cannot beat the location! Try to get a room with an ocean view, it's just gorgeous! Everything you could want is close by, lots of shops and restaurants, pubs, etc. The rooms are kind of small but hopefully if you are in Hawaii you aren't planning to spend much time in the room anyways! Overall it was a great value and I would stay there again in a heartbeat

A friend told us about their 'secret" favorite place to stay in Honolulu. Short distance to Waikiki Beach, free parking, very reasonable breakfast buffett. We didn't know what to expect because the rates are GREAT! We discovered we LOVED Waikiki Resort Hotel. Big open air lobby. Rooms were so clean and good size. Refrigerator we could put things in. Coffee maker. And plenty of chairs so when our friends stopped by to visit we had a place for them to sit. Service was excellent. Everyone was so nice. We loved the in and out parking. No worries, beef curry. I would recommend this to all my friends.

Found out about this hotel in a travel book and it lived up to is expectations of being a moderately priced, comfortable hotel, set off the main street and close to the beach. It took longer waiting for the light to get to the beach than it did to walk down to the corner to do so. Absolutely great. Unfortunately, when I had booked a number of months ago, I had specifically asked for a king size bed. When we checked in we found we had two doubles instead. Two couples we were meeting arrived the following day - one had a set of doubles and the other had a king size. Interesting, that I had booked our room quite a bit of time ahead of the other two and yet did not get our king size. It would have improved my opinion. Staff was generaly helpful, but not overly so - we got whatever we asked for but no suggestions re where to eat, how to get around, etc. The only other unfortunate thing is we booked the shuttle on our last day to take us to the airport, which we did through the bell hop. The shuttle arrived, took us to the airport, and then he informed us that he wanted $1.00 per bag on top of the fare we had already paid. We were prepared to tip the driver but hadn't anticipated needing enough money to cover our bags, which we didn't have as we had used up all the American money except $2.00 which we gave him but he certainly asked for more. Might be better getting the Roberts shuttle service to take you back to the airport.

I love staying at this place and it is typically the only place I stay in Waikiki unless it is booked.Friendly staff, clean rooms and the thing that I like the best... is the location in Waikiki!My most recent stay was this past Halloween! I was a bit bummed this year that they didn't have a pumpkin carving contest amongst their staff like they did in 2009. I hope they bring that back next year.It's also fairly easy to upgrade rooms for a very small fee if they are available. Just ask upon check-in.When I rent a car... they offer free parking for Kama'ainaThe pictures are from my junk cell phone if they look a bit dark.

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions and we have not been dissappointed yet,friendly staff,very helpfull,clean rooms,beautiful view,block from the waikiki beach,bang for your buck,we will stay there again next time in Hawaii

We got a great deal: flight+hotel and it worth every penny.The room - it was bachelor suite - was spacious and very clean, small, but well set kitchen with fridge and sink, nice washroom. We loved breakfast, which were a part of our package.Great selection of food and friendly service stuff.Overall we found everybody very friendly and helpful and taking that opportunity we would like to say special thanks to Nancy at the front desk, door bell guy - George, room service attendant Amelia. Thank you all for making our vacation so comfortable and enjoyable.
It was a pleasant experience that my family and I enjoyed. Our church event was more than I expected! The kamaaina rate and 50% off breakfast buffet was great and affordable! Mahalo!

The pluses first: Nice bell hop staff and nice concierge. Super close to the beach, Yay! OK rates, yes. Nice little cafe off the lobby. Nice breezy open-air lobby. Cool fountain out front. Now the pesky negatives: My husband and I travelled with another couple. They checked in first and guess what, they got the last kingsize bed. That's right, folks. We insisted on staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and our thanks was denial of a kingsize bed. Instead, we got two doubles and a poor view and the tiniest tub in the world, which was still an improvement over the tinier shower we had on the cruise ship and the cheapo shower curtain at the Aqua Wave. Said they would have a king size open up the next day, but we were only staying two days, so we said forget it. If they wanted a positive review, they should have offered us an upgrade, as the Aqua Wave offered to our friends, but refused us. (hmmmm, wonder who we pissed off?) Anyway, we can not recommend this hotel to our fellow travelers. Stay at the Waikiki Circle, instead, perhaps?

My Dad lives in Maui and we were visiting him, he encouraged us to at least spend a day or two in Oahu. Upon searching for a hotel in the Waikiki area I stumbled upon the Waikiki resort and their Hawaii resident rate so we had Dad book it for the three of us to stay.What a great location! Only a block from the beach near the statue of Duke Kahanamoku, our room was on the 18th floor and between the other hotels we could see the ocean and the hills from our balcony.I would have loved to have spent more than one night. Our room was clean and very quiet. The only thing was that I couldn't figure out how to turn the shower on (pull down under the faucet) but once we figured it out it was all good. I wanted to check out the pool but we just ran out of time.The breakfast buffet was great, not too small that we were disappointed like some hotel breakfast buffets but not so big that we felt overwhelmed. There was great variety and everything tasted wonderful. All employees were friendly and it was a overall a very nice place. If I ever return to Oahu, I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

I stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel for only two nights while I was in Honolulu on business. I live in a rural area of the Big Island, and when I have to travel to attend meetings in Waikiki, it is a challenge to find a conveniently located, reasonably priced, and pleasant place to stay. The Waikiki Resort is all that and more--the front desk staff was invariably pleasant and helpful when I stopped by, June (sp?) checked me in and was careful to explain that there was construction near my room and ask if that would be a problem. Since I was gone from 7am to 5pm, it wasn't. My room had a lovely lanai with an ocean and mountain view. I will say that the early morning buses lining up on the street outside were noisy, but I never travel without earplugs and they took care of that problem!Everyone was very helpful and friendly, which I know is not always the case in Waikiki. The room was very comfortable and I appreciated the safe for my notebook computer and valuables while I went out for walks on the beach. The in-room coffeemaker was nice too. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet, especially the soups changing daily. I've already recommended this place to colleagues and friends as a great value in Waikiki.

We stayed three nights pre-cruise and this was part of our package when booked with an on-line travel agent. Our package also included the breakfast buffet which was good each day. Loved the variety and the fresh pineapple!The open lobby was visually lovely and always clean. Our room was always clean and very comfortable. Nice having an ironing board and iron in the room, thank you but I thought they had blow dryers in rooms but they didnt so I had bad hair days for three days, but then again, with all the wind, it probably wouldnt have mattered!!My husband and I married while staying there and I have to say that James, who worked at the bellman desk was super! He called The Bus for us and got the route and times for us to go get a marriage licence. He also took pictures of us with our cell phone in our wedding attire while we waited for our limo. We appreciated it and will never forget it.Being from the east coast, we did not sleep well due to the time change, being up most mornings around 2am. We walked up one short block to the beach and felt very safe even at 2am. Thank you for a wonderful stay Waikiki Resort Hotel!
The hotel was clean, tidy and convenientStaff were very friendly and helpful

If you want to meet the nicest people who make you feel like family and you want value for your dollar then you have to stay here. It starts with making a reservation and getting Sherrie or Derek to help you choose a room and to give you insight to the hotel. Sherrie is so pleasant. If I didn't want to book at the Waikiki Resort just talking to Sherrie would make me reserve my room. At the front desk the staff of Nancy, Branden, Mitzi, Susi and many others will make your check in, check out and stay so much more pleasant. The housekeeping staff will keep the rooms clean, well stocked and they are never intrusive.  The hotel is not a Five Star place but it is affordable, comfortable and located close to the beach and all of the Waikiki attractions. We booked a standard room and was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a Jr Suite. The room was clean, spacious and had two wall mounted flat screen T.V's. It had a kitchenette with sink,a small fridge, and coffee maker. There was no microwave. The in room safe was large enough for a notebook computer. The room had two Lanai's overlooking the city and mountains. The elevators were never a problem as there were three of them. The pool although small was clean with an ample amount of chairs. Since the beach was only a block away the pool wasn't used much. There is free Wi Fi in the lobby. There is a restaurant in the lobby the Ilima, which serves breakfast and lunch. We had breakfast there and thought that we entered another world. The service and food were both substandard. Maybe the hotel should train the restaurant wait staff in customer service. How many times does one have to request a second cup of coffee? We've been to Hawaii two other times and stayed a few blocks away at the Aston Waikiki. The Aston does not compare, the staff is not as friendly, the elevators don't work as well and the rooms are much smaller with an old fashioned Tiki montiff.  Mahalo Sherrie for driving us to the park on top of the mountain so that we could get the best view of the city. Nancy, Mahalo for the suggestion of Ono Hawaiian Foods for dinner. It's a local hole in the wall joint with good food.  We can't recommend the Waikiki Resort because once everyone finds out how great this place and its people are; everyone would stay here and we wouldn't be able to get a room. ( You guys know I'm just kidding)

This is a very economical hotel that's a quick walk to Waikiki Beach. Clean and Friendly. It is the Korean Hotel in Waikiki, but very friendly to all. Not to be missed is the breakfast buffet. Lots of delicious offerings favored by Westerners. Dawson in the kitchen does a first-class job, and Mr. Park is the Goodwill Ambassador among the restaurant staff. Excellent service, and we highly recommend the Korean Seaweed Soup! So Tasty!

This was our third stay at Ocean Resort Hotel and we'd stay there again. The rooms are comfortable and clean, but no frills. The hotel is a block from the beach, literally 2-3 minutes. It is surrounded by hotels that cost 2-4 times what it costs here. It's a great value. Staff is friendly and accomodating.

Loved it. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great location - only 90 seconds walk to the beach. Room was great, clean, everything we needed was available and the in-room safe was invaluable. We will be staying there again on our next trip to Hawaii.

After narrowing my search to this hotel, I searched even further for the very best rate, finding it on blue-hawaii.com, where I booked a rate of $81/night + tax! At this ridiculously low rate, I expected a less than ideal room, yet when I arrived and checked in, I was given keys to a room on the penthouse floor - a great way to start our vacation and first time visit to Hawaii! The room was nothing special, even a little worn, but it was clean and quite. As other reviews point out, this is a great location. If you are content with spending your vacation in Waikiki and the surrounding vicinity, do not get a car - you can easily walk anywhere and there are lots of restaurant choices in all price ranges.Other good points: Hotel staff were all friendly and helpful; the lobby is beautiful; and the elevators work great and are quick. I would not hesitate to return, especially if I could get the same great deal.

Overall Waikiki Resort Hotel is a very commendable hotel. Great location, clean/decent rooms but the front desk staff were not so helpful. The only issue we had was at the check in time. We arrived a little earlier than the usual check in time but was told that our room wasn't ready yet...which we didn't have a problem with. They were able to hold our luggages while we try to kill time by roaming around the streets of waikiki and grabbing a late lunch. However, our issue came about when we came back and tried to check at around 3pm but was told that our rooms were ready yet...I guess we were just a little frustrated that we had to wait much longer considering I checked the day before to make sure the room we requested would be availabe on time on the day we arrived and the only thing we needed at time was to relax a bit after a long flight. Other than this tiny issue the rest of stay at this hotel was quite wonderful. As mentioned, location is perfect, close to everything and literally a few steps away from the beach (big +++). Cleaning staff and bell desk were extremely helpful and nice. Front desk were just so-so not sure if its because I booked our stay online through one of those discounted package sites which the first lady I spoke with at the front desk deliberately mentioned when we initially tried to check in 2 hours earlier than normal, just thought it was kind of odd. But didn't let it ruin my stay had little interaction with the front desk as they seem to be "very busy" all the time....I would stay here again just for the fact that it has a very nice location... quick tip though, if youre trying to save some $$$ on food, try the food court at the back of the international market place, very yummy yet wont break the bank (try the asian-hawaiian fuision and the fresh seafood stall right next to the stage - so goood!) also if you're ever going to the swap meet....you must try the ha-ling pineapple...its the best one yet....Mahalo and I can't wait to visit HI again....ALOHA

This is my 9th times to Waikiki.Out of the 9th times, this is the BEST stay. It's because of the hotel and its staff (Andy, Suzy and Brandon). The are the BEST when it comes to customer services.Pro:-Very clean room-Staff provides us with everything that we needed-close to the beach (not even 1 block)Con:-NoneI'll DEFINITELY stay here again.

This hotel was a few blocks from Wakiki Beach and a McDonald's and many restaurants and ABC stores were accessible within a few blocks. The area around the hotel was bustling with tourists from every country. I didn't experience any interaction with American or European tourists at this hotel. The hotel has a nice lobby, easily accessible laundry facility and limited parking on a very busy street. The restaurant food service was poor and our large group often didn't get served in a timely fashion. Once we dished up our breakfast buffet, most mornings, coffee wasn't available in a timely fashion. Our room had an issue with insects, however, the hotel did give us a one time $35 USD discount for this problem.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks. It's a nice basic hotel. Clean, comfortable and I found the room to be plenty large enough for a couple. For the price, you can't beat it's location. The hotel is only 1/2 block from the beach and is close to many restaurants, shopping and of course ABC stores :) As others have mentioned because of it's prime location, it does get a bit noisy in the mornings due to the large amount of traffic (many, many buses!). We were on the 18th floor facing Liliuokalani Ave and even with a sound machine on we could still hear the street traffic. It wasn't terrible, but if you are a light sleeper you will want to take earplugs or a sound machine to help drown out the noise. Overall it's a nice hotel for a great price. If you want to experience Waikiki but don't want to spend a fortune, this is your place.

Waikiki Resort is a very clean hotel with attentive staff and a great location. The hotel is only a block from the beach and close to restaurants, The Bus stop, shopping and entertainment. The pool is nice although it has limited hours. WiFi is free in the lobby. Elevators were fast. Beach towels were provided. The in room safe is roomy enough for a lap top. They only give 2 cups of coffee in the room per day - so bring some extra or buy some while you are there. We had a great time in Hawaii. Thank you

probably the best value hotel in waikiki. very close to waikiki beach, maybe even < 100 steps away. You can take 10-min walk, there are some good shops along the street. Overall great location.  Hotel rooms are clean and comfortable. The Korean restaurant within the hotel have some good food, recommended to try. Hotel rates are considered very affordable.

I recently spent 6 nights at this hotel. It is tucked a mere half block off of Kalakaua & with easy beach access down at the Kuhio Beach end of Waikiki. It's location just off the main drag means you don't hear the incessant noise from the cars, people etc. on Kalakaua.I booked a room with two double beds via the hotel's web site for a very good rate ($84 plus taxes). My room was on the 7th floor with a partial ocean view & also a partial view of Diamond Head from my balcony. There was a large flat screen (never bothered to turn it on), a mini fridge, bureau, desk & two chairs. The hotel itself was very well sound-proofed on the interior & very quiet.Read some comments about the small size of the rooms, but I found mine quite large for one and plenty spacious for a couple, as there was ample room between & around the beds, desk, etc. Compared to most European hotel rooms it felt palatial. Personally, I can't comprehend paying twice the price for a room with more empty floor space, especially in a location like Waikiki when you're out and about the majority of the time, but to each his own.Housekeeping did a good job & there is free wifi in the lobby--which had plenty of comfortable seating. Free beach towels are provided. All staff that I interacted with were pleasant & helpful. I didn't eat at either restaurant, so I can't comment on them. The hotel does allow you to check-in & print boarding passes for flights free via a small computer room.The location is perfect & I walked all over Waikiki. The hotel is half a block from a bus stop & I took The Bus from the airport to the hotel--very easy, and also used The Bus to visit Ala Moana, Chinatown, etc. A few points that might matter to some: the shower & toilet were in a small room off of the closet/vanity/sink area which was spacious enough, but the WC/shower room was small and there was no fan. Also there is some morning noise from the trolleys & tour buses that motor down Koa. However, Honolulu is a large city, & a hotel smack in the middle of Waikiki is going to have some street noise. This hotel had much less than would be typical on a busier road as there was no late night pedestrian traffic & almost no automotive traffic.Overall a very pleasant experience & I would highly recommend it.

Our room was ready by 2pm for checkin. Room was nice and was cleaned every day without fail and always fresh towels available .. Would have preferred a King or Queen to 2 double beds in room which we did ask for when booking but never got. The good thing about this hotel is that it is close to everything. Beach is only 100 metres away and all the main stretch is close as well. Pool was ok for a quick dip, nothing fancy. Didnt try any of the restaurants in the hotel. Overall a nice place to stay.
Check in was a breeze. Very friendly staff, always smiling and asking if we needed anything. Location is perfect, close to beach, zoo, and aquarium, all in walking distance.

If you want a hotel, where you feel like you are at home, and treated accordingly, then go to the Waikiki Resort Hotel, when you are on the Island of Oahu.!! Everyone there, from the bell captain, front desk, waitress's, even the cleaning girls,most of all, the General Manager, treat you like you are there best friends, and not in a phony way, in a loving way! We hated to come back home, and want to stay longer then three days next trip! The location is ideal too, less then half a block to the ocean, and great shops and things to tour and see, like the Zoo, so many things, close by. Also, the two restaurants are so great. Start off your day, with a great buffet in the coffee shop, and then have lunch or dinner in the top of the class, Korean Resturant too. Both places have great prices too.If you are able to go to this great find, then do ask to meet the General Manager, Glenn Vergara, and you will be so surprised at his total friendly ways, and knowledge of the Island.

Just back from a 9 days stay at Waikiki Resort Hotel. The location was great , just a short block from the main strip and beach. It's away from the crowd but close enough for an evening stroll on Kalakaua Ave ( The main strip ). Room was just the right size. Plenty of fast food or restaurants within walking distance. Pick ups for most of the tours is just across at the Pacific Beach Hotel. Should have free Wifi in room, not just at the lobby. Overall, very satisfied.

I stayed at this hotel for eight nights from late July to early August. It's very clean, in a great location and the staff are friendly. The Korean restaurant on the second floor was great as well. In room internet access is not included, so that's extra, and it's via a cable connection, no WiFi. Free WiFi, however, is available at the lobby. The only complaint I have is that the doors would slam loudly when they close. Maybe it was the combination of air pressure and people just being inconsiderate, but I think they need to install some sort of mechanism such that the doors would close gently and quietly. I kept waking up at 7/8 in the morning when people would start leaving their rooms. If you can live with that, then stay at this hotel!

The Waikiki Resort Hotel is about one-two blocks from the beach. Rate was affordable for a very nice hotel, not to be "beachfront"! You do need to be on the far right side of the building (facing the ocean) to have an ocean view. We asked for it and that's what we got!. Crisp, clean, fresh -- beautiful hotel. Great check-in/check-out staff; friendly and helpful. Awesome breakfast buffet was included in our rate. Didn't use the pool b/c we were visiting the island beaches so can't comment on that. You do have to pay for parking. If I were to return to Honolulu, I would definitely stay here again.

Just got back from an eight day stay in Waikiki at this hotel. I had my two boys (17 and 12), and my wife. Overall the experience at the hotel was good. On a tight budget, I selected a standard room with two twin beds. We had a view of the city, but unless you plan on staying in your room on the lanai during the day what's the point of spending extra on a beach view. Smaller than standard rooms we are used to on the mainland. It felt a bit cramped for a family of four, but we didnt spend much time there. The bathroom had the smallest bathtub I have ever seen. It measured approx. 31/2 ft in lengh. My housekeeping experience wasnt as good as others have mentioned. There were only two towels for four people which became frustrating.
