I kept leaving notes, and telling the front desk. They would fix the problem that day but then the day after it would be back to the standard two towels. I had the same experience with the single cup coffee packets. We had two coffee drinkers, but they continually restocked with one regular, and one decaf. As mentioned by previous reviewers the location was fantastic, the rooms were clean, and the front desk staff were helpfull. Should I ever return to Waikiki, I would stay here again, but would be most likely upgrade to a Jr. Suite, and be prepared to change a few housekeeping items from day one.

The hotel is located only a block from the beach in a fairly quiet area of Waikiki. Our room was very nice and the lanai, which had been recently renovated, gave us a view of a piece of ocean, a piece of Diamond Head, and the neighborhood where my wife lived as a child. The hotel staff were very helpful whenever we had questions. The price was very resonable and we were more than satisfied.

The hotel is beautiful and clean; rooms were modest, but very comfortable! The hotel was easy to locate; easy to walk to the beach (only a block away); easy to walk to many of the Waikiki locations! Branden and Mitzi at the check-in desk were EXTREMELY helpful! Gave us recommendations on places to eat and things to do and see! They are truly an asset to the Waikiki Resort Hotel! Bell desk attendants were also very helpful! Cleaning staff as well. Completely felt "at home" during our week there! THANK YOU WAIKIKI RESORT!!!! We will be back!!!!

My wife and I found this hotel clean and well managed. It is perfectly located just a small block from Waikiki beach and the walk took about three minutes. The service in this hotel was excellent. We stayed in a Junior Suite which had a small kitchenette and a fridge in it and a lanai attached. The room was big enough for the two of us even though it had a king size bed in it. Our sleep was never disturbed by outside noise. The kitchen had a tiny,one cup percolator in it which could be a nuisance if both parties drank coffee ! The sliding door leading onto the lanai was noisy on windy nights and days. The towell service was great for going to the beach,it was self service. We would stay here again as it is centrally located.
Top notch considerate treatment and service. 1/2 block from main Waikiki beach- we could see Diamond Head and the Ocean (partial) from our lanai. Great place, good price, nice people.~Linda T

Great location, one block to beach and close to plenty of restraunts, shopping and the bus service to just about any where you want to go! Clean rooms and front desk service very friendly. Alot of the rooms have just been remodeled and are very roomy and clean. The one negative point is that they should have put new sliding glass doors that go to patio in during the remodel. Even being on the 16th floor we could hear street noise from below.
Nice, clean hotel steps from the beach. Friendly, knowledgeable staff, especially front desk personnel.

The Waikiki Resort is just a half block off the beach near the quieter end of Waikiki Beach. The location was perfect for beach and surfing and just a very short walk to restaurants, shopping and the zoo. Our second afternoon we had water coming through the ceiling in the bathroom from the room above. The front desk had someone there in moments to check it out and minutes later they had us re-booked into an upgraded room. The bell captain helped with the move and within 30 minutes we were unpacked and settled in our new room. The staff was wonderful thoughout our stay - we would definitely come back to this hotel!

The staff at the Waikiki Resort Hotel was very hospitable. However, on our first night when we arrived, we were charged a $250 security deposit that we were not notified about before the deposit was deducted from our bank account. For this miscommunication, on behalf of the staff at the hotel, we were given a complimentary voucher for a breakfast for two people the next day. We were appreciative of the professional staff and our satisfaction was guaranteed. The remainder of the trip, the staff was helpful and assisted us with transportation or sight-seeing venues. Thank you for making our stay at your hotel a memorable and relaxing time. Mahalo.

The family home in Honolulu was unavailable, so we were forced to find a hotel for the O'ahu leg of our trip. I'm a local girl and I HATE Waikiki! We avoid it at all costs when we return home to Hawai'i. That said, there are very few options outside of Waikiki if you need to stay in a hotel on O'ahu. After obsessively going over TripAdvisor reviews of dozens of hotels, I reluctantly booked two rooms at the Waikiki Resort for a week (March 16-23). I'm mostly glad I did.Mitzi was amazing at the front desk when we checked in. She was friendly and competently answered our many questions... sometimes even before we asked them. (The front desk demonstration at check-in about how to use the shower fixtures seemed comical, but was obviously necessary.) Her instructions on parking, validating the ticket, etc. were all clear and precise. She and the rest of the hotel staff didn't treat we locals poorly, as many hotel employees who are "transplants" to Hawai'i sometimes do.Don't try to park in the underground garage if you have a large vehicle. We had a Chrysler mini-van that couldn't fit into more than a couple of spots. It's a tight maneuver around a very tiny garage. Park in the outside lot. It's easier on everyone in the car! There was a special event on the first evening and a parking attendant in the outside lot told me I had to park underground because the outside lot gate was "broken". (In the upright position?) I told him that I absolutely refused to park underground again since my van didn't fit the parking spaces. He looked perturbed, muttered -- and all of a sudden he made the gate "work". Hmm. I wonder if he was pocketing the cash the special event people were handing him. I informed Mitzi about the encounter and she said that she'd address it.Overall, it was a great stay. There was no construction going on. The hotel is small, clean, rooms adequate, bathroom and shower cleaner than most hotels. With a few notable exceptions, the hotel was quiet, considering it is in the heart of Waikiki. Housekeeping is diligent and friendly and eager to assist guests. Our housekeeper, "Young", was exceptional. Hotel security is amazing! I reported an unattended suitcase in the hallway that had been there for 30 minutes. They responded within 1 minute to check it out. When we had noisy neighbors one night at midnight, they were at their door within 2 minutes of my phone call. Security is seen doing their rounds regularly. The hotel's location allowed our local family members to easily pick us up when needed. Waikiki beach may be one block away, but it is too crowded, dirty and commercialized to enjoy. We spent most of our beach time at other beaches on the island.The one thing that made this a less-than-perfect stay was when a large group of teenagers checked into the hotel the last 2 days. What a racket! The housekeeper said that this band/choir checks into the hotel every year. She seemed very relieved that she didn't have to work on the "lower floors" where they were housed. They screamed and yelled while in the rooftop pool just to hear themselves echoing off the surrounding buildings. On our last night at the hotel, they gathered (around midnight for an hour and a half) on their balconies to chant, scream and holler in unison to people on the street. In the morning, they played their band instruments and "sang" on the balconies. Upon check-out I reported this to the front desk who genuinely didn't seem to know that this was going on. The front desk manager came to talk with me and apologized profusely and said that he would be speaking with the group's sponsors. He stated that he was surprised and that the hotel always adds more security when a large group like this stays there.If I absolutely had to stay in Waikiki again, I'd consider staying here. However, I'd make damn sure that no band/choir adolescent group was going to be there!

I've stayed at this resort many times since 1980. I was happy to discover the place was totally remodeled, very nice! Family orientated, happy welcoming staff, entire place is very clean, within one block of Waikiki beach, walking distance to shopping and the many eating places, felt very safe day or night, bus line available 1 block away and I parked my rental car on-site, self-service laundry, beach towels available. I had a standard room with two queen beds located on the 12th floor, facing east. The closest resort was across the street so that I didn't have to look directly into another resort or apartment. It never bothered me that I couldn't see the ocean or diamond head since I only had to walk 1 block to see the sunset. Expect the sounds of a busy vacation spot during the day. It quiets down at night or take a drive to another part of the island. We did and had the beach area to ourselves. My room was supplied with a small refrigerator, coffee maker, new furnishings, flat screen, new clean mattress. We had the choice to swim in the pool or ocean. Check out the swap meet for major savings on the same items sold at the local stores at a fraction of the price. It's held at the Aloha Stadium every Weds, Sat, Sunday. I didn't post photos because the photos posted for Waikiki Resort are authentic, no need to repeat them. I felt so relieved that my accommodations surpassed my expectations that I soon found myself truly on a relaxing vacation in paradise. Enjoy!

We visit Hawaii every year, and this year we were fortunate to find the secret jewell of Waikiki - The Waikiki Resort Hotel.Great location, excellent views, courteous staff, all around great !!!!!!Thank you especially to Manager Ryan Thayer, Brandon Gaspar, and smiley Nancy Short.We certainly are looking forward to seeing you next year, God Wiling.

My Husband and I found great airfares to Honolulu so were after a reasonably priced hotel in Waikiki Beach. This Hotel fitted the bill and exceeded our expectations by a long shot. We arrived early and as our room wasn't to be ready until 3pm, we had breakfast at a nearby restaurant and then returned to the hotel and relaxed by the pool until it was ready for us. We had booked a standard room but were pleasantly surprised to be told that we had been given an upgrade to a suite on the 14th floor. The suite was well laid out with comfortable seating and a flat screened tv. There was a small, well equipped kitchen corner and a balcony offering views across the city. We had a small view of the beach and surfers between two of the buildings, but as the beachfront was literally 100metres from the front entrance of the Hotel that didn't matter. There was a well stocked gift shop and two restaurants within the Hotel, but we were more interested in trying a variety of different places so did not eat at either of them. This Hotel is used by Korean Airlines aircrew and passengers, so the restaurants focused on Korean foods.We didn't have a lot of contact with the staff, but what little we did found them to be helpful and courteous. Best thing about this Hotel is location and cost. Only disadvantage we found was that our room was right next to the lifts and could be a little noisy because of that. But as we were so fortunate to be upgraded, there was no way we would have complained or commented on that. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for absolute bargain accommodation and would definitely stay there again.

We got a really good deal by booking online with this hotel. I also liked that it isn't right on main drag. The best part was the air conditioning. In general it was quiet but at night if it was windy the balcony door would rattle and wake us up. That was it's only down-fall. Still a great choice for Honolulu.

I would like to say a great be Mahalo to the hotel staff, particularly Nancy, Mitzi, and Brandon for all their hard work and friendliness they showed our group at the hotel. Their professionalism and positive charisma were refreshing when they checked our group of 40 people in. They made my life and job much easier. I recommend them for all large group gatherings. The breakfast staff is wonderful and very responsive to all our needs. Mahalo!

I stayed here for 5 nights in February for the first time. I had seen the hotel on previous trips and had eaten at the restaurant. This was a casual, relaxing place to stay. I had the partial ocean view which made it nice to sit out on the lanai in the mornings with a cup of coffee. All the staff I came into contact with at the front desk were pleasant, as was the man at the tour desk. The location is great, 1/2 block to the beach. Because it is not on the main street, it does not have all the hustle and bustle. It was convenient to lots of shopping and restaurants. Beach towels were available just steps opposite the elevators. Some hotels direct you to a lower level to check one beach towel in and out. Here you could take what you need and return to the same place.Looking forward to returning.

This was my 3rd time staying at the Waikiki Resort Hotel and the 1st time after its major renovation. I wanna stay in the hotel for 5 nites and would like to take the advantage of the “pay 2 nites and 3rd nite FREE” offer on the hotel website, but funny that I could not get this offer if I booked for 5 nites (I assumed that I will pay for 4 nites and got 1 nite free), so I had to break it into 2 booking, one for 2 nites and one for 3 nites in order to get the 1 nite free on the 3 nites booking, their system is a bit odd, but I got free breakfast for two for all 5 days, which was an extra bonus. The overall deal was a real bargin especially for a hotel in a good location and so close to the Waikiki beach.Before arrival I had requested for a room on the higher floor with a nice view (I booked for Partial Ocean View Room) and got a very nice room on the 15th floor. Very nice view of the ocean (partially blocked by the 2 hotels in the front) and the room was of good size, very clean and new with flat screen TV, lots of channels to choose from, basic amenities included, but the mattress was kind of soft. Breakfast was basic but good and lots of customers are from the nearby hotels. The parking fee was $18 which is high but quite common in Waikiki and the parking spaces were quite big when compared to other hotels in Waikiki. They also charge $9.95 a day for in-room internet, but there is free wifi in the hotel lobby and you can use it in the lobby for hours in a very comfy environment, so don’t bother to pay for the internet. All the staff (from front desk to restaurant to housekeeping to bell desk) there was very nice and friendly and willing to help you at all time The location of this hotel is perfect with a 24-hour McDonald round the corner, ½ block to the beach and ½ block to Kuhio Street where all the major bus lines stops there. This hotel is basically in the center of everything and very convenience for shopping, dinning and all kind of activities. I will definitely stay there again and have no doubt in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Last week my partner and I spend 6 nights in this hotel. I always check every single review on al lot of different hotels so decided to write one myself this time. Before we decided which hotel to stay, I again checked many reviews. First I considered to stay in the Coconut Waikiki hotel (often number 1 on these websites). After I spoke to some locals from Hawaiian Airlines and a local travel agency I changed my mind. Both explained to me, that if I wanted to save some money, the Waikiki Resort hotel would be a much better choice. They said it to be recently renovated (which is true, and I am sure construction has been finished by now) and they told me location wise this hotel was a much better choice. Why pay more for a longer walk to the beach or centre while in the mean time both hotels are said to serve good quality? You should save the money to make some good trips. Location: After I have seen where the Coconut Waikiki (which sure is a good hotel too) hotel is located I don't regret my choice. The Waikiki Resort hotel is seriously 1 minute away from the beach and the boulevard. I haven't had any trouble with traffic or any other disturbing noices. My room was on the 5th floor.Service: Great! When we arrived there weren't any standard rooms with King bed available (which we booked) and we got an upgrade to a Junior Suite. Transfer is easy to arrange with the bell boy and saves money on the taxi. Check out time is 12, which I find very reasonable. Staff is always ready to help. Room: spacious. Has 2 flat screens, a kitchenette with (empty) refrigerator (which you can fill with supplies from the ABC shops that are located on every corner of the street) and a coffeemaker (with complementary coffe). Junior Suite has seperate living room. We had 2 balconies. To be honest, the bathroom looked good, was absolutely recently renovated, but is small. Not too small, but this is something that must be said. Shower is great however. No bath. Room was very clean. Housekeeping did good job. Save some money?- Parking at the hotel is rather expensive (as for any hotel in Waikiki I guess). Location of the hotel is good, since parking around the Zoo is free. Lots of space every day. It's a 5 minute walk along the boulevard to get there. - You will find ABC shops every 100m. Shop is reasonably priced, so you can get supplies for your refrigerator or trips. - I expected Hawaii to be expensive. This appeared to be untrue. There are a lot of restaurants and bars with reasonably priced food. - Car rental: Many reviews advise you not to rent a car. Although the bus system is good, it takes a lot of time to travel around. You won't reach the good places and you won't have the time to look around and enjoy all the amazing views. We rented a car via www.discounthawaiicarrental.com which is a bargain. It is worth it! We spend two days driving around the island, which is sufficient. Besides this, the island is great. Better than I expected! There is a lot to do and there are many good beaches. Have a good trip!

Clean and very affordable and only one block from Waikiki Beach!!! The Staff were great to assist with rentals, etc. We had a late afternoon flight and they extended my checkout time to accomodate at no extra charge. I highly recommend the Waikiki Resort and I will definitely be coming back.!!!

3rd floor room was a junior suite and perfect for me. Plenty of room and lots of hot water! Staff was easy to use and I'm sure spoke several languages. Hotel is used for Korean Airlines Pilots and Flight Attendants, which I can confirm and spoke to several crews. Hotel does have Korean BBQ, no idea if its good, I did not go. Hotel is 1/2 block to the beach and sits roughly in the middle of Waikiki, Hyatt Regency Waikiki just a block away, Budget and Hertz car rentals can be had there, also you can check in for your flights there along with Waikiki Resort. Hotel Lobby had free Wi-fi but rooms were ethernet cable for 9.95 a day. (Not bad really)

Hotel rooms are nicely decorated. The staff goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful to guests offering recommendations for sightseeing and dining. Do not miss the Yakiniku dinner in the Seoul Jung Restaurant... diners who are unfamiliar with Asian cusines can rely on the recommendations from the wait staff and enjoy a wonderful meal!

Waikiki Resort Hotel is a great place to stay in Waikiki. One block to the beach, all the shopping, and Kapiolani Park (perfect for morning jogging). The staff is very helpful and friendly. They responded immediately to any requests we had - extra pillows, wine glasses, etc. The rooms were spacious and clean. Our room had a beautiful view of the hills above Honolulu. The lights at night were amazing.We ate dinner one evening at their Seoul Jung restaurant and it was delicious. It was really fun bar-be-queueing at your table. What we liked the most about Waikiki Resort Hotel was the friendly staff. Least - it is not directly on the beach, though from some rooms you will see a sliver of Waikiki beach.

I spent 2 nights at this hotel in February 2010 and was very pleased with the accomodations and the service. I booked this hotel on the Discount Hotels site, at a preferred rate for a standard room. The service attendant at the hotel upgraded me to an ocean view room for the standard room price....her idea not mine! As well, I had an 11:00 pm departure and when I went to check out, for an already late check out (1:00 pm), I jokingly told her that I would now be "Homeless in Honolulu" until my departure for the airport at 8:00 pm. She said, "just a minute" and checked the hotel room database and graciously allowed me to keep the room, no charge, until 8:00 pm. Normally this would be an additional full day charge if I had requested it. I hung out at the pool, had a shower before my departure to the airport, which was a real treat. As well, this hotel is extremely clean and all staff I dealt with very friendly and helpful. Only caution is that the pool is very cold....but refreshing!! Great stay and I will stay again....better than a 3 star rating. Saskatchewan, Canada.

Great hotel and staff! The hotel's Korean restaurant "Seoul Jung" was excellent...the best meal we had during our stay. Clean and nicely decorated rooms and terrific service from a very friendly and helpful staff. Just one block off the renown Waikiki beach and one block from a shopping area that has most of the world's most famous stores. Will be staying there everytime we go to Hawaii!
We loved the hotel, it had a great location and was very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. The restaurants on site are wonderful, we can't wait to go back!

I have stayed at the Waikiki Resort several times, and love it. It's close to the beach and all the activities and restaurants we like. The staff is exceptional, especially Andy, Brandon, Suzie, June and Adam the manager.The hotel is clean, and well appointed and the room staff is wonderful. The housekeeping dept is so accommodating and friendly. They go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable.

Very clean and quiet hotel. Do not go to this hotel if your looking for a place to party. Its suitable for families. Very strict on No Smoking. However if your like me, I did not find it a big deal to go downstairs where they have an ashtray for us. Its undercover , and its warm out anyways. I am picky when it comes to clean. And am very satisfied with what I got. A 3 star is exactly what it is. Its a good place to crash and have a good sleep on a firm bed. If you are familiar with other Waikiki hotels, there are no cockroaches in this one. Newly renovated. Parking was a bit steep at $18 a day. But the whole of Waikiki is like that. And it truly is 24 hour security. They are watching it like a hawk with cameras and staff. I recomend this hotel to anyone and will be back their again.

I booked this hotel on a gamble thru West Jet Vacations. The billed it as a 3* and much to my supprise thats exactly what it turned out to be. Its best feature is that it is literally 75 yards from the front door until your feet are on the sand of Waikiki Beach. Its a 1/2 block off the beach front street, behind another larger hotel so some of the higher up rooms might have a beach view. Ours on the 6th floor didnt.This is Korean Airlines base hotel so the service is exceptional. Everything was neat as a pin. The hotel was recently renovated and I couldnt find a blemish anywhere. The beds were comfy, the linnens good and housekeeping adequate.This is the only hotel that I have been in that wasnt a 4 or 5 star that had beach towels for guests right in the lobby. There were plenty of places near by to eat from Mc Donalds right next door to Grilled steak, mexican food and 3-4 asian places all with in the same block.For those of you familiar with Waikiki this hotel is on the far east end of the main part of Waikiki about 4 blocks west of the Zoo. The beach area by the hotel is protected by a lava rock jetty so its very calm and warm in the water. Shallow too. I had no problem letting my 10 yr old run around here. The only complaint I had with the hotel is that the pool is NOT heated. This is the norm for Waikiki hotels, but you know what guys that is NO Excuse!! Guests in the 21 century EXPECT the pool to be heated. The pool was useless and ICEcold. Speaking of which the only ice macine in the hotel is on the 2nd floor by the pool. Could use one on every floor.The hotel had coin operated laundry in the basement parkade which came in handy as well.This was one of the few "Budget" hotels that I have stayed in at Waikiki that actually had a full tub. Everything in the room was modern, we had a small 2' cube fridge that was ice cold and came in handy for snacks. This hotel is 4 blocks from the Food Pantry the only full grocery store in Waikiki.There was a business center and free Wifi in the lobby. Internet ws $10/day if you wanted it in your room. There was no gym, but there was a full 24 hr fitness place across the street that guests got a discount at. Parking was a steep $18/day for guests and there wernt tons of spots. The room also had a free large safe that could old a 15" laptop.I would stay here again in a heart beat and for the price it was a steal.

Location and price unbeatable. Concierge was most helpful and housekeeping staff were great. Only one short block to the heart of Waikiki and the Beach. Could not have been happier with the location and the price. Would advise anyone to stay here with no concern at all.

We got an outstanding deal on our room and thought maybe we would be given less than stellar accommodations. This was not the case. We were given a wonderful room on the 17th floor with a city view. The lanai was great to sit and have our morning coffee. The staff was awesome and always ready with a smile and plenty of aloha. The location was perfect - close to the beach, the zoo, and restaurants. We will be returning and recommending this hotels to others. A big hello to Nancy and Gary!

Drug my wife with me to Honolulu for a too short "business/leisure" stay. Work turned out to be debilitating, but General Manager Glen Vergara and his staff, with their incredible personalized and "we care" additude, made us feel unbelievably at home and welcome. The accomodations were spacious, clean and extremely comfortable; the staff throughout the hotel was friendly, helpful and efficient. My only regret is that we didn't have more time to spend at the Hotel. Mahalo, Glen and staff - you made for us the absolute best of an otherwise trying business trip!

For my wife and I , this was our third time staying at the Waikiki Resort.We consider this to be our home away from home.From our first visit the staff have been great.We have found them to be very friendly,and helpful when asking for directions or suggesting some of the different sights to see.The location is excellent,only a block from the beach who could ask for a better spot.Some people have written that it is too noisey but what do they expect,you are a block from the beach and it is a very busy area. We have been able to sleep with the windows open and have never had a problem with sleeping.all in all we would recomend this hotel to anybody. We are planning to return to the Waikiki resort next year,and we will have great service and a great time just like we have had the first three time we stayed there.

This hotel is 1 block from the beach; abc stores shopping and all else within steps.The accomodating staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcomed; the spirit of Aloha.IT is a 3 star; hotwired for 67 night ; it is a hub hotel for Korean airlines and have a korean restaurant in the hotel.No problems ;no headaches...just pure R&R

Waikiki Resort Hotel is located 1 block from the beach. The staff was great. We needed to change our room and they were very pleasant and helpful in finding us another room even with a better view of the beach than what we already had. We opted to pay $10.00 more a night for a Jr. Suite which included a microwave, sink, and dishes and silverware. Small refrigerators come in all the rooms. The room was quite large and it had a sofa bed and a nice size balcony with chairs. The hotel had two restaurants but there were a lot of restaurants within walking distance. We would stay there again.

Friendly staff greet you and the location is great. Half a block away from the beach to kick back and relax or take surfing lessons or walk along the main shopping strip. (Honolulu's version or Rodeo Drive)

After a 2week vacation on the North Shore, we decided to stay for one night in Waikiki prior to us leaving early the next day. We were greeted with friendly staff. Rooms had all we needed. Clean and tidy and very affordable. Just the place to be if you want to be right in the heart of Waikiki. Would recommend and stay again.

This is the 2nd year we have stayed here. We like it so much, we have brought 2 other couples with us. My husband loves playing "Aloha Santa" on Waikiki and has done this several Decembers in Hawaii. The staff, in particular Brandon at the front desk, has been very helpful and supportive. The rooms are nicely decorated, the king-size bed is very comforable, and the coffee service and mini-refrigerator in the room is great for snacks. There is free Wi-Fi high-speed internet in the lobby with your own laptop. The location just one block from the beach, McDonalds and ABC stores makes it a great location for families. We are seniors, but we love McDonalds senior coffee and free refills...their dollar menu too.We will be back, the Lord willing.Max and Shara Storm(Aloha Santa and his Elf)

Last month we went to Oahu for a business trip. We live on another Island, so travel to Honolulu allot. This trip, we had the pleasure of staying at The Waikiki Resort Hotel, which is on Koa Street, Waikiki. This hotel, was like home away from home! Not only was the room beautiful, so nicely furnished and clean, but the personal working there were the most friendly of any hotel on Oahu that we have stayed at. They looked after our every need, even the Manager, Glenn Vergara, inquired as to how our stay was. This was a first for us, so we were really impressed. Breakfast was included, a buffet and was truly delicious. The Hotel was indeed to us, a hidden secret, and one that we would like other people to discover too. We will defiently return there, and will make it our home away from home, when ever we are on the Island of Oahu ( Honolulu) We have already passed on information to many others. Aloha, Evonne Bjornen and Paul Tallett, from Hilo, Hawaii

Found the people friendly and place convenient. Just a block from beach and lots of activities and eating places around. Got a great deal from an online site when making a last minute booking.Parking in Waikiki area expensive though. $18 a day not included in room rates.

I wasn't expecting much as it was on sale and a budget hotel. However lots of people rated it high. I see why now. The staff is nice and the location is awesome! Half a block off of the beach and right next to bus routes, shopping and Mcdonalds. LOL great if you have kids. The rooms were average and nice. The pool is smaller and cold, but i like that. Also i didnt goto hawaii to mess around in the pool! Great views of the sunset and great snorkeling again about 100' from the lobby! The location is superb! They have a business center but its really slow connection speed, but you can get on from your room or find a hot spot for faster connection. This is a base hotel for Korean airlines, has a spa, and 2 good resturants in the hotel.

We are a local Hawaiian family in Honolulu for funeral services. We stayed in 4 rooms and travelled in and out of the hotel several times daily. The proximity to the beach was important, because we scatterred the ashes of my brother off Waikiki's First Break (surf spot), duplicating the scattering of my dad's ashes back in 1985. My dad was a beach boy in Waikiki in the 1930's and the ocean off Waikiki is important to our family.The rooms were clean, the staff was very accommodating; we requested rooms together and the hotel came through. I encountered a minor issue with the sink drain, and it was fixed in no time flat. Parking was convenient, especially for Waikiki, or, the Jungle as the area was known back in the 60's-70's.Mahalo nui to the staff and management of the Waikiki Resort Hotel.

We stayed at the Waikiki Resort for two nights as a pre-cruise package. We were welcomed by the desk staff and the bellman, who refused our gratutity because he said it was included in the pre-cruise package. The buffet breakfast was very good and everything was clean and looked to be newly updated. The location, just 1.5 blocks from the beach, was great. They handled our luggage and transfer to the ship very smoothly. We will surely stay there again if given the opportunity.

I was planning on checking in for one night and ended staying for a month. The hotel is a gem in the heart of Waikiki without all the hustle and bustle. It is in a great location and only steps away from world famous Waikiki Beach. I looked at many other hotels in that same price range while I was staying there and did not find even one that came any where close. The rooms were spacious,and newly renovated with flat panel TV's. My room had a view of Waikiki Beach and also of Diamond Head which I enjoyed from my lanai. I found the staff truly exceptional and I felt like family after just a few days. This hidden gem I will recommend to my friends who visit!

As Kamaaina, they gave us a room with two double beds & free parking for $86 per night and upgraded us to an ocean view mini suite for just $10 more our final two nights. 50% off the breakfast buffet cost us just $3 for our kids and $6 for me. We ate breakfast there every day for a week! Since so many of the guests at the hotel were from Asia without rental cars, I never had trouble getting a parking spot in the gated lot. One morning we discovered that I left the keys in the ignition overnight (long story) and the battery was dead. The hotel manager quickly found an employee with jumper cables and used his own car to jump start us. Every one of the staff was very helpful & friendly the whole week. The location is great. One block from the beach and two blocks from the Internaltional Market Place. Three of our favorite places to eat are within 3 blocks Keoni (Thai and American), Caio Mein (chinese and italian) in the Hyatt & offer kamaaina discount! and Torito's (take-out Mexican in the marketplace food court).At the combined price of the room, breakfast, and free parking, this is the only place we will stay when we go to Oahu.

This hotel was part of a package we received from a travel agent. Positives:Great location (2 minute to the beach, activities)Lobby was very nice with entertainment in the afternoonNegitives:Alot of street noise on the 7th floorRoom was very small... tiny shower (no tub) with mildew, older beds and carpet.

A 2 night stay was part of our Pride of America cruise of the islands, however we opted to stay 5 nights prior to the cruise and two nights after. I cannot say enough wonderful things about the hotel and staff... including the price!! We chose an ocean view room which I would HIGHLY recommend. Although the hotel is one block from the beach we still had a wonderful view of the beach and sunsets. The rooms were clean, the staff eager to please. We recommend asking at the desk (Judith who was SO helpful!!) about taking the city bus to various sites. Just $2.25 each way. Our room at ($109 per night) also included a wonderful buffet breakfast!!! A 20% discount to the Korean restaurant at the hotel enabled us to try Korean food. Each day we enjoyed watching the flight crews from Korean air come and go. Just across the street is a small outdoor restaurant with great ribs and chicken. Dinner for the two of us was $33, including a beer. We would stay here again in a minute!!!

Thank you, Sherry, Brandon & Andy for a lovely stay at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. Nothing was ever too much for them the owners are fortunate to have such good staff. My 2 week stay was the best holiday I have ever had the Island of Oahu is beautiful. There was always an Aloha or Mahalo from everyone you came in to contact with on the island very rare these days. Hopefully one day I shall return to this paradise. Mahalo Nui Loa

If you are staying in Waikik make sure you stay on the main avenue along the sea front as it is a bit seedy a few blocks in. We chose this hotel because it is at the end of the avenue - away from the biz with an uninterrupted view of the ocean.Breakfast is provided and, if you are sneaky like the otehrs, you can save some for lunch on the beach.The pink tram serves the hotel.Tours are a rip off and to be avoided - especially Pearl Harbour where they get you there real early along with all the other tours so that you have to queue and, when you come out - there are no queues.Another rip off was Paradise Cove Luau. Repetitive banal banter, poor food and drinks were even worse!

This was the first trip to Hawaii for my 3 year old daughter. We stayed at the Waikiki Resort Hotel. Overall, the hotel was nice for the money we paid - the staff was helpful and friendly when we checked in. We got a newly renovated room (clean - but we don't think the bed sheets were changed daily - just made back up daily - we had to write a note to ask for new bed sheets - we left a cherrio on the bed to test and when we came back in the evening - the bed was made up but as we lifted the cover, the cherrio was there). It is a little noisy on some mornings (garbage trucks go by and tour buses go by), but since we usually wake up pretty early in the morning, it was okay for us. It is 1 short block to the BEACH. I would skip the hotel buffet and grab the coupon and activities guides in the kiosks along Kalahaua St - main street on the beach side to find great deals on food and shopping. We found one place that was really good - Shorebirds - we went there for breakfast and the price was reasonable for a breakfast buffet (2 people adults and a 3 year old - $20). The place was right on the beach so that was an added treat. HOWEVER - the best deals were found in the Entertainment Book. I highly recommend getting an Entertainment Book before going to HI. We got our entertainment book coupons online from the travel site where we booked out package, however I think the actual book might have better deals after talking with some of the cashiers. We paid $10 to get the online access for Entertainment and easily made that $10 investment back up in one activity. We saved countless dollars using the other coupons we chose. For example, we got $45 off on the Polynesian Culture Center activity - for parasailing, it was buy one get one free ($30 value) - for the Magic of Polynesia (show only - it was a buy one get one free couple ($52 value) - As you can tell, the Entertainment Book is WORTH getting - you will get the money you spent on it back and then some since it has shopping coupons and food coupons. Restaurant Picks... Jimmy Buffett's was great, Senor Frogs was great, Cheesecake Factory is always good, if you like korean food (me bbq right behind the hotel is really good and inexpensive), La Cucaracha is okay (behind the hotel), but the service is not all that great... I would recommend staying away from the chinese restaurants in Waikiki - particularly the ones in hotels or in major shopping malls. They are over-priced and the food is not all that great. The Aloha Tower has a really good Japanese Sushi buffet - weeknights require waiting and is about $30 per person. Lunch is more reasonable at $17 per person with pretty much the same selection as dinner less lobster.MUST DO things before leaving Oahu: 1) Parasailing, 2) Jetskiing, 3) Magic of Polynesia Magic Show, 4) Pearl Harbor, 5) Hanauma Bay - Swimming and Snorkeling, 6) Polynesia Culture Center, and 7) International Market Place. Of course... also just relaxing on the beach and catching the wonderful sun rays.Make sure to bring really comfortable shoes, because I guarantee you that you will be walking ALOT. If you are into getting self-portraits - there is an Asian guy who comes out at night on Kalakaua Street (around 10 ish pm) to do drawings - his drawings are SUPERB... they are life like to the shadows. He doesn't have a set fee but rather draws for donations ! So whatever you think his work is worth - that's what you would pay him. This is a definite "check out" thing in case you want a real life portrait of you - looks like he uses charcoal as his drawing medium. This is NOT a caricature, it is a real life duplication of you - except he's drawing you. We were thinking wow and we wanted one - but the wait was really long.We hope you enjoy your trip to Oahu as much as we have - we really tried to highlight all the things that were fun to do... we did all of the "must do" things with our 3 year old - she enjoyed it all... it was a most wonderful and memorable vacation.

Price:I would give this a high rating for price alone. We paid $59/night thru the hotels website. We got a web special.Staff:The front desk staff wasn't overly friendly...rephrase, the women were ok but there was one guy that wasn't at all. The only major problem we had was when we checked and got to our room there wasn't a bathtub. I went to the front desk to inquire about switching rooms and he said they didn't have any standard rooms with bathtubs. I said what about tomorrow, he said no I didn't understand, to get a tub we had to upgrade our room. I went down the next morning when he wasn't there and the moved us to a new room with a tub at no charge. I asked if they had standard rooms with tubs and she said yes...strange.Housekeeping:My only complaint was that out of the 8 nights we were there we had to call for towels 4 times. They just forgot to give us any.Rooms:A little on the small side. With 2 teenage daughters (and my wife) they could use another mirror. Small fridge and coffee pot in the room. The lanai was ok too. TIP: We were on the 14th floor and if the wind was blowing the sliding door rattle quite a bit. Put the Oahu Gold brochure between the door and the frame to stop the rattling...LOL.Noise:The first night we were on the 4th floor and the noise from the street was quite loud around 5:30am or so. The street noise didn't bother us at all from the 14th floor.Pool:Also a little on the small side. I think it closes at 7pm or 730pm. I was hoping it would be open until 10 or 11pm. The patio was nice, lots of chairs, could use some more lounges.Location:Nice location. Maybe a 2 minute walk to the beach. Close to pretty much everything.Overall:We would stay here again not problem. I've read reviews of this place being dirty or having bed bugs. I thought the hotel was clean. Hey there were shampooing and vacuuming the lobby everyday. It looks like they take very good care of the hotel.

My parents and I stayed at the hotel for a week. Being with seniors, we were assigned with a room close to the elevator that is clean and quiet. The hotel is very close to the beach, grocery stores to get supplies, and public transport. One morning, there were a group of Hawaii dancers provided free entertainment at the lobby. The free internet access at the lobby is great. Used it everyday to check e-mail and print maps.I am a seasonsed traveler. Had experienced the best customer service at this hotel. Special thanks to June at the Front Desk; she is always friendly and patience with all the questions I have in regards to sightseeing and travel plan. She even declined my tipping with a sweet smile. The housekeeping staff are very good too. We asked for extra pillows and blanket; adjusting air conditioner temperature; both times that arrived within a few minutes.Definately will stay here again.

We had a great stay at this hotel. It was a great location, so close to the beach and easy access to everything. Room was a bit smaller than we anticipated, but was clean and very affordable. The desk staff also very helpful to us in finding some of the off-the-beaten path things we were looking for - including a Saturday morning local farmers market, which turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. Oahu had a major black-out on the evening we arrived, so rooms were dark; flashlights at the front desk would have been helpful, but there were none available for guests. However, the generators kept the halls and lobby lit, and the elevators moving - which is more than many of the other buildings in the area could boast. We would definitely stay at the Waikiki Resort again.

As we planned our Hawaii trip over the past 8 months, the economy got worse and worse, and the hotel prices got better and better. Because of this, we canceled and re-booked hotels a few times for better prices, eventually booking at the Waikiki Resort Hotel at an amazing rate for a partial ocean view ($109, which included two $13 breakfast buffets per day). When we mentioned our anniversary, we were upgraded to an ocean view, from which we also had a nice view of Diamond Head. The hotel's location was astonishing for the price! It's in the very center of Waikiki and less than 1 block from the nicest portion of Waikiki beach... Also about 2 blocks from the Int'l Marketplace and other great sites. The open-air lobby was very nice; fairly spacious and with fountains/torches outside. The rooms were slightly dated (they could use new carpeting and bedspreads), but were very spacious with a relatively huge balcony and a wetbar/minifridge with granite countertop; also had a flatscreen TV. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge, who we even called a few times from the road while sightseeing for directions and tips. While still costly ($18/day),the parking was cheaper than other hotels in the area, and the hotel had both a small parking lot and a small basement garage. Our only gripe was the EXTREMELY LOUD garbage trucks at 5:30 every morning, but I'm sure they were just as loud at the neighboring hotels. Overall, my wife and I considered this place to be quite a find, and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

We came from Australia on 15 May 2009 and stayed in a hotel on Kuiho street. We paid much higher rate for this first one and found Waikiki Resort on the internet at a much lower rate. We read a lot of reviews on the internet but still could not make up our mind. We decided to extend our stay in Honolulu for few more days on 23 May 2009 so wanted to change to a hotel with lower rate and made our best bid to Waikiki Resort Hotel and guess what, we do not regret. We should have made the change many days ago. The room we've got is smaller but it's enough for all 4 for us. We do not need the view so the room fits us perfectly. We were a bit worry about the noisiness but we mentioned we prefer a quiter room during check-in and we were given a room in L12! Great room, very comfy beds (not too soft/worn and just right for us), bathroom is very clean! We book a room from a local on a local magazine and got an even cheaper rate (than internet price)! Bargin! We will explore more on this hotel and may write more reviews! Only thing is no coffee machine/kettle, but we can live with this.

My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights and were very pleased with this hotel. Pluses were - great price, nice size attractively furnished room, very clean, helpful staff, great location less than a block from the beach and main street with all the shopping and other activities, and free internet in lobby. Really no negatives.

When we got married, I had many of our guest stay at this hotel. The hotels were inexpensive and the rooms were perfect. They seemed to have just been updated with a cute Hawaiian theme. The hotel doesn't have a lot of amenities, so if you plan to be out outside most of the time, this is the hotel for you. You can't beat the location - it's close to central Waikiki.

The front of the hotel was quite impressive, the hotel room was average size, you can tell that it's an older hotel, bathroom was newly renovated. Staff was friendly. We faced South over street and was a bit noisy in the morning, it's a busy city afterall. Excellent Location from beach, zoo, and aquarium. Family friendly. I would stay there again.

My husband & I stayed at Waikiki Resort over the Christmas & New Year. Excellent location. Less than a block from the beach and all the shopping and amenities just around the corner. It is so close to the bus stop, we can get to almost all the attractions by bus. We've stayed on the 8th floor at a corner unit, the room was clean, with a hair dryer, a safe and a refrigerator. The staffs are always friendly and helpful. I love the free internet access at the lobby. Our room has just renovated with a large LCD TV . The garbage truck can be a bit noisy around 5:30a.m., but we got used to it after a day or two. We loved this hotel and will definitely going back there again.

I stayed at the hotel 6 nights and 5 days.Positives: Close to the beach, less than one minute walk. Very close to the main avenue with restaurants and shops. Helpful staff. They have a room in the lobby with about 3 computers with free internet service; most of the time there is a computer available. Sound proof elevators. I stayed on the 12th floor, with a city mountain view, one large king size bed. The room was clean, the bed comfortable. Good size balcony. Negatives:No Continental breakfast. They have a restaurant in the lobby. The issues is that the food is way overpriced. The breakfast meal I think was around $15 for all you can eat buffet. The restaurant of course was mostly empty, given the numerous other restaurants and fast food joints in close proximity with much more reasonable prices. The doors to all rooms, at least on the 12th floor slam when they close. Also the hotel I noticed had sort of connection to Korean Airlines, they would have multiple parties of people staying together. This was an issue for a few night as they had a large party staying in a few rooms next to mine, and when they would enter and leave the rooms the doors would slam very loud. Also there was no workout room. The TV service was terrible. Although I had a flat screen TV, the service was poor quality. There was no movie service available. The local TV programs with Waikiki activities etc. did not work. But this was a minor issue as most people don't go to Waikiki to watch TV. Conclusion: Overall good hotel, the higher the floor you stay on the better it gets. A few issues no continental breakfast, no workout room, weak TV service, and load closing doors.

For a short stay this is an above average choice for the price range. Morning staff is very friendly. The section of Waikiki beach a block away is great for little kids. It's nice to see the beach and aqua blue water from the partial beach view units, but try to get as high up as possible; these units face Koa Ave which is used by the tour buses, trolleys, delivery trucks and garbage trucks to sit and idle until they are off to the next destination. We were on the 8th floor and it's not high enough to escape the sounds of Manhattan.

This hotel was priced accordingly. My husband and I went there for our honeymoon for the first 3 nights before flying to Maui. There is so much to do there that we hardly paid attention to the room we were in. We wanted cheap pricing so we expected the room to be accordingly so no big complaints here. Room was fairly clean and we got upgraded to a junior suite because of our honeymoon.

My family of 4 as well as my father n law stayed at this hotel. Before i left on my trip i read the reviews about the hotel and not all were good. Well the people who left the bad reviews must be used to staying at the ritz carlton. This hotel was fantastic especially for my 2 boys. We had a deluxe ocean view studio. It had a kitchenette, nothing big but had the necessitys like a micro,fridge and even dishes. The room was able to connect to my father n laws room whos room was a bit smaller than ours but was just fine for him since he was alone. The view from the balcony was great the beach was literally right there. The beach was only 1 block away and "hawaii" blocks are small. ABC stores on every corner which made it great to pick up snacks on the way back from the beach. Pacific Beach hotel was across the street, That is where most of the touring companys pick up so that was very convenient for us. Overall the hotel stay was great and if you are traveling with kids and are on a budget this is the place to stay without having to worry about a run down hotel. There was flat screen tvs in our rooms as well. Ask for a corner room facing the beach or else you might get stuck in the middle and have to stare into the hotel across the street. Great hotel will definetly stay there again!!! We didnt even have to rent a car we were in the middle of everything!!!

My husband and I booked a "mini economy room" at this hotel, and it was unbelievably small. I'm from NYC, so I'm used to small hotel rooms, but it was not only extremely small, but it was very very outdated and rundown. We considered switching hotels until we talked to the front desk and we were told that we could upgrade our room to a larger ocean view room for an additional $30 a day. Since we already got a good deal through expedia, we decided to take the upgrade. The larger room was much better, since the beautiful ocean view makes anything better. However, it was still very rundown and in great need of remodeling. The walls and furniture have smudges on them, the wall paper is peeling, the showers are tiny and old, there's no room service or concierge, the beds are old and uncomfortable, and everything looks like it hasn't been updated since the early 90's. All this said, however, it has a very convenient location, right by Waikiki beach, it's in a safe neighborhood, they have their own parking lot, their free shampoos and soaps smell nice, and if you're in to Korean food, they have a great Korean restaurant in the hotel that serves good Korean food for all three meals a day. Also, it is affiliated with Korean Airlines in some way, so if you have Korean Airlines mileage, you may get a discount, and it's very Korean friendly, with the Korean speaking workers and the Korean restaurant. I probably wouldn't stay here again for vacation purposes, but if you want a good deal for a very average room at a hotel by the ocean, and you don't care about any luxury amenities, it's fine.

We just returned from a 10 day stay that was a combination of a business and pleasure trip. This hotel hit a home run in both ways. They were undergoing a renovation to correct past shortcomings and to get more up to date, but there was very little inconvenience other than one of the 3 elevators being worked on while we were there. One renovatation was the addition of a nice large flat screen TV on the wall that added lots of room to the average size rooms. We got an oceanview room that had a partial view of the ocean and the surfers on the beach. It was great to go out on the lanaii to have a morning cup of coffee and to watch the city wake up to another day in Paradise. cities are by their nature busy, but Honolulu is probably the most laid back city I've ever been in, so the crowded Waikiki area isn't as bad as you would think.What made the hotel one of the best I've stayed in was the staff. They were smiling, friendly, and genuinely wanted to be of service and to please. We noticed the heavy Korean influence in the hotel and found out it was Korean owned and had just hired an California based management company. The large numbers of Koreans and the presence of a Korean Airlines office made for a nice experience in a hotel that was full of guests. The staff was so service oriented and anticipated our needs that we almost forgot we were in a nearly full hotel instead of being the only guests in the hotel. We especially liked the 2 restaurants, one an upscale Korean/Asian one and the other a Hawaiian/American style one. the food was top notch and the service was sparkling.The half block distance to the beach and closeness to the middle of Waikiki's shopping and night life make this an excellent choice in a headquarters for a visit to Oahu. All the tour busses stop there and they have an underground parking floor in the basement with an elevator that goes straight up to your room. Also, good deals can be had on rental cars and my advice is to take your GPS system with you or rent one. They are great and take a lot of stress out of driving in an unknown area with long and hard to pronounce names!The Waikiki Resort Hotel made us very happy on our trip and I highly recommend it to others who want a good value hotel near the beach.Tha Laird

Just returned from Waikiki and would definately recommend this hotel. Our room hadn't been renovated yet, but it was still clean and comfortable - we had a deluxe suite, which came with queen bed, double pullout and mini kitchen (sink, microwave and fridge), which fit our family (myself, husband and 11 and 13 year old girls) just fine. Staff were friendly and accommodating and you can't beat the location for the price - a 30 second walk to the beach, close to everything!We lucked out and were given an ocean view room, which really set the tone for our stay - would highly recommend that the ocean view is worth a few extra dollars! Was great to drink morning coffee on the "lanai" and watch the surfers! The pool was also nice and never too busy.

we just got back from waikiki and we stayed at the waikiki resort hotel for 2 1/2 weeks. This is our third time here and it has just been renovated. The room we were in had new carpet, new king size bed, new paint and it was great. It also had a new flat screen tv that was on the wall and freed up the counter space. I love the location of this hotel. It is so close to the beach. The staff is very friendly and always have a smile for us. We will be going back there next year for sure.

Very nice hotel, very well located (2 min walk to the beach). It is highly recommended to book the room with the sea view as it is really worth the money. The view from the balcony is fantastic.The rooms are quite small but cosy and nicely decorated in hawaiian style.

This hotel is great for the price. I was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the other reviews on this site. We booked a package deal with flight through a tour provider, so I don’t know what the rates were. I’m guessing they were about $100 a night for 6 nights in mid-February. We were primarily there for the Police concerts (which ROCKED btw) so the hotel didn’t concern us much. It’s not like we were on our honeymoon, and we don’t typically stay at plush places anyway. As long as the hotel is safe, clean and quiet, we are OK. The Waikiki Resort Hotel was all three. Prior to arriving, I’d emailed the hotel’s customer service department and asked for a room away from the elevator because I ALWAYS end up near the elevator. When we got there, the room they initially assigned to us was on the 9th floor directly across from the elevator. As soon as we got in the room, I called the front desk and explained my earlier request. They moved us to another room right away. They even let me look at it first (with a security guard). In fact, Adam at the front desk was very helpful. We took the second room on the 18th floor. It was Penthouse E. But before you get excited, the penthouse is the same as other rooms. Nothing different. We had two full beds and a fridge. The room was clean, as was the whole hotel. The AC hadn’t been turned on and was locked, so I called Adam again. He said he’d send a maintenance man ASAP. When the maintenance man didn’t arrive after about 25 minutes, I called Adam again and he apologized profusely and the maintenance man was at our door in 5 minutes. Later in our stay, the AC got locked again in the on position (a little too cold) and we called again. A maintenance man was there right away to adjust it. This time, my husband watched how he unlocked the thermostat in case we needed to do it again. The view from the room was the neighborhood and hills behind the hotel. Since we didn’t spend a lot of time in the room that was fine. At night, the view was very cool. The lights from the houses on the hills curved and reminded us of lava flowing down the hills. Very cool.Speed of the elevators is fine.The shower IS tiny. I had to figure out a way to shave my legs w/o getting water on the floor. My husband is very tall and the showerhead height was OK for him. But if you are a heavy person, the shower stall will definitely be too small for you. We left our maid $2 each day and our request for more towels on the first day was filled and we never had to ask again. We didn’t request clean sheets every day (in fact we told the maid to leave them). We don’t change the sheets every day at home, why would I waste laundry water somewhere else? We got lotion, shampoo and soap. The vent in the toilet/shower stall area was filthy inside, but since you don’t spend a lot of time in there, who cares?The good: Price, cleanliness and quiet. This is a small hotel compared to most in Waikiki or Honolulu. It’s really not a RESORT, though that’s in the title. And I was fine with that. Several friends stayed at the Hawaiian Hilton Village (HHV). Wow. That’s a HUGE resort. It kept going and going. Everything was SOOOOO expensive (food, drinks) and it was very, very, very busy. There was always a long line to check in. The HHV has a lot of bars, restaurants and shops, but it was too bustling for my taste. We were OK with the laid back atmosphere at Waikiki Resort Hotel (WRH)Location: less than a block to the beach in front, less than a block to the bus stops on the street behind the hotel. A McDonald’s and Burger King w/in a minute’s walk and Starbucks and Subway w/in a 4 minute walk. There are three ABC stores w/in a 2 minute walk, two in front of the hotel and one behind. The beach is a 60 second walk. It’s pretty busy in that area, but walk a few minutes toward Diamond Head and the park and the beach is less packed. Ritzy shopping is just a few blocks away as are the zoo and aquarium.My husband rented a longboard and the bell hop stored it for $5 a day, which was very convenient. The local surfers were helpful to him too, which he’d heard is not always the case. But surfing was fine.Refrigerator – buy beer and water at ABC, save $$$$$.The staff was pleasant/helpful each time we spoke with them. Ask for the bus map.The bad: The business center didn’t have a printer so I couldn’t print our boarding passes to fly home. That seems stupid. The hotel should get a printer and charge people 5 cents for a sheet of paper if they are worried about waste. The business center was $7/hr. I heard (but did not confirm) that the HHV was $7.50 for 15 minutes!Shower size – already discussedPool – it was nothing to write home about. Very sparse area. If you want a fabulous poolside experience, you need to go to someplace like the HHV (though HHV is very strict about what can go in the pool – no beach balls, no kid floaties, etc.)The room doors were heavy and noisy. Even if you tried to shut them quietly, they banged. This was the only noise we heard from our neighbors except when they talked in the hall. We could not hear them in the next room.Notes: The city bus to the Pearl Harbor/Arizona memorial took an hour to get there and 80 minutes to get back. Cheap and easy, but if you don’t have the time to spare, take a shuttle (not a cab!) The bus was very easy to use but we did find that there were fewer routes on the weekends and evenings so we had to take cabs a few times to get to places on time.Do not try to walk to the Diamond Head visitor’s center. It’s too far combined with the hike to the top (which is totally worth it). Take the bus there.We found a great hole in the wall for breakfast. Leave the hotel and go to the street behind it where the bus stops are. Turn left at the ABC store on the corner. Walk straight until you see a tiny little park (like a triangle) with a statue of a woman and a goose (?) in the middle. There is a restaurant called Hula Girl (not to be confused with the expensive Hula Grill at one of the beach hotels) on the side street on the side of the park closest to Diamond Head and WRH. If the waitress calls you “pretty lady” or “handsome man,” you’re in the right place. The waitress alone is worth the 5 minute walk! The food was very reasonably priced compared to other places.If you like the TV show LOST, take the Lost tour through Big Kahuna tours. Tom is great!We had great weather - yay!!!!

I stayed for two beautiful weeks in the Waikiki Resort hotel in Hawaii and couldn't have been more pleased. It wasn't exactly fancy, but it was clean and had a beautiful view of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. It is located a half block from the beach and within walking distance of tons of shopping and dining. Oh, and the price. I booked through the hotel's website and got a special for $82 a night! Can't beat it, especially in Waikiki where your typical not-fancy hotel goes for at least $200/night. The staff if friendly enough and very helpful. I didn't bother with the restaurant because it was a bit pricey (but the Sunday brunch in the hotel across the street is definitely worth a splurge!) Also, if you stay at this hotel and want are looking for an awesome surfing instructor, walk about 2 blocks west (just before the King's Cross shopping plaza) and talk to Eric. He gave a great lesson, I got up on my third wave (and many subsequent ones!) and he probably stayed out there for an extra hour with me at no extra charge! He really wants you to learn and love surfing! But I digress. Simply, this hotel isn't going to be a super romantic, upscale place but if you're going to Hawaii on a budget, you can't beat it. I will most certainly stay there again if (when) I return to Oahu.

I had stayed here several years ago and found it to be decent so I rebooked for my husband and I for our visit to Honolulu from Jan 12th - Jan 15th. Our room was on the 17th floor facing the mountains and we had a great view. They've made some renovations and our room was again decent but the bath had no tub just a small shower. The room was roomy with 2 full beds and we had cable TV. Around the corner from the elevators so it was pretty quiet except when the neighbors came in at 1 am. They did charge us $15/day for parking which surprised me since the last time I stayed it was only $8/day. There is no free wireless here or anywhere on the island that I'm aware of. You have to pay at least $9/dy for it but I was able to sign up for 3 dys/$13 with one of the wirless providers, just hunt for the discounted rates. The biggest plus about this hotel is it's a block away from the beach so just walk a short distance and you're there. I would definitely stay here again.

This was our first time in Honolulu and we were very disappointed in this hotel. We requested a room on an upper floor away from the elevator and where did we end up? On a middle floor right next to the elevator. They could not change our room for two days. The hotel was undergoing renovations and we were told they would be complete 12/31/07. On 12/27/07 it was tough to tell what,if anything, had been renovated... definately not the rooms. They nickel and dimed us on everything. If you wanted a hair dryer it was $1/day extra. If you wanted an iron, it was $1/day extra. The parking was $15/day extra and there was a problem with the parking ticket and gate everytime we entered or exited. We were finally moved to a different room. There was a slight view of the ocean, but the room itself was still small and out of date. Some of the customer service reps were helpful, others were crabby. The price was reasonable (for Hawaii), but this hotel was not worth the price.

My wife and I are seniors who enjoyed our two-week stay in early December very much -- in spite of some rather severe weather. The resort is part of the Ilikai hotel (which also has sold off some of its suites as apartments). We found the nearby construction noise very loud when we sat outside in our lanai, but very quiet when we were indoors. The elevators' reliability was poor. We had two queen beds with a sofa, table, one chair (and a desk with another) and a usefully equipped kitchen. Good bathroom, no bathtub. We got no extras that some others have mentioned; indeed, it was annoying that we had to buy salt, pepper and coffee filters. Beach was a ten minute walk and the Ala Moana shopping center about the same. Hotel staff and the Shell Vacations Club staff were friendly and accommodating. We found the location perfect: the eastern part of Waikiki beach is too heavy with humanity and hucksters for our liking. The hotel needs re-painting and redecorating, but is fair value for the money.

Loved this hotel.LOCATION: 1/2 block to beach, so you're close, but you save money... not sure if any rooms have ocean views, but it's toward the Diamond Head side of Waikiki. Also a short walk to the park, and to Queen's Surf gay beach. Also just a few minutes to the International marketplace area, Royal Hawaiian, etc... Just the perfect location all around.ROOM: I had an "economy mini room", which was only $62. It had a lanai, refrigerator, private bathroom, cable t.v. It was not big, but ok for one or two people who want to save money. This price can't be beat anywhere in Waikiki. The room was clean, but the bathroom needed some updating/upgrading.The hotel had a coffeeshop/restaurant I think called Ilima... and on Friday, Saturday and sunday nights, they have a great prime rib buffet for only $16, with salad bar, dessert, fruit, etc. It was really good. You won't beat that price anywhere in Waikiki. The hotel is run by Korean Airlines, and has a Korean Airlines checkin desk in the lobby for those passengers, which could be an amazing convenience for some. The staff were all polite and friendly. The air conditioning was great in the room. No ocean view, but an amazing value. I booked directly on their website. I think the regular sized rooms are about twice the price, probably still a good value. The economy rooms are adjacent to the elevators, so you can hear a little elevator noise, but it didn't bother me at all... it's really quite minor. There was a nice sized pool, but the ocean is better.They had all the usual bell staff, even a small spa. It's a one minute walk to the Hyatt, but that's about four or five times the price.

Stayed at the WRH from the 8th to the 14th Sept 2007.Our room was clean and cheap, which is pretty much all we wanted. The hotel is central to everything you want to do whilst in the Waikiki area...they are working on the hotel at the moment, but we wern't inconvenienced in any way - they shut the water off for a few hours the morning we were leaving, that's all.If you're looking to save some money, this should be your choice. Are you going to Hawaii to spend time in a hotel room? If so, choose somewhere else. If you want to be out and about, this place is just fine as a base and a place to sleep.Waikiki itself is VERY busy and commercial, if you're imagining an island paradise, i'd say definitely spend a few days or more on the North Shore - at the Turtle Bay Hilton. There are still plenty of natural activities to do close by to Waikiki, but due to the amount of people around the area, you aren't likely to be alone.

i stayed at this hotel for 11 nights at the end of aug/sept 2007.i initially booked this hotel after reading comments through trip advisor.i expected it to be clean and good location,but i believe this hotel is underated.my room was renovated and was cleaned daily.staff was courteous and very attentive in requests that i had made.unfortunately i was on a lower floor so my view wasn't good.some great restaurants nearby and the cafe on ground floor had great food, good prices.your meal would come out in about 5 mins too.great service. cheeseburger in paradise down the road also not to be missed if you like cheeseburgers.;)

My wife and I have stayed at the Waikiki Resort for 10 days at a time for the last 5 years. The staff has always been professional and friendly. The rooms were always clean and well kept. This hotel is owned by Korean Airlines, so you see their flight crews here a lot. With taxes this room was around $100 a night.A two minute walk to the beach to see a beautiful sunset. For the price you get a big bang for a buck. This place is in the center of every place. The bus stop is around 100 yards away on Kuhio Ave. Our favorite restaurant in Waikiki is Duke's Canoe Club. With what we save at the Waikiki Resort we can have dinner here every day and still spend less than most.Looking forward to being back in February and staying at the Waikiki Resort.

The lobby area of the hotel is nice and welcoming. However, once you get into your room, you notice that there's a bit of wear-and-tear in the furniture and the bathroom. The bedsheets and towels are clean but they are a bit worn out as well. It is clear that the hotel was once glamorous but with the passage of time it has been allowed to slowly decay. I stayed there in June, which is the low season for Hawaii because it is summer in the northern latitudes. The price of the hotel was not cheap but not very expensive either (approx. US$95), which allowed me to spend the money saved on hotel for other things like entertainment, good food, and Aloha shirts. The hotel is in a great location: it's one block away from the beach and there are numerous shops and restaurants nearby. Since I spent most of my time outside and not so much time in the hotel room, I ignored the lack of luxury of the hotel. Overall, I recommend this hotel for a few nights but don't expect much in the way of creature comforts here. By the way, there is no internet connection in the rooms, but there are computers in the lobby area where you can use the internet for US$7/hour.

We arrived early and I thought we were going to have to leave our luggage at the desk till we were able to check in. But we were able to check in early, we were also upgraded to a room with a partial ocean view, plus we could see Diamond Head The room had a microwave oven, sink, Dishes and silverware were also supplied in the room.The room was clean, beds had new mattresses. They cleaned our room almost everyday. If they weren't coming in the next day, they would leave extra towels. The staff were friendly and helpful. Yes the elevators were a bit dirty, and yes there was duct tape around the rugs in the elevator But you aren't going to sleep in the elevators! The place is a bit dated. They were in the process of renovating while we were there. But let me tell you!!! You can't beat the location, 1/2 block from beach, shopping, restaurants, and the bus stops all near by. The Catholic church is only a 1/2 block away. Next trip plan on staying here agian. Our trip was taken April 2007.

Checking in - slow since they only had one person staffed at the front helping people. The person who did check us in was almost brusque in that she really just wanted us all out of her hair. She never smiled once, in fact, no hotel staff ever smiled at us. The room - It is VERY dated, white varnish furniture from the 80's. Everything was clean, but cheap and uncomfortable. The first problem came here - the bedding had holes in it. We called to ask for new bedding and were told that they could not accomodate that. That's all they said, and anything else I said was given a response of "we can not accmodate that" - as if that was all the English she knew. Second problem - the gauge for the AC, or the thing that lets you control how cold it gets in the room did not work. we turned it to one end and did other stuff for half an hour and nothing changed, then we turned it to the other end and left for 2 hrs and nothing changed. We called about that and they said they could get someone to come and fix it in two days. We were only staying another two nights and so just said they can do whatever they want.Third problem - the fridge, the old mini-fridge that they said their rooms would have. well, they had one. it just didn't work. we asked for them to take a look at it and maybe fix it and surprise, they sent someone to look at it. well, the person said that we were right, it didn't work. but they wouldn't be able to put another one into the room for a week or so. On the plus side - they did a thorough job of cleaning the room everyday since we did track in a good deal of sand.The location of this place is GREAT.The parking in the place is really tight.We weren't expecting much, mostly b/c it was so cheap, but what we got was even less. Next time, we will spring a little more to be a lot more comfortable.

My wife and I have just returned home to Australia from a week's stay in Honolulu. We booked our stay through a local travel agent, and I must admit, the only brief I gave the agent was that our accommodation should be central and inexpensive. He came back with the Waikiki Resort Hotel and a price - I duly looked the hotel up on their web site; it looked ok, so I confirmed my ok back to the travel agent.About a week later a friend referred me to this web site, and out of interest I looked up this hotel. After reading some of the less than complimentary reviews I 'll confess to becoming worried about my decision to stay here.However, I'm happy to report that for the most part, our hotel stay was enjoyable and we experienced no problems with our room or the service.If you're considering shelling out your hard-earned on staying here, then what you'll get is a clean, well serviced room, in easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants, bars and public transport.The rooms are of good standard (if a little dated) for what this is (3 star accommodation) - if you are expecting a room that is the standard of the Sheraton et al - then you will be disappointed - its not 5 star, and doesn't advertise itself as such. The hotel caters for all, but is heavily reliant upon Japanese and South Korean tourists, and as such, the restaurants and staff are skewed in their favour. None the less, I found the staff to be courteous and helpful.I note that someone else made a note about the pool - I can confirm that it isn't heated and is extremely cold - I'd suggest you confine your aquatic activities to the beach - the water is warmer there.If you're a first timer to Hawaii like we were, I can recommend day trips to K'uoloa(not sure of the correct spelling) Ranch (Horse riding, quad bikes and 4 wheel drive tours) and the all day snorkelling and whale watching catamaran cruise on the K'Olina (once more, not entirely sure of the spelling) which was great value. The guys operating at the tour info desk next to the car rental desk in the lobby should be able to help you.Good quality affordable dining that I'd recommend (and within easy walking distance) - Lu Lu's Wakiki Surf Club, Dukes, Cheesebugers in Paradise.

We were there for a week. Two couples each with two small children. We booked adjascent rooms and it was as if the other family wasn't there. I never herd their kids they never herd ours.
